text: I've loved this place for a long time. While I usually get delivery or take out, somehow the kitschy decor makes everything taste better. I rotate between the pad thai, pad wen soo, crispy noodle dishes, and peanut chicken. I LOVE their crab rangoon. I'm not sure what it is about it, but I'm also super into their fried tofu.  Plus, the staff is friendly and service is quick!
Best place in the area for pad Thai. Easy to do a pickup order and it will always be on time

My go to place for Thai Take out!  The food always arrives faster than promised and is delivered hot and delicious.  I've ordered a lot and never had a problem with an incorrect order.  I have noticed that some items have a slightly higher price when ordered on GrubHub than if you order directly from the restaurant.  My favorites are the pad see ew, crab rangoon, and various curries.  Whatever your favorite Thai dish is, it's probably going to be good here.  I don't often eat in the restaurant, but it is a nice place.  They have an eclectic mix of things decorating the walls that you won't find at your typical Thai restaurant.

Me and the boyfriend came here for something to eat after a cubs win ! Little did we know people coming from the cubs game get 15% off their bill. We ordered the chicken pad see eiw and the beef pad woonsen. Pad See Eiw is my favorite thai dish and they made it just right ! It was delish. The padwoon sen's beef was dry and there were too many vegetables in it for my taste, but my boyfriend loved it. I did like the noodles though. I usually like to get the pad thai and a thai restaurant, but this one was too red/orange and that is not a sign of good pad thai (in my personal opinion). Overall I would like to come back and try a bunch of other meals dishes. The service was great and the staff is very very attentive to each and every customer. I recommend !

I'm an LA Dodgers fan visiting Chicago and just finished watching the cubs beat the Blue Jays in extras with a walk off! Very cool! We ended up here walking around with the kids after the great game. This place is great. Service is very friendly. The layout of the place and all the cool toys makes it original and fun to be in. Food was great.  Warning: cash only.
One of my favorite Thai places!! I just moved to the area and lucky for me I am soo close to them.  I can't wait to try their lunch special.

Overall, this a great Asian cuisine! I live in Wrigleyville so I eat here quite often. I have never had a problem with service. My go to's are the Pad Thai Noodles, Pad Khee Mao, and any of their curries. All are very flavorful and very filling. Their Crag Rangoon is some of the best I have ever had and their vegetable rolls have an interesting flavor. I also enjoy their smoothies as well.  The only reason that this is a 4 and not a 5 is because this place is cash only. There have been numerous times that I have not come here due to that sole reason. This place is always packed so I'm sure the cash only thing isn't too big of a deal for them and helps them save money. Overall, the price is right and I highly recommend this place as it's the best Asian food in Wrigleyville.
I love this place.  I take all my friends whenever possible.  Its an easy walk from the Red Line.   My go to order there is pad khee mao with crispy noodles and a green tea bubble tea.

Awesome food, great vegetarian options! Super friendly owners (love Tee!). The noodles mixed vegetables with tofu is heaven. Try it! You won't regret it. I get their lunch special (M-F, until 3 pm) and take it to go to eat while I work.

Fun decor, especially for cubs fans! It lives up to its name and is a cozy little restaurant with friendly servers. I enjoyed the food here and consistently order the Panang curry since it is my favorite Thai dish.

We were searching for a place to eat outside of Wrigley and we stumbled upon Cozy. We saw just how many people were in the restaurant and thought that was a very good sign. We were not disappointed! My wife had the Crispy Pad Thai which was a nice twist. When the noodles are deep fried they have this crunchy texture that gives the dish a nice contrast. I had the Pad Kee Mao which was our server's choice. It was a bit spicy but delicious!  It reminded me of the out of way places in Khaosan Road in Bangkok where we would sit, watch the crowds, and enjoy Thai food. Can't wait to go back before a Cubs game!

I rarely come on here to write anything but if you haven't been to Cozy you must go. The owners are wonderful, the décor inside is so cute and "cozy".  Went there last night after leaving Wrigley toward the end of a concert. Kitchen was closed but they went out of their way to make us food because we were starving! I live in the burbs now but plan on heading back to visit the lovely staff and the absolutely amazing food. If you like spice, the spicy fried rice is a must!!

In a word, "meh". Much to my dismay, I recently moved out of the delivery radius for my absolute favorite thai spot, so I decided to give Cozy an audition tonight. I ordered delivery, which arrived faster than quoted, always a plus. I was nervous to try the more authentic dishes at a new spot, so I played it safe with a popular dish- orange chicken (mild spice), and pineapple fried rice with chicken.  The pineapple rice was...fine. There was a smattering of pepper thrown on top, as if the cook realized they forgot to season it right before throwing the lid on. Overall, it was pretty bland, and most of the cashews were burned to a crisp. On the upside, there was a generous portion of white meat chicken in the dish.. no mystery shapes that have you guessing which part of the chicken it came from. My first bite of the orange chicken, however, was the opposite experience. Completely inedible fat and bone, along with that "mystery meat" look about it (shudders). On top of that, I ordered mild spice to balance out the sweetness, and it arrived with some sort of watery orange marmalade sauce that not even a few drops of sriracha could salvage.  Moral of the story: You don't have to try hard if your restaurant has Wrigleyville foot traffic on your side.

Came here for lunch with a party of 4 because we wanted Thai food and it's BYOB. The decors here are lined wall to wall with Cubs gears, bobbleheads, and robots. Very busy in terms of decors.  We ordered our own entrees and shared an order of crab rangoon and the Sriracha spicy fries. The crab rangoon was meh..a bit too doughy for my liking. The fries were hot and fresh and decent. My order of the chicken pad woonsen was okay..nothing amazing. The rest of my party liked their food but again..nothing too special about this place. I would recommend going about 5 minutes down the street to Krung Thep for thai food. Our bill came out to about $60 (before tip) and we tried to pay with a credit card but the waiter asked for cash. We guessed that it was cash only restaurant..which is fine but we did not see any signs. And when I checked out Yelp later..it did say that they do accept credit card. So I am a bit confused about this incident. Overall, I probably won't come back just because I wasn't too impressed with the food. But if you're a big Cubs fan, you should definitely check this place out since it is near Wrigley Stadium and it's decked out in Cubs gears.

Usually restaurants put ALL their ingredients that are in a dish in the menu under the dish, but this place didn't. I ordered the vegetable rolls thinking there would just be vegetables in it, but there was also a fruit in it, which I looked over first so I tried one piece and it tasted funny to me. I tried another trying to figure out what it was because I thought it was a pear, but it wasn't. So I picked it out and made my friend try it and he said it was pineapple. I am ALLERGIC to pineapple. Luckily I didn't eat enough to make my throat close up but I ate enough to give me a very upset stomach. I will probably never come back here again because I will forever have trust issues with what is or is not in their food.

I really enjoyed Cozy Noodles. It is very cozy inside just like their name states. I ordered their Pad Kee Mao (Drunken Noodles) with beef. My usual, and it was very delicious. Plenty of heat, noodles and meat and not heavy on the veggies, makes for a perfect drunken noodle dish.  I usually rate based on if their customer service was great or needs improvement. Cody noodles goes beyond customer service. They treat you like a guest visiting their home. You can tell right off the bat when you walk in, that they are so welcoming with big smiles on their faces. You really can't beat that.  The only thing I would like to add is that Yelp has them as they accept credit cards and I was not prepared to pay cash.  Overall I would with out a doubt return to Cozy Noodles.

Nice casual restaurant that I went to for the first time today, came across it via GroupOn.  Had the Cozy Salmon, steamed salmon with stir-fried vegetables, and both salmon and veggies were really good

Great location near Wrigley with limited parking. There are 5 sidewalk tables shaded in the afternoon. Many vegan options made with fresh ingredients and generous size Tai tea. The staff is friendly and an eclectic collection of memorabilia. I would definitely recommend and will return to try the pad Thai. Cash only.

I order Thai food quite often and given this was the number one on Yelp I thought I'd give it a try. While I ordered delivery I cannot speak for the ambiance.  When the food was delivered it was hot and looked good with decent portion sizes. I got the red curry and fried chicken shumai. The shumai had no taste and was like eating a ball of grease. Since it wasn't the part I particularly wanted and ordered to hit delivery minimum I moved on to the red curry. I ordered with a medium spice and it came with no spice at all. The curry was less than flavorful and the tofu (that I paid more for) was pretty much missing. Definitely will not be back

The ambiance was fun! Check out the bathroom!! BYOB, and I got the crispy pad Thai. HELLO! So awesome and different than what I've ever eaten. My jaw got a little tired from so much crunching but so good!! Really kind servers, I can't wait to go back.

Thai food served at a unique and friendly atmosphere. Crab Rangoon is phenomenal; a must have if you're craving an appetizer. The staff is also extremely friendly and makes you feel welcomed. Big food crush on this place.

This place is really so special and some of the best Thai food I've had since moving to Chicago from NYC. Additional to the great food is the wonderful owner who loves Chicago, the Cubs and his customers. Really is nothing better than an owner who comes out and chats with his customers and makes sure they're happy. He and his wife are so personable and living their American dream. He gave me a card for a free entree at lunch next time I return, and all I did was have a friendly chat with him! Also: the decor in here is fun and cool--especially in the bathroom!

Thai cuisine is my one and only. I could eat it all day, everyday, not a problem. The spicer the better, it's hard to achieve the spice I want, nobody ever believes the white girl really wants the heat! Cozy noodle is a small neighborhood spot tucked away right next to Wrigley Field. It's decor is fun, walls covered in trinkets. This vist we ordered the Pad Kee Mao and an order of Panag curry. Every since In-On Thai closed on Broadway, we have been looking for a thai place that fills our empty void. Cozy noodle is a great subsitute. Their pad kee mao is above average everytime, but their panag seems to flucuate. This time, I thought the curry was a little sweet, still delcious. I wish they had papaya salad, its another favorite, but their seaweed salad is wonderful. We will defiently be back and we love that its BYOB, that always earns an additonal star in my book.
So yummy. My toddler loved the mini egg rolls AND my own entree. Could not love the service more. Will be back soon!!!

The best Crispy Pad See Ew I've ever had. Eclectic decor, incredibly kind service - really, the friendliest service I've ever had. The owner makes sure to stop by and personally greets each table. Right now they are running a promotion where your entire bill is discounted %50 if you come within two hours of a Cubs win. Don't forget to try the Crab Rangoon, perfect blend of crunchy and creamy.

Cash only sux! It's absolutely irritating to not take credit cards. I hate paying fees in order to help a business avoid paying taxes. Boo. The food is pretty good although the orders were all messed up. Our table of 3 had to ask for several things that we ordered but I were not brought when the food came out - side of noodles, side of sauce, crispy noodles with Pad Thai - and we all ordered extra spicy but our dishes were mild. No big deal really. I'm mostly mad about cash only.

Update: I've been living here for years, Tee is one of the best owners in the neighborhood. He genuinely cares about his customers and has a huge passion for food. So much so, his lunch special for Chicken Fried Rice is now $5 FLAT. Before it was around $6 or $7 with cash which is still incredibly cheap, but today I had to spread the news!  $5 lunch with either cucumber salad or baby egg rolls. Same quality, same quantity, he said he was doing it to give back to the customers.  It might be others, but definitely at least the Chicken/Beef Fried Rice Lunch Special. If you want something different and quiet for a date its a great BYOB. If you're a construction worker who didn't bring a lunch, I'd consider checking it out because Tee is the man!

Never tried Thai food until I went to this place. I'm a huge Chinese food fan and was told it was somewhat similar and for the most part that is correct. I was a little overwhelmed with the amount of items on the menu, but decided to play it super safe and get the chicken fried rice. I think it was pretty average; it wasn't really good or nasty but I definitely ate most of it. I also got it spicy which I was told to try. I would suggest that if you're not a big Thai fan or scared to venture.  This is BYOB joint which is a plus. I really like the small and homey vibes this place gives off as well.

The pad woosen is delicious with chicken or shrimp. The pad Thai is okay...definitely not the best I've had. Crab Rangoon is awesome--you can never go wrong. They also have a huge selection of sodas and other drinks. The atmosphere is really relaxed and  cute!

Our first time ordering here-- mixed review but part of it was my own doing!  We ordered beef pad thai, pad kee mao and an appetizer sampler.  Beef pad thai was very good: flavor very good, portion very large, thought that there should be more beef and egg but would order it again.  The Pad Kee Mao I've never had before, and didn't get what I expected.  We ordered online and I'm pretty sure in the online ordering site, it doesn't say that it's spicy because if I saw that I wouldn't have ordered it.  Way too spicy.  I now know it says spicy on the regular paper menu and on the website, but on the actual ordering part of the website it doesn't.  Also the wide "noodles" were deep fried, not pan fried as I had expected. But I think this was my misunderstanding of the dish and wanting to try something new.  The appetizer sampler was great and our 3 year olds loved it and the pad thai, the other was too spicy for them.  The app sampler traveled well the short drive home and were still crispy.  I will definitely order there again and keep trying things.  It's inexpensive, big portions, local, and family owned. The young man who checked me out was very friendly.   Next time I expect to give it a 4 star review.

I order red curry. It's wasn't spicy but fast and nice service. We went on a Monday at 3 so hardly anyone was here so I don't know how fast service usually is. If you like Thai and are in the neighborhood, this place is dank
Pad Khee Mao and crab Rangoon. Eat it! But seriously, this place alway fulfills my late night cravings for Asian food. This is my go to place to order from.

This place is amazing! The pad see ewe with chicken is on point! Great atmosphere if you are dining in and if you are ordering take out its super easy and they always have your food ready when they say it will be. Great service and great food!

I just moved to Chicago and knowing this is a 5 min walk from made it even better. I'll be in to try all of menu items. Absolutely delightful chicken soup on a cold day. The chicken satay is awesome, some of the best peanut sauce I've had

I was looking forward to trying this place out. Thai food is definitely my top 3 favorite types of food and to have a good place by my apartment would have been damaging to my wallet. Lucky for me, this place did not impress at all. I ordered a thai iced tea and the fried pad khee mao and man was I disappointed with both. After receiving my thai iced tea, that set off the night for disappointment. It was definitely not authentic and left a weird aftertaste that I didn't care for at all. For the fried pad khee mao, I wish I had gotten it regular instead of fried.. it's definitely not something pleasant to eat as it was chewy and really salty. I'm the type of person who to-gos everything after a meal but this time, it wasn't even worth it. I'd warn people to stay away from the fried noodles they're so famously known for. Side notes: Double check your jewel osco receipt for BOGO 1/2 off an entree Cash ONLY They have a small parking lot off to the side.

Geez, I was disappointed in the great reviews to find that I can only muster 2 stars. The pros = very friendly and quick cons = the food! The Tom yum soup tastes like watered down beef broth and the pad Thai was just "okay" nothing memorable or that matched the many great reviews. Not quite looking into a second visit there.

Cute looking place, friendly staff, but sadness reigns. Pad Thai was orange and unrecognizable. Free mini egg rolls were bland and not crispy. I don't know what was inside. Spring rolls also bland. Pad Khee mao was pretty good. But $30 for 2 people to have one pretty good dish won't cut it. We won't be back.

I wish I had looked at reviews before ordering from GrubHub. This food was some of the worst I've ever had. My Pad Thai was literally bright orange. Like, goldfish bright orange. And tasted that way. Stay away. Far, far away.

The food here is really good and the atmosphere was really unique. Awesome antiques all over the place! I have had noodles there and a chicken salad. I was trying to be healthy and the Chinese chicken salad was actually very good, might have been the best thing I've gotten there. HIGHLY recommend it.

If you eat here, do dine in only. I ordered grub hub delivery Christmas night and our order was almost inedible. My chicken pad Thai was so dry I could barely eat it. I asked for it spicy and they must of added it right into the dinner itself because my noodles looked orange and tasted even worse. The potstickers didn't taste any better, like they were microwaved. Tasteless. On top of it, no sauces on the side, no utensils or napkins, and I had to throw most of it out. Also, I know bubble tee probably doesn't travel that well, but most of it was melting by the time it got to us.  Sad as this used to be one of my favorite Thai places. 40 bucks down the tube.

I ordered delivery from here a few days ago. The food was awful, including some that tasted 'off.' The potstickers tasted like fake shrimp paste and were cold on arrival. The order did not include utensils. The other reviews here were great so I was excited, but what I got was disgusting. I love Thai and leftovers, and these are going in the trash.

I always love dining at Cozy and am a little surprised it's taken me this long to write a review or check in.  First and foremost BYOB, that earns automatic stars.  While it's a bit on the smaller side and the seating is...ahem intimate, the vibe is unbeatable.  Cool decor, friendly staff, and outstanding thai food.  It's no wonder I've been coming here since 2009.  Cozy is always a winner.  A lot of place come and go, but this place is as dependable as they come.
Great food at great prices and the owners are so friendly. The decor is really fun and interesting. I love the thai bubble tea!

I've eaten a lot of Thai food in Chicago, and the only thing memorable about this place is that the pad thai is orange. Orange! It looked like a bunch of shredded carrots. Despite its strange appearance, I decided to give it a chance. Alas, it was a disappointment. Very little flavor. Kind of surprised by all the 5 star reviews, but maybe the other dishes are better.

Just ordered takeout and this is probably the worst Thai food I've ever eaten. Definitely should have listened to the reviews. Fried rice was AWFUL and the pad Thai was not good either. Do not eat here!

Pardon my French, but this place is fucking amazing. I live right near Wrigley so I can tell you that this is my spot. I promise to be as objective as possible in this review despite my love for Cozy. The Staff: Every single time I've been here I'm always greeted with a smile and taken care of promptly. No matter how busy it is the staff is always extremely friendly and I appreciate that given I know how hectic a dinner rush can be. The Decor: Wow. I can guarantee that you have never stepped foot in any establishment like Cozy.  They have the most amazing collection of Cubs memorabilia I've ever seen and on top of that they have an insane amount of cool toys (which you can actually try and buy!). You could spend your whole visit here just marveling at all the cool collectibles they have. It really is such a warm and COZY spot. (I know I'm lame..) The Food: Incredibly consistent, every time it is spot on. My favorite dish is the basil leaves with chicken and holy shit is it spicy!! I actually had to order it non-spicy the last time I had it to avoid my lips catching on fire lol. But if you crave the heat this dish is for you. The flavors are incredible and the portions are huge. Great value. Pro-tip: Get the strawberry banana smoothie too. It's heaven.   Cozy loves its neighborhood, and we love it back.
One of my favorite spots for a Thai food. Everything is so fresh and delicious.Owner is a great guy very friendly. Definitely recommending this place.

This place was great! It was close to where my boyfriend and I stayed and also close to the theater we were headed to later in the evening for an improv show. Due to the size, we were pretty sure we'd have to wait out in the cold for a table to open up at 7 pm on a Saturday but we only had to wait a few minutes before being seated. My boyfriend ordered the battered and fried chicken wings and the one I tasted was delicious. Like southern-style fried chicken. He loved the sweet and spicy sauce that came with them as well.  I got the pad khee mao with tofu (~$10) which was spicy and delicious. I asked for slightly less spicy than normal and it was still pretty spicy although definitely not too much so. I loved the thick, wide noodles and the proportion of noodles to tofu to veggies was great. I actually could have gone for a bit more veggies but nothing to really complain about.  The only issue I had with this place is that we were literally rubbing elbows with the couple at the next table and found it uncomfortably difficult not to listen in on their conversation. Let's just say it was way too intimate for my tastes. Considering the size of the restaurant and that it was probably the busiest time of the week, close quarters are to be expected.

Cozy has been my favorite Thai food in Chicago for almost 10 years. My husband and I recently moved up to Evanston for the year while he goes to school and we miss it so much! Literally every time we are in the city visiting w/friends we suggest Cozy for dinner. The pad Thai is THE BEST and the crab rangoon cannot be matched. We've been trying Thai around us, but nothing is nearly as good. Cozy, we love you and appreciate you!

Guys, what is happening? You used to have a tasty food, great presentation and excellent prices. Portions went down, prices went up, presentations look sloppy. Chicken wings were awful today, smelled like rotten meat. The ginger dish not good at all. Very, very disappointed. I will not go back.u

Just a block south of Wrigley Field on Sheffield Ave sits this little unassuming store front with crazY giant menu item billboard on the side. Inside the walls are lined with cubs bobble heads, old toys, past product advertisements, and all sorts of odds and ends, trinkets and nic-naks! But most importantly is what comes out of the little unassuming store fronts kitchen... Glass noodle & vegetables, egg noodles & curries, tofu & chicken to name just a little, all mixed up with a whole lotta love and thai spices.... Food orgasm....aaahhhhhhh

So disappointed we ordered the Crispy Pad Thai! Warning TMI... Smelled like wet dog and tasted like rotten fish! I'm not sure why people raved about it online. Saving grace was the Crab Rangoon. Very creamy and good. My son's Orange Chicken was below par. The frozen Orange Chicken from grocery store is better. Cute atmosphere. My son loved all the toys as decorations.

Not sure how is this great for everyone else, service is so slow until you ask for your check then service is so fast, food was not good at all, pad Thai was tasteless with disgusting chicken. Never again

The decorations we're fun and different, especially for a Thai restaurant. Unfortunately though, the food was nothing special. I've had a lot of Thai food, and the food at Cozy's seemed like the Americanized version of every dish we ordered. We ordered the appetizer sampler plate (crab rangoon, shrimp, and mini egg rolls) and they tasted like they took them out of a bag and dumped them in the fryer. The Pad Thai was not very good either.  If you're in Wrigleyville and just looking for a quick bite to eat, you should go to Cozy's. If you're looking for an authentic Thai restaurant, look elsewhere.
This place is a neighborhood gem! I have been eating here since I first moved to Chicago. Great food! The service and hospitality from the staff and the owner is even better.

Good food and very friendly staff. We are spoiled on Thai food in Denver so the food was mediocre for us. We got the sampler appetizer, Tom Tom Soup and Pad Thai. All good and met our expectations. Definitely a good stop since you can BYOB.

My husband and I have gone here 3 times and each time has been consistent. I accidently found this gem on Yelp when I was searching for Lad na, crispy on NYE in 2013. Located right near Wrigley Field, it definitely shows its appreciation for the Cubs. It is so cute inside! It's a small restaurant and had little & big collectibles throughout, even in the bathroom! From Elvis to Mario.  I love their cozy chicken, it comes out in a little basket, so fresh and the breading is perfect. It also comes with a small dipping of sweet & sour sauce. Their crab ragoon is pretty filling, unlike others I have tried that barely had any filling. My husband always gets their lad na. He tells me no one can ever come close to his mom's lad na and Cozy Noodles comes pretty close, that's impressive! The only con he didn't like about it, but didn't mind, was that it comes with regular broccoli instead of Chinese broccoli.  I've tried their pad thai with crispy noodles, this was a first and I was very happy I chose it. I'm used to it eating it with the regular thinner soft noodles. I have also tried their spicy curry panang noodles. It's like a curry broth over the crispy noodles. The broth is super creamy with the right amount of sweetness, saltiness, and spiciness. I love spicy, so I opted for it to be spicier. I was hoping to try their mango over rice dessert on our recent trip, but the server said it's a seasonal thing, so it wasn't available. Anywho, the owners and workers are very nice. They're Thai and I can tell they have regulars come in pretty often. The husband and wife are personable and their service is impeccable. Though I have been here 3 times already, the reason for my review was how the staff made it so memorable for us this past weekend. It was a hectic night due to the Cubs playing and winning that evening to make it to the world series.  The owner Mr. T? had a whole Cubs suit on that you couldn't miss from a mile away! It was a perfect outfit to wear that evening, he was definitely looking like a celebrity as everyone wanted a photo opt with him.  It's BYOB, so we had a couple beers with us and enjoyed watching the game. I mean, it was just the environment they set and everytime a great play came on, Mr. T hyped up the crowd. We even sang, "Take me out to the ballgame!" This place is definitely on our list to come back cuz it has never dissapointed us.

Pros: It was delivered sooner than I expected...and that's about it.  Cons: I got the crab rangoon (which I'm not even sure had crab in it, just loads of cream cheese) and pad thai with shrimp. The shrimp and egg were so overcooked that I picked them out. Definitely a cheap meal if you're looking to only spend a little, but ultimately not worth it. Wouldn't go back.

I love this local spot for it's friendly service and the Pad Thai (it is the type that is orange, and is very tasty).  I have eaten both in and done take out; the take out is always ready within 15 min which is nice.  I do believe they take credit cards, but only if it's over $10.00.

The owner and service are really nice. I love the cubs collection and i donated a bobble head and rally towel to them for display and the owner was very thankful. The food was really good and i really enjoyed my experience here.  I hope to celebrate a cubs world series championship with the Cozys staff very soon
Great food. Great and fun servers. I reccomend the shrimp rolls. They have lots of fun bobbleheads and memorabilia.

About 6 months ago, we arrived in Chicago and were in Wrigleyville visiting my brother. We opened up yelp and this was a top rated place.  We were not disappointed. We arrived for lunch just as they were opening. We basically had the place to ourselves and ordered the lunch specials. We had the Pad Woonsen and Mixed Vegetables. I still think about those clear noodles. They were so good. The owner greeted us and showed us around the restaurant. We told him we were visiting from Orlando, and he was very eager to show us the Disney/Mickey room. He was very passionate about his restaurant and was taking pictures of my boyfriend and I. He even went outside the restaurant to take a picture of us through the windows! He was very nice and energetic. Once the food came, he was still talking to us and while I enjoyed talking with him, this foodie was hungry and wanted to eat her noodles!  I enjoyed the vintage toy theme of the restaurant. This restaurant was definitely memorable and an experience my boyfriend and I still talk about.

Decent Thai.  Pad Thai was bland and didn't have any real taste.  Maybe it's bland for "American" people.  If you've had good Pad Thai anywhere else this will disappoint.  Service was good.  The sautéed dishes seemed to be better made.  This is an ok Thai place close to Wrigley field.  Probably wouldn't go again though.

My wife spotted this spot when we were in an Uber on our way to Wrigley Field. It was a small family owned spot but the flavors in the food were BIG! I ordered the mini egg rolls, seafood salad, and the crispy pad Thai. All of it was very good! The crispy Pad Thai was unique but loaded with flavor. I loved all the Cubs and Chicago memorabilia. They allow you to BYOB. It seems like a spot lots of people stop at to have a bite to eat before the Cubs game since it's right down the street from Wrigley.

The cozy rice soup with chicken is clean and amazing: I added sriracha for heat sooo good. The chicken satay great with the cucumber salad. Oh and I had the lemon ginger tea it was so soothing. BYOB we went down the block and got some beers she was kind enough to give us a bottle opener. The green curry was amazing even their vegetables are great. Can't go wrong when u come here and wait til you check out the decor at this place like nothing you've ever seen! Go and try it and thank me later!

First time here and I ordered takeout. Accidentally ordered the spicy fried rice with chicken and tofu but when I got there they immediately remade it without chicken, no problem! Super tasty veggie rolls too! Very nice staff and will def be back! Excellent experience all around.
This is our go to Thai place and the owners are the best! They normally have a good Groupon available and specials for lunch.
Authentic with nice touch of eclectic knick knacks. Good food and nice choice for gluten free options and of course vegetarian.

What a fun restaurant !   We were lucky to get outside seating for our group of 7, for a birthday celebration.  An end of summer evening with cool weather helped make it wonderful.  Appetizers a plenty, baby egg rolls, shrimp wraps, chicken wings, cucumber salads.  Everyone had different entrees.  Almost everyone were members of the clean plate club!  Doggie bags for the rest.  Being a B.Y.O.B. is a great advantage.  After splitting the Birthday girls portion of the bill.  It was $26 per person, including a healthy tip for our fine waiter, Earth! He was a outstanding server!

Lived near here for 2 years and I never got sick of Cozy. BYOB is awesome, bobble heads are awesome, crab Rangoon is awesome, and the Woon Sen Khee Mao (under Specials) is awesome. Make sure to get a dish with glass noodles, they're delicious. Recently changed their policy on dining in - now cash only. Pick-up and delivery accept credit cards. Perfect pregame dinner for Cubs games.

Food is decent. This is the only joint in town that charges you extra for tofu if you are a vegetarian. If you order any meat item it's covered in the price though. That's BS! Lived in Chicago all my life. Never came across this before. Not cool.

People complaining about their cash only rule are being petty. They have a sign posted up inside, at the door, etc. that says cash only, so why you acting all surprised? Also, there's an ATM right outside. ANYWAY, food was good. I'm very happy with their Lard Na and would recommend it. My pad Thai was also good. Portions were large. I look forward to coming back!

Ever since moving to Chicago in 2005 (and right near Cozy), it's been my favorite quick asian restaurant.  They have really good food which is reasonably priced and never misses the mark.  I like their Pad See Ew and Crazy Noodles.  They have a huge delivery area (we are the cutoff at Foster at our new home).  Really cool inside with toys everywhere - and a statue out front!  It'll always hold a place in my heart.  I'm glad it's always busy - it can get overlooked being in a tiny "cozy" spot down the street from Wrigley.
Talk about amazing food, WOW! If you live or visiting chicago- this place is a must!
Have been coming here for years! This place is the BEST Thai restaurant in chicago! Pad see wee is amazing and I love the crab ragoon!

When my friend and I walked in, the waitress looked at us and asked how many then proceeded by telling us we could sit anywhere we'd like. She didn't follow us and did not come with menus until a couple minutes later. After giving us about 2 minutes to look at the menu she asked if we were ready. We asked her to give us a couple minutes...but after 20 seconds, another waitress came and asked us the same thing. I bring this up because I wish it was more organized.  I ordered the crispy pad thai and my friend ordered the basil leaves dish. My friend enjoyed her dish a lot. I, on the other hand, had a tough time enjoying mine. The noodles aren't really noodles, they're more like soggy over fried tortilla chips lathered in sauce. The chicken wasn't bad.  On top of this, during our meal there was a child who played with this footrest thing under the table (which I still don't understand the meaning of because it moves back and forth) and it kept making a screechy noise and it went on for a good 5 minutes before any of the employees said anything to the child.  Heads up: This is a cash only joint! I probably won't come back unless there's no other place to eat.

Cozy is a favorite takeout spot for lunch when I am working from home. I visit about once a week and almost always get the Chicken Pad Thai lunch special with Baby Egg Rolls or Spring Rolls. My favorite lately has been the Chicken Panang Curry which is spicy, creamy and loaded with crisp red peppers and carrots. Yum! The portions are generous and I always have enough leftover for a 2nd meal. The staff is very friendly and in many years as a faithful customer I have never been disappointed!

If you ever walk in, first thing you should do is see Tee. He's amazing. The food is great. The atmosphere is wonderful. Just a great place, with a leader who honesty loves his food, and loves feeding people.

Super surprised at the price and the food. The quality and flavor of the food is stupendous. If I lived in Chicago this would be a weekly stop for me. I would highly recommend the basil jalapeño chicken.

Wow I've never experienced such treatment. The owner watched us like a hawk and told our friends we weren't allowed to sit on the outside patio. Waiting around your only black customers to see if they leave when you told them they can't stay? And the food is basic standard Asian if you have no taste buds, would not recommend. Try the other 50 Asian resturants down the steet.

The food was mediocre but the problem I had with this restaurant was the treatment my friends recieved. After I purchased my 16 dollar meal to go, my friend and I recieved rude remarks from the owner about us sitting outside the restaurant as we waited for our other friends to arrive. Not the way I would expect any establishment to treat there customers.  Will not return,very rude, and overall my experience was bad. P.S. Dine in is cash only but carry out they'll take credit card? It makes no sense what so ever.

I live down the street from here and I order here probably once a month.  It's a great neighborhood spot, it's full of really cool knick knacks and memorabilia and the staff is always super nice. I always get the green tea latte smoothie with boba (super good), and usually order the basil leaves with beef.  It is on the extra spicy side so I side with medium not hot.  My boyfriend usually opts for the rama chicken. I'm not a fan of the "crispy" noodles though, but I won't deduct a star for that... a lot of people like them, they're just not for me though.
Loved this place. A true unique Cicago Classic on my list of 1000 place to see/eat before you die.  Eat here ASAP.

Loved the Green Tea Smoothie! Food was great. They staff was suer friendly and willing to make suggestions. Loved the kitschy atmosphere.  I'm not bothered by the "cash only" thing, especially since their prices are very reasonable. I'm sure it helps cut costs for them, and in turn, they obviously keep their prices low. Worth the trip.

Some people search their whole lives to answer, "What would be your last meal on earth?" I have the answer, and it's the Noodles Panang from Cozy Noodle.  The crispy noodles take you through a journey from perfectly crispy to melt-in-your-mouth. I've never had another Thai dish like it, and probably never will.  Every time I come back to visit Chicago, I can be found at Cozy Noodle at least twice. P.S. Cash only & BYOB :D

Lunch at Cozy's was amazing. We sat outside on a beautiful day and were waited on by the owner, T Cozy. Mr. T made the lunch the best one I've had in Chicago. He not only welcomed us with lots of happiness but also talked with us about the Cubs and Chicago life while also giving us 3 free appetizers. This man runs a quality restaurant - great pad Thai and curry - with a lot of hard work, love and enthusiasm. Anyone and everyone in wrigley should check Cozy's out. And bring some drinks because it is BYOB. You won't regret it!
The crispy Pad Thai and crab rangoon at Cozy's is the reason I'm fat. That and beer. Which you can bring to Cozy.

I'm definitely a fan of Cozy Noodle. Not only is it BYOB (which is amazing) but it's very reasonably priced. Is it the best Thai food I've ever had? No. But for the price the food is definitely worth it. I'm a big fan of their chicken pad thai and it's what I order every time I come in. We also usually order the vegetable egg rolls to share which are pretty good. My biggest issue with this place is that it's cash only. They have an ATM on site which helps make it a little more convenient, but they accept credit cards for delivery and take out which makes it annoying. Also, for a BYOB place they don't have wine glasses. If you bring a bottle of wine you will get small juice glasses. Not a big deal, but it always makes me laugh.

I really liked Cozy Noodles and Rice!  It's super cheap, (BYOB) the food is delicious!  (Cashew Chicken) and the décor is well, very packed but cool.  The women's restroom is filled with like a thousand pez dispensers which is cooler than some places even if it is a tad weird, and there is cubbies stuff and little bobble heads ALL OVER THE RESTAURANT!  it's super close to the stadium as well, and it's just plain hard not to have a good time while you are hear, Our waitress was kind and informative and helpful, and boxed up what I couldn't finish.  I'd go here again!

Many places have great food, but few have great people behind that food. Tee and family are generous and make you feel very welcome. Pad Thai with a little spice and other noodle bowls are fantastic. Stop by Cozy's and feel the love!

Stopped here for a Pre-game meal on a Friday.  Excellent atmosphere, value, and people!  The Pad Khee Mao was unique and delicious with its crispy noodles.  The owner and staff couldn't have been nicer.  Highly recommended for a casual meal.

Started out poorly when trying to establish an account online to order delivery.  Had to redo the address 3 times so that the apartment no. would show up on the delivery address.  (Hint:  only the first 20 or so characters of "Address Line 1" will show for the delivery address.)   We ordered the crab rangoon and mini egg rolls appetizer.  Really unexceptional.  I'm assuming that they were from frozen.  The entrees were good.  I had the basil chicken and the wife enjoyed the dumpling noodles.   Would order here again, but only entrees- no appetizers!

Perfect after a Cubs win! The food was good, environment kitschy and fun, and the staff was friendly. I can't put my finger on why, but it just hit the spot after the game. If I lived nearby, this would be my go-to for inexpensive Thai food. My only complaint: cash only.

For the price, this place is great. The food was delicious, the service was great, the food was relatively cheap, and the atmosphere was really fun. Make sure to bring your own booze because it's BYOB! My boyfriend and I can't wait to go back.

Meh. Cozy is kitschy cute, and I can see it being a good option if you're in Wrigleyville and in a crunch and/or have a coupon on top of the already pretty inexpensive prices, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. Some random tidbits: CASH ONLY -- This is annoying. There is an atm inside the restaurant and a PNC atm right outside, but if you bank elsewhere and try to avoid atm fees, it's inconvenient. THE SPACE -- Like I said, cute/kitschy. Walls are lined with baseball bobbleheads and other curios. The restaurant is tiny and can get crowded; you might be able to hear other tables' conversations better than your own. WAIT TIME -- On a Saturday night around 7:30, about fifteen minutes for a table of five. FOOD -- It's all edible, but not great. I liked the crab rangoon and Thai iced tea. The edamame was flavorless, not even lightly salted. Skip it and get a frozen bag at Jewel to microwave. Trust me, it'll taste better. The pad thai was mediocre and so, so, so orange, almost as orange as my Thai iced tea. I got chicken and tofu, and there ended up being a ton of kinda-tough-to-chew tofu and about three tiny pieces of chicken. Whatever, I still ate it all. A friend's crispy pad see ew noodles were way overly crispy, veering into might-slice-your-mouth territory. I mean, by the time I'd finished my food and was satisfactorily full, I'd gotten over my annoyance at the cash-only situation and bewilderment at the color of my pad thai. But still, probably won't ever come back.

Honestly, I have no idea how this place even has 4 stars. I eat a LOT of Thai food and I can honestly say it's the worst I have had in the city. I left there so disappointed and wondering if it was just another Wrigley restaurant that can get away with subpar food because of its location. Sadly this might be the case.  We had a Tom Kar and a Tom Yum soup to start. Tom Yum-  canned mushrooms and overall was just alright. Tom Kar was overwhelmingly coconuty, not your typical broth, the ends of the peas were yellow and mushy, broccoli heads were yellow...  Not the authentic and quality Thai food I am used to a getting in Chicago.  Edamame was just microwaved, did not have enough salt, was just bland. Not even hot enough to serve.  Vegetable spring rolls were very bland. Usually the sauce makes this appetizer great but ugh, it did nothing for me.  Pad Thai - Now I have high standards for pad Thai and if I try a new restaurant, this is typically what I order. It offered very little flavor, the same mushy beans, and greens that also seemed unfresh and a pile of peanuts on the side. I added Siracha just so it was palatable but needless to say, we did not finish anything we ordered.... And I really hate wasting food! Oh and the water tasted really gross like the ice was dirty or something.  In sum, although the feel might be cool and has a Wrigley theme, I will never come back here. I will stick to my faves, Noodles in the Pot and Aroy! Only giving two stars because the service was good.
Minimum $10 credit card charge so I couldn't get my order. Pretty sure that's illegal. They definitely lost a customer

This place DOES NOT accept cards (for dine in). They have an ATM in the resturant, so instead of Cozy paying $1 in credit card fees, they instead charge customers $5 with the ATM fees. Used to come here all the time for the food, but never again. Get with the times, no one carries cash anymore.

After a cubs game, we were looking for some grub. Something that was not ballpark, or bar food. I came across this place on yelp, its about 2 blocks from Wrigley Field and 800+ reviews, it was a done deal. Pretty small place but it has alot of charm. Its CASH ONLY. The Crab Ragoon was amazing, skip the wings. The crispy Pad thai is hit or miss. I thought it was a textural masterpiece, but my buddy was not feeling it. My favorite was the Panang Curry noodles with chicken, its savory, spicy, and got some crispy noodles in there. With your ticket, you will get %15 off. Although I think next time I will go before a game not after. Because it is BYOB, its a nice lowkey spot to have a few brews  and grub, for a cheap tasty pregame!!
The fried pad thai is amazing. Cute little place to go with your friends.

Had this recommendation from a friend who claimed some of the crazy cheapest deals in Wrigleyville, and having a free week I had to try it out. Cozy might not be the word I would use, but I'll allow it; when you walk in you probably won't know where to start looking. Either the left wall with all the robots, the right wall with tons of baseball paraphernalia, or for the adventure the restrooms(the ladies one I have been told has walls of jpez dispensers). It's like Toys R Us mixed with my childhood basement mixed with some Thai Food. Tried out that $1.99 Lunch Special Soup, their $5.99 Lunch Special Pad Thai w/mini Egg Rolls, and had a tasting of my friends Chicken Rama and Pad Khee Mao. Was a little bit let down by the Pad Thai, as the tamarind flavor and sweetness was a bit overwhelming. The Pad Khee Mao, from what I tasted, was actually pretty well balanced though I would have preferred a bit more spice.  Verdict: 3/5 for flavor, but 5/5 for value and quirkiness. Not the greatest or most authentic Thai Food I've ever heard, but for their cheap lunch specials and awesome décor, I wouldn't mind coming back.

This is seriously my #1 favorite thai restaurant.  I've been going for YEARS and they have still managed to keep their dishes at reasonable prices and delicious as ever! Literally every single dish is amazing!! Not to mention their decor is by far the neatest thing ever. If you want to enjoy a really laid back atmosphere while staring at the coolest vintage toys while eating GREAT thai food, this is the spot.

For me, it doesn't get much better than Cozy!  I love the noodles, the ambiance, etc.  I've always loved their crab rangoon, thai coffee, and noodles.  I can't speak for curry or other menu items but it's typically my go-to.  I've ordered delivery a lot lately from them and have learned to allot about an hour for my delivery (approx 1 mi away) which is quite a bit longer than I'd like but I'm not sure it would necessarily deter me from ordering.  I'm also not a huge fan of their recent changes to $1 upcharge for tofu (sorry that I don't eat meat...) and cash only policy (though I do appreciate that they have ATM in house).  I also love that Cozy is BYOB and will even provide glasses should you need those.  Overall, definitely a favorite and a place that I will continue to frequent.

This place is great :) BYOB with a great atmosphere! Super eclectic decorations with lots of local and vintage sports trinkets. The food is delicious! I normally get the crab rangoons, crispy pad see ew or regular pad see ew. If you're eating with someone else, I'd suggest getting a crispy and regular and mixing them together because sometimes the crispy is extra salty and you just can't eat that many fried noodles.  All in all, great little local spot with cool food and a cool vibe.
It's nice to come to a place where you are appreciated. Love the atmosphere T and wife are always spot on crab Rangoon amazing crazy noodles are my favorite never had a bad meal.

I moved to San Francisco after 5 years in Chicago, and I think about the panang curry from Cozy Noodle every single day. My heart hurts for it. I want to die in a pool of it. I would do anything for it. ANYTHING. PLEASE. My only suggestion is to please deliver cross country. :(
Food is pretty good but Pad thai i had was not the best. Also its cash only so i hate that. Also its byob which is a big plus.

let me preface this review by saying i've eaten from cozy noodles & rice several times and typically my experiences have been better than this last one...however, last night i ordered delivery. i called at 6:37, they said it would be an hour. 8:07 my food was delivered and it was all so cold i had to reheat it - not particularly convenient when the whole point of ordering delivery was to not have to cook. plus i don't have a microwave, so reheating isn't just a thirty-second ordeal. i had ordered a smoothie, and that was melted and super sugary-sweet. the mini egg rolls tasted like nothing but a fried shell and seemed strangely bready. overall, the experience basically ruined this place for me. it's not super expensive, but it was certainly not worth the money spent. maybe dine-in? i wouldn't order delivery from here...

I have been here 3 times and every time was amazing.  This is my second favorite Thai restaurant that I have ever been to (after from Room Service in NYC).  The prices are very fair and the food is good!

Love, love, love Cozy!! We order takeout from here several times a month, and often dine in as well. Their Crispy Pad Khee Mao is my absolute favorite, w/just the right amount of heat on it. The Wonton Soup is heavenly, and the best cure for the common cold! The special for free Crab Rangoon w/a purchase of $20 or more gets us every time - they're always perfectly crispy since they deliver them without closing the box top.

So typically I wouldn't review a delivery order, but this was a pretty annoying experience.  I ordered the Curry Rice from Yelp's Eat24 app.  The description on the app lists is as: "Curry Fried Rice (spicy) Stir-fried rice with curry powder, egg, white onions, green peas" When I get the order, there are massive chunks of chicken in the rice.  I don't eat poultry.  So I called Cozy Noodles hoping to get a refund, and the woman who answered basically told me that 1)Eat24 had the ingredients wrong on their app and needed to fix it, and 2)I should've just called in my order if I wanted it to be correct.  Oh. Ok.   So I go onto Cozy Noodles website, and what do I see?  Curry Rice listed as follows: "Curry Fried Rice (spicy) Stir-fried rice with curry powder, egg, white onions, green peas 8.75" No chicken in sight.   Morals of the story: 1) Vegetarians don't like it when you surprise them with meat in their food.  2) Update your effing menu Cozy Noodles.   But shoutout to Eat24 for refunding me my money.  I shouldn't be eating carbs this late anyway.
There's only one reason to order from these folks - the chicken wing appetizer called "Cozy Wings." They are delicious.  Everything else we've ordered was sub-par - tasteless and poorly prepared.

Seemed a little over priced for such small portions.  I don't remember that experience when dining in.  Kinda disappointing.  This used to be my favorite thai place in Chicago.  The beef salad I had was delicious  just really, really small.
since jitlada is gone we tried this one but really not worth it

Warning: CASH only for dine-in!! Worth walk in the cold! Great vibe, great food. The service can be slow at times even when it is not busy so that's why it lost a star. However, the employees are friendly. I've tried many dishes and have been very impressed with most.  Crab ragoon is delicious :)

I appreciate Cozy for its "divey" feel, the thousands of entertaining collectors' items scattered about, and its individuality as a small chain, but some things on the menu are just hit or miss. I came here with a group of friends for lunch last weekend and I would have traded my meal for any of theirs. I ordered the Sesame Chicken Salad and it was nothing special. It tasted like someone had taken pre-cut chicken strips, heated them up, placed them atop some bagged lettuce, and drizzled generic sesame salad dressing all over it. I was expecting something better for $8.  ANYWAYS, my friends got Curry, Chicken Fried Rice, and Pad See Ewe which all looked, smelled, and tasted 10 times better than my salad. The noodles and curry are Cozy's strong point, and anything else on the menu will not compare to them. They had excellent Crab Rangoon appetizer w/dipping sauce, and even stuck in a cute little umbrella, which made me feel for a second like my current situation wasn't Chicago in the middle of February. My friends and I agreed that their Thai Teas were also very good.  I wish I could have a do-over here, but now I know what not to order at Cozy. Be forewarned: at a table over, there was some confusion over the fine print of a Groupon--I have come here with one before, and there are so many random stipulations, so before you order/go, look at the time/day of the week/any special requirements listed!
Best Chinese / Thai / noodles : takeout food I've ever had the pleasure of eating. Crab Rangoon's, Edamame, fried rice and the crispy pad Thai. Bi weekly to my door.

Very disappointed ! Had bad experience! Was attracted to the place because of its decoration and my expectations were accordingly. The food was ok.. but the worst thing came at the end: Cash only ?? Really?? So you saved 1.24$ credit card fees, but lost 4 potential customers and rewarded 1 star on yelp! Congratulations! Are we in the 18th century that you decided not to accept credit cards ? Or maybe you're trying to declare less income so you'll pay less taxes ? The manager said that there is a sign on the door. I'm coming to the restaurant to eat, not to read signs ! You must inform every single customer about it in person and not to expect from him to read signs.  Never coming back here and will never recommend
I thought it was average at best.  I tried their special Pad Thai.  It was okay, but no means great.  I will give the place another try and go with a different dish.

The most decorative, pop culture vibe I've seen in Wrigleyville! I'm always greeted with the warmest smile, the most upbeat employees who always make me laugh.  The food is just wonderful. I've had their crispy pad Thai, pad see ewe, fried rice and Thai iced tea.. ALL DIVINE.  I've recommended this place to so many people and I have yet to bring a couple of my friends here in the near future!  I will miss this place dearly when I move in the summer :(  Go, go, go!!

Holy Heck! Best dish I have had in a long time! I wandered in here yesterday and ordered the crispy Panang Chicken noodle dish and the watermelon raspberry smoothie. FANTASTIC! The small restaurant is super clean, adorable with eclectic décor. Sports memorabilia, license plates and very cool tables. Owner is super cool! Cant wait to go back. what a great find!!!!1

I'm upset I don't live in Lakeview anymore simply because of Cozy Noodle's deliciousness. Amazing Thai food, best I've ever had, as a matter of fact, and very reasonably priced. During lunch they have a great special which includes a spring roll, as well as your choice of soup or a cucumber salad, and choice of entree. Try the Pad Thai or the Pad Kee Mao, both are so good I have trouble deciding which to get when I'm there. You might think Pad Thai is just Pad Thai, but there's is the best! Also, it's a BYOB (awesome), has a great little sidewalk patio in the summer, and finally, and perhaps most importantly, if your trying to teach someone the definition of "kitsch," take them here. It's how my boyfriend learned.

I love Cozy Noodle!! It is my go-to neighborhood Thai place. My typical order is the Crab Rangoon to start, which is so delicious, & then I get the Pad Khee Mao with half normal noodles and half crispy noodles, it's got just the right amount of a spicy kick to it. I love that this place is BYOB and ultimately what wins me over is the decor. The rooms are lined with collectible trinkets, it gives the place so much character and you never get bored looking around at all the cool items along the walls. I have always had great service here, whether its for carry out or for eating in.

I placed an order of Pad Thai and Crazy Noodles for delivery, which I will never do again. The  food arrived luke warm, dry, and almost flavorless.  I requested medium spice, there was not any spice.  Both dishes were mostly noodles with very little of the ingredients that sold the dish, chicken, egg, carrot, bean sprouts and zucchini etc. Very disappointing for the price.

I came in tonight with a friend and noticed you are now cash only.  I wasn't happy when I had to pay out of my wallet than use a credit card.  I wont be back.  You accept credit when I order delivery but not at the restaurant.  Its not consistent.  Sorry, this ruined my experience.

It's behind the pizza place. Because of its location, it welcomes Cubs fans. The interior is also decorated with fans stuff. It's got a cool old look to it. Great friendly service. They also have a healthy meal which is great.  Now about the food I ordered. If you are looking for authentic Thai, this is probably not the best place. The tom yum soup is on the sweet side. The chicken in it does not belong there. I had the crisp pad thai instead of regular pad thai, as it is recommended on the menu. It is really crispy! And sweet. If you like that for a whole meal then great! Tastes great but I should have had the regular pad thai. I just realized. I ordered vegetable yum tom not chicken, so they actually got my order wrong. It's good that they cancelled it.  Despite all this, my impression of the place is not bad. Good vibe, good place to sit with some friends.

Quick service, cozy atmosphere and yummy shrimp wraps. I ordered the shrimp fried rice with a spicy sauce and couldn't eat it. Not only was it flaming hot spicy but it was overloaded with cumin. The shrimp were huge but they felt a bit under cooked. I'll probably never return, I also didn't see anything else on menu that appeared appetizing.

I had never been to this place, and my wife dragged me in here despite me not wanting to go. That said, it shortly became one of my favorite places in the city. The restaurant is just what it says it is: Cozy. A great first-date spot or place to meet up with a friend or two.  We have been back several times since with people visiting from out of town, and all have had positive reviews. The food is also much above average, and worth your visit.
Ugh they recently switched to cash-only for dining in.   It is 2016, poor move.  Plus, they still accept cards for delivery....which makes this move strange and very disappointing.

Been coming here for 8 years and very annoyed that they switched to cash only. Always makes closing out a tab with friends overly complicated to the point that we are just going to start going other places. Please change back!
Try the Singapore noodles when you go! The atmosphere is super kitschy and touristy. Makes a great spot for friends or dates.

Another update several years after my original update. Still a favorite place. We've since moved away from the area and made the trek into the city to visit Cozy. The husband and wife that run this place are super friendly. The food is still excellent and we'll be making the trip here on a regular basis.
I have ordered food for delivery twice from this place and have been disappointed both times.  I do not recommend.

I love Thai! It's one of my favorite cuisines.  The first time I went to Thai here, I ordered the pad Thai, and fried tofu. You do get bang for your buck!  However the second time I went, I found out that they do use fish sauce for their Pad Thai. They couldn't replace it with a vegetable oil/sauce. I am a vegetarian, and I was a little frustrated that no one gave me a heads up, and I even asked. Sadly I had to knock down the 5 stars to 3.  So if you're vegetarian/vegan or have an allergy to seafood, do not get the Pad Thai. Also an FYI, this place is cash only.
Very disappointing... The food was average and the delivery took 1 hour and 20 minutes. The vegetable rolls were okay but the mild curry was tasteless.  Won't be ordering again.

This place is terrible. I had crab ragoon, red curry, panang curry, and a kids meal. Crab ragoon and kids meal were both soggy. Curries were both watery and tasteless. (SERIOUSLY SO DISSATISFYING)  Food took forever to get here.  It's really not that cheap... Never would spend another cent on this place. Message me if you'd like better recommendations. I have 3 in mind.
Nothing more needs to be said. The food is delicious! The Noodles Panang is my go to dish and never disappoints. Perfect for hang overs.
1) This place does NOT accept credit cards.  Yelp, please update the business information.  It is MISLEADING. 2) Regular pad kee mao is better than crispy noodle pad kee mao.
Good food and ambience but they charge 18% gratuity regardless of number of people. I don't appreciate the automatic deduction..

I found my new Asian food joint. Hooray! I ordered online via Yelp (since they're cash only when you dine in) and it was ready for pickup in a jiffy. A jiffy! My boyfriend got the broccoli with chicken and I got the garlic chicken noodles, and we shared the crab rangoons. It was all delicious. The rangoons were AMAZING. The garlic chicken noodles were flavorful and filling - I could only eat half which means LEFTOVERSSSSS. Who doesn't love leftovers?! Especially Chinese/Thai leftovers! Hot damn! The atmosphere at this place looks so adorable - we're gonna go back and eat in next time. 10/10. Will eat again. Yum! Love! Yay!
My go-to ---- my FAV!  I really can't get enough of this charming restaurant.  I'm happy with it every single time.  The only change I'm not happy about is the cash only policy, but that's it!  :0)

A group of seven of us met, after making a reservation for 6:15, all at roughly that time - some early, on Friday the 13th, 11-13-15, to be exact. The early arrivals sat chatting and drinking - as the only other table in the restaurant, until we were a complete party. At that point, we started to order a few appetizers. The restaurant now had a few other tables. We then ordered our entrees. As we were eating those, a couple or two began arriving and were waiting for tables. This was perhaps 7:15 to 7:30. The staff began to collect our plates, we asked for, and promptly received, the check. One of our group said "Wait a minute. Would anyone like dessert? (It was a birthday.) We declined, collected funds for the check, and began to pack up. The table was being cleared as we stood at it and the door was opened to usher us out. A young lady was actually pushed .out .the .door.  I selected Cozy because the atmosphere looked fun on line and because the Pad See Ewe was touted as the best in Chicago. Indeed, that was NOT the case!  All the food was mediocre. They was a red curry and a green curry. They were indistinguishable, but not bad. There was a shrimp bowl that was also not bad. The Pad Thai was served with a strange orange-colored condiment on top. The dish was sub-average. There was another dish, which was unremarkable. Service was good. Atmosphere was indeed fun. Would we be back? Probably not.

Cozys is my all time favorite place ever. There is no other place that I have ever loved the staff, atmosphere, environment, and of course the food all at the same time. The food is absolutly delicious and it is so fresh and taste homemade. I have yet to try anything on their menu that im not a fan of. But it is not just the food that is amazing, the staff is wonderful. Tee and his wife Julie make you feel welcomed and important, and thankful that you came in to eat. The decor is out of this world, it is such a fun laid back place with a kid like vibe, it just makes you want to keep coming back. I absolutly love this place, and highly recommend it to anyone. Also it's BYOB which puts the cherry ontop. Cozys rocks!!!!

This place was interesting to say the least. And not interesting like those friends of your friends that you don't like so you call interesting. This place is a good interesting but a lot of things on the menu are thugs that I would only care to have once.  For example they have crispy pad Thai. Most people would think this means some crispy chips on top of the pad Thai. But it's actually weirdly soggy yet crispy noodles that seem like the tortilla chips you get from Costco with great sauce on them and chicken. Like j said tastes great but I would say I only need it once.  That being said they have some classics on the menu that are great always like the pad see ewe or however one spells that. They also have some great mini egg rolls and crab rangoons.  The establishment is a little strange but in a fun eclectic way. The service was meh I think we have 3 different servers so we never knew who to ask questions to but it was definitely more of a positive experience than a negative one.

I thought the food was terrible. The crispy pad Thai was not at all good. The sauce tasted like something out of a jar. The Tom Kha soup was basically coconut milk with mushrooms. It was super thick and had no flavor---clearly no galanga root or kefir lime leaves used in the broth. I'm also feeling sick after eating it. Don't recommend it.

Awesome place for a great meal.  Randomly chose it with my girlfriend as we are new to the area.  I had the Noodles Panang and she had the Crispy Pad Thai.  Both were excellent.  Service was great and the prices are hard to beat for how good it was.  Very happy we found it.  Excited to go again!
Personal service Whit a smile! Excelente food!     The decoration on the walls It s amazing

I have come here a few times in the past three years and always had a great experience.. till today. As of August 1st you must pay with cash if you are dining in. Yes, there are signs but best of luck seeing them with all the other clutter on the walls. I walked .6 miles to my bank to avoid bank fees. Very bummed about that since it is 2015 you really should accept credit cards! Also, my food was not timed out at all! I no longer got my appetizer and my dinner was right there too. I recommend if you plan to try this place, go with cash and expect to be in and out.

Red Chicken Curry - a bit watery and not much chicken in it 3/5 Spring Rolls - almost no vegetables, dry, not tasty at all 1/5 Chicken Skewers - not fresh 2/5 Pad Thai - like from the microwave, chicken meat did not smell and taste fresh 1/5 Good for ordering Vegetable curry with rice, but not beyond that. Save on sides and starters..

I was really excited to try this place based on the reviews. Ordered online: crab Rangoon, crunchy pad Thai, and spicy basil. Let me start by saying the delivery took over an hour and a half. We called 3 times and the customer service was below average. The food finally came. The crunchy noodles were now soggy. The crab had WAY too much cream cheese. The highlight would be the spicy basil. I would be tempted to go back because other people have had such great experiences but tonight was not their night.
Had the seafood Lard Na, it's freaken amazing. The wait was a little long but I came on a Friday night. Will definitely come back to try more from the menu.

This location has NOTHING on the Evanston one!The baby egg rolls (which are my favorite appetizer) are not the same! Theses ones are made with some eggy looking product & noodles inside. Flavor totally lacking! The Evanston location makes theirs with ground pork & mushrooms. The Pad Thai was lacking color & flavor! I will not return to this location. &&&& the prices are increased!
Maybe it was a busy day but wasn't a big fan of the of Thai. The noodle were a bit over cooked and the goyza were too over fried.

I can't say this is the absolute best I've ever had but it may have just been my meal because my husband enjoyed his and the crab Rangoon was amazing! Maybe some of the best we've had! My meal was not awful, don't get me wrong, I ate it all! It just wasn't extremely flavorful. (Some may prefer it that way!)  We ordered carry out so I can't speak to the service but the staff was so friendly when I went in to pick it up! The place busy, it's small but it was full on a Sunday evening! Cute little fun place!

This place was not what was expected. Food was fine but service and scene was awful. They are now a cash-only dine-in service and only have a small sign notifying patrons that they have now made this recent change. This sign gets lost in the cramped clutter of the restaurant so nobody can see it and then they offer you their atm that has a large charge fee associated with it. None of the other patrons realized it was cash-only either and were in the same dilemma as us.  They have a credit card machine, however they refuse to use it even as a courtesy for people who don't know about this "new policy." The machine is only for take out orders.  We felt taken advantage of and had to pay extra money to cover our meal. Definitely not coming here again after being treated so poorly.  Rethink about coming here and bring cash.

What a cool place to eat. As someone on a budget for the time being I was happy to see online that their menu had a 2.00 chicken soup special. I gladly ordered that before taking in the sights with some of my buddies. The aesthetic in this resturaunt is incredible. As someone who is not incredibly into sports, I still really enjoyed the Chicago themed decor in Cozy. From the Blackhawks table we enjoyed our meal at to the cubs merchandise that covered the walls from floor to ceiling, this place knows how to stand out. My chicken soup was outstanding. Everything was cooked to perfection, and I definetly felt I got my money's worth. My friends enjoyed their meals as well. The rest of the menu seems delicious and I really want to go back and try some of the other Thai food here. The service was perfectly fine and we had no issues besides the fact that we were informed we have to pay in cash AFTER our meal was complete. It was not too big a deal as there is an ATM right down the road, but it would be nice if Cozy made this more clear ahead of time. Wonderful Thai restaurant with great bang for your buck. Check it out! Just make sure you grab cash first.

After coming here for a busy, weekday dinner, I will not be coming back. This place seemed like it catered to large groups the most, because my bf and I had to wait for a table when we first got in (although there were a bunch of empty tables put together). The large groups were also served the quickest and got most of the attention from the waitresses. We were in and out of the restaurant in two hours, which is a long time since we only ordered one appetizer, the dumpling soup, and pad see ewe. The pad see ewe was standard but pretty bland. We didn't even have the spicy condiments tray on our table like the others, so I couldn't even add anything to it unfortunately.

Customer service: mediocre Food: forgettable  Getting served your food after four tables, about 16 to 20 people in total, who sat down well after you did totaling a wait time of 90 minutes for a bowl of soup: priceless. Want a discover cover card moment? Come to this restaurant. Repeatedly I saw other tables get served drinks, appetizer, and main course while I waited for a small soup. Won't be coming back here again. Btw, I rarely post on here, it takes quite the horrible experience for me to take the time to write a review.

With a sports memorabilia theme, the decor is far from your typical Thai restaurant. But don't let that fool you.  The food is delicious and has excellent Thai flavors.   We had the Tom Kar soup, chicken pad kee mao and pad prig.  All of the burst with spicey flavors.  Service was fast and courteous.  Be sure to bring cash because they don't accept credit or debit.
Food is always good and used to accept debit credit card however now they accept CASH ONLY. I didn't realize until I ordered food which was suck. Wish they tell us in advance or put it up somewhere.

Awesome food and service. I had the crispy pad tai with chicken and a bubble tea. It was great. Service was really good and fast. We forgot that this is a cash only place but it was still a great experience. The place is small but definitely a great one. Highly recommended
Simply put - the best in Chicago. Quick delivery and amazing appetizers and entrees. Much better than any other delivery restaurunts in the neighborhood.

The food here is good and the décor is pretty cool.  The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was because the last time I was there it was too warm inside.  The staff is friendly and the food comes pretty quickly.  Be aware that it is a pretty small room so you may have to wait on weekend evenings, so don't come famished!!!

Absolutely dry noodles with no sauce and hard broccoli. Felt sick afterwards even the White Sox game couldn't cure me. Also, the owners didn't seem Thai to me so that immediately gave me a bad feeling.
This place is the best. Prices are MORE than reasonable, food is delicious & service is always very relaxed & friendly. Go! You won't regret it.

I love this place. The decor is definitely worth the visit but stay for the food.. Must note it is a CASH only restaurant but the food is very very very good. They have outdoor patio seating and do offer lunch specials . I love the staff very friendly and if Gris is your first visit let her know you get a little  something !! When in Wrigleyville and craving THAI. Come visit

This is a cash only restaurant, so make sure you have cash handy!  Very eclectic with vintage toys and signage covering the walls.  The pad thai was very good and flavorful - just enough to split between two people.
Best Cashew Chicken Thai dish in the metro area. Crab Rangoon are small and delicate treats, as they should be.
My favorite place to eat! Love the crispy pad Thai and... Well everything! Byob and a quirky atmosphere, and the owners and staff are incredibly nice.
This place is the best. Amazing food, very accommodating to vegans and vegetarians. Their panang noodle dish is to die for!

I give this place one star but they really deserve none. Do NOT order the Pad Thai. It was absolutely horrible. The dish was extremely salty, came with only three pieces of chicken, the noodles weren't the traditional pad Thai noodles. The food came with no silverware, no sauce. It just felt like they really didn't care about the quality of the food and service.

I love Cozy Noodles and Rice. I wish they delivered to Logan Square! Good food, adorable interior. Sewing tables, cute, kitschy americana adorned walls, mosaic tabletops, a small outdoor area, parking, BYOB, and they always offer coupons/discounts. There's a slightly larger location in Evanston as well, although I prefer the little Lakeview spot. It's great for large parties, and the turnover is quick, so the wait is never long. I can't think of a single complaint. Perhaps the food is somewhat run of the mill Thai, but even in the realm of originality, they have a few tricks up their sleeve.
A great Yelp find for me!!  Good Thai food and extremely cute decor! I definitely recommend the yelpers favorite crab rangoon, fried crispy noodles! We will be going back for some more soooooon

This place is now officially my favorite Thai restaurant. Food is delicious and fresh. And prices are great. Next time I'm craving Thai food I know where to go! Would recommend to anyone who loves fresh ingredients and flavorful food.

This is absolutely my favorite thai place...no my favorite restaurant....no my favorite place ever in the world!!!! Cozy noodle has atmosphere, attitude, and a whole lot of yummies for your tummy!  Pro: Awesome atmosphere, indoor and outdoor seating, fun trinkets and decorations in every room (including bathrooms!!), friendly staff, amazing food, great prices, and an unforgettable experience.  Con: I don't live close enough to go every day!! Since moving away to Denver from Chicago, Cozy Noodle is ALWAYS a top spot on my visits back home.  It's a great spot to grab lunch, catch up with friends, impress a date, girl's night, or bonding with grandma.  My personal favorites and must trys: Baby Egg Rolls (served in a cubs hat! FUN!) and the CRISPY pad thai (I get mine with chicken but guaranteed  good any way you do it). The way they do their crispy wide egg noodles is just out of this world. I tell people everywhere I go about it.  Cozy love you!

Yummy Thai food in Lakeview! I do think it's a TAD pricey for Thai but the food is pretty good. Crispy pad kee mow - excellent flavors and spice level. I thought the crispy part was really interesting and new. It did not taste bad either however because of the crispiness, it's hard to continuously eat without resting your jaw. Overall too salty for me though. If they can make crispy pad kee mow this good, there's no doubt that the regular pad kee mow would be good too. Cozy wings - delicious! 5-6 small little wings/drumstick with an excellent crisp on the outside served with a delicious sauce.
