Chicken Satay - It's a lot like chicken satay elsewhere but it was still tasty.  Fried Tofu - Also fairly normal. Tastes better when piping hot. Eat it before it cools down. Definitely stop by if you're in the area or if you want to try the crispy pad kee mow!

I ordered delivery at night time: the Cashew entree and the beef fried rice. It was great! Both dishes were very fresh and tasty. The crab rangoons were also very delicious and a decent size. Highly recommended and the delivery driver was also friendly.

We went here for my husband's birthday and it was a blast! The decoration on the walls was very fun, lots to look at. They threw in some Cubs theme stuff too which was also fun. We had our appetizers delivered in a Cubs helmet, which was delicious, by the way. The food was reasonably priced and so good. Would definitely recommend this place! No complaints!

It seems like a lot of people love this place for the atmosphere. If you're looking for just delivery and not an in dining experience, there's a few other Thai places I would recommend over this one. The food itself is ok. Even though the bright orange color of the Pad Thai is a little odd. Recommended if you're looking for an interesting dining-in experience.
Fantastic! Great Thai food, fun twists on classics, and speedy service. In and out very quickly and very good food. Highly recommend the Crispy Pad Thai, unusually good! Cheers!
The pad thai was delicious and the staff was awesome. They were so friendly and helpful!

I LOVE this place.  First, let me tell you that the atmosphere is nothing like you've experienced in that part of Chicago. It's all kitch and its wonderful.  Second, the food; OH THE FOOD. I got the red curry which was the best I have ever had. My boyfriend had the crispy pad see ewe which he fell in love with. The only complaint I have is that the tiny spring rolls you get as an appetizer aren't worth $4. But that's not going to stop me from coming back. Third, the wait staff is KILLING it. We got there when only a few tables were full and as we were leaving they were slammed. And, to make things more crazy, there were only 2 of them. They were running around like crazy AND making sure everyone got everything they needed AND clearing tables. Gold star right there.  You bet your ass I am going to be coming back.
Love this place, BYOB, great food and either inside or outside seating. Very reasonable prices. Liquor store is right around the corner.
Disappointed. I wanted to like. Ordered their specialty, crispy pad Thai. Too many noodles not enough chicken. Very nice people though

Cozy is my favorite Thai restaurant in all of Chicago! My go-to is Pad See Ew. Each bubble tea flavor I've had here is always really tasty! The crab rangoon is among the best I've had. The staff is very friendly. Now that I started to go there a few times a month with one of my friends, they recognize us and are always very attentive to our requests. There's cool decor ALL over the restaurant. The outdoor seating is pleasant too.
This place is below average. Salty and too sweet. I never had tom yum soup that tastes SO SWEET that i wanted to throw up..

We went there because of 4stars!!!! I would give no more than two. The Tom Yum soup was way too sweet, they used cheap mushrooms (instead of shiitake) . Server didn't know if they have a duck dishes. Beef salad wasn't spicy( the menu said it was spicy) Golden noodles was good. It was raining, so their roof was leaking right in a middle of the floor.

I ordered delivery on a Saturday night. The order was delivered within the suggested time frame, which was great.  But the good review ends there... I ordered Pad Thai medium spicy and pot stickers. The pot stickers were bland and overcooked. The Pad Thai was VERY spicy. I also said explicitly "NO GROUND PEANUTS". And they included the peanuts. Thank goodness I am not actually allergic to nuts! I also checked boxes (this was all on East24) for condiments like "soy sauce" and "napkins", and got NOTHING. Not even one pair of chopsticks or a fork.  Pathetic and disappointing delivery and cuisine experience.

I saw the reviews and was hesitant to come here, it seems like more people come here to review the restaurant itself rather than the food. I agree the place is very unique, definitely adds a bit of atmosphere. But it's still lacking, there's no music that I think could add a lot to the experience - some kind of thai music! They should also encourage guests to walk around the restaurant in between ordering to get them to take it all in rather than stare around at the decorations from your table. The food was decent, neither my friend nor I enjoyed the food too much. I probably ordered the wrong thing - I got the Noodles Panang. Can't say I like crispy noodles, they're so hard to chew and don't go well with the soup. I enjoyed the sauce a lot, but the crispy part was just odd. The beef looked very weird as well, not entirely sure how I would describe it... just didn't look fresh? It wasn't expensive and they had a yelp deal, so all in all not bad.
Absolutely love this place!!!! Awesome service and amazing food! Such a cute dine in atmosphere and the owners are lovely! Definitely one of my go to places!

I order delivery often and have popped in with many friends over the past 9 months on a regular basis since ive moved to the area...i LOVE their food. i usually order the panang curry, seaweed salad, and pad thai and they always make it spicy upon request. all of my friends love this place, from the awesome flavors, great prices, great service, nice location and really unique and vibrant decor...oh and it's byob!! unfortunately, im moving-and i will for sure miss their food and atmosphere. it's my go-to local joint that has top-notch food and service. the owners are sooo nice. one of my fav places in the city!!

Disappointed that the Thai food was not traditional or authentic...but noticing the surrounding neighborhood, I understand why the ethnicity of the Thai food was compromised or maybe because the prices are on the cheaper side.  We ordered the cucumber salad and seaweed salad to start and bothered that the seaweed salad was mixed with cucumber.  If this was noted in the menu then we wouldn't have ordered the cucumber salad.  We moved on to the Panang chicken curry (spicy) which was mild and soupy with coconut milk.  The Pad Thai was bland...and we had to add sriracha, soy sauce and pepper to give it basic flavor.   The decor is cute but I'd rather have good food than cute.

So let me start by saying this place is the bomb dot com. I have only ever gotten delivery; however this food is amazingly flavorful and cheap! About once a week my husband and I pick the most interesting sounding food from the menu and dig in. First we tried the lard na. This is a delicious dish that has the tastiest broth. The noodles come separately and are fried. Next we tried the pad thai! This was an orange version of the classic dish. The portion is humongous and very flavorful. And my overall favorite, the garlic chicken noodles. These are simply the best thing on the menu! You can choose any meat and it is full of garlic-y goodness. The portion, again, is huge and the meat is also plentiful.  The delivery usually takes about an hour; however for 2 entrees and an appetizer, we have never paid more than $25! This is an amazing deal for great food!
Ordered delivery: $25 for one app. 2 "entrees". What a ripoff!!! Portions were so small we were hungry after finishing them. Not worthy for the price.

My wife and I are addicted to Cozy's crispy pad thai, and used to eat here every week. This is our favorite thai restaurant on the north side, and its about time we gave them a 5 star review. They are so consistent and everything is always so tasty. The Crab rangoon is awesome too. Service is wonderful and the food comes fast and hot. Not to mention, the BYOB factor is a bonus.

I ate at Cozy for the first time recently and it's now my new favorite Thai place. We had pad see ew and Spicy Cashew, both with tofu. Both were delicious and just spicy enough. I also love the decor - so cute! I definitely recommend this place and I was also glad to find out they deliver to my area :)

Came here because of the great reviews. I love Thai food so always looking for a good, affordable spot. This place has a unique, cozy, & fun wrigleyville atmosphere. I love that they have bubble tea! I got the Thai tea & my husband got the coconut, both delicious. I got the pad see ewe as recommended by a review & it was yummy, I love the soft, big noodles. My hubby got the chicken Penang (he loves spicy food) it was really delicious, I recommend for other spicy food lovers! The crab Rangoon had lots of filling which is gold. Will def be back!

Okay, so the food was pretty good. That's the only compliment I can give. I ordered Pad Thai. Not something that takes long to cook. The people next to us ordered at the exact same time. They got their food. Ten minutes pass. My friend got the curry she ordered. No mention of my meal. Ten more minutes pass. The waitress seems to realize I've been forgotten and walks into the kitchen. Five minutes pass. The couple next to us, who got there 20 minutes after us, gets their food. At this point one of the other patrons even pointed out that I had yet to receive my food. It's finally brought out and it is good. We go to pay. They don't accept credit cards for orders less than $10. For a restaurant that has most of their meals costing $8.25, that seems shady to me. Good food and I'll maybe try it again, but I'm not happy.

My favorite Thai restaurant in the city!! The crab rangoons are the best I have ever had. They even do 50% off entrees on Cubs game nights with a ticket. Eating in is always better because it is fresher but delivery always gets to you relatively fast. It is somewhere I always take guests when they are in town for the weekend and want some good food. Love the decor inside. Very eclectic. Women's bathroom is filled with PEZ dispenser!! Prices are decent as well.

I'm not that happy with Cozy. There are a lot of other asian restaurants in Lakeview that do Thai so much better. You can't just throw three ingredients into a curry and expect that to cut it. If it's close to you, I guess give it a try. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here though.

Appetizers: Crab Rangoon - Good. Would be better at the restaurant as delivery fried always gets a little soft. Baby Egg Rolls - Also good Entrees: Basil Chicken - very good and they made it spicy for me Pad Thai - Wasn't good at all. Was a weird orange color and quite bland but heavy on the fish sauce flavor. I wouldn't recommend it for an entree. Delivery was fairly quick and low fees.
Friendly staff, cozy, awesome decor and yummy food. Not bland at all!
Loved this place!!! Food was great, I had the crispy pad thai. The environment was awesome, there's pez dispensers hanging in the ladies room!!! How could you go wrong?!?!

I came here with a friend who has never been here before and was really excited to show them my favorite Thai restaurant. We ordered the Tom yum soup for starters, she realized that the soup she tried she didn't like after a few sips. We asked our waitress if she could get something different or have it taken off the check, which I think is a reasonable question, you should never have to pay for food you don't eat due to not liking it at a restaurant you've never been to. The owner them came over and said that if you've never had the soup before you probably shouldn't get it, she didn't look at us when saying this, and then said "fine I'll take it off". She then came back with our entrees and asked my friend if she has had pad Thai before then commented that everyone does it differently so maybe don't order it, and asked her to make sure she liked, the way she went about it was extremely rude. No one should feel bad for trying something new especially from a manager/owner. As much as I like the food, I am disappointed with the service and probably won't bring any new customers.

My boyfriend and I visited Cozy Noodle for the first time last night. We live down the street and I'm very upset we have never walked in before! The name definitely suits this place just right, it's so cozy! I loved every minute of it.  The food was great and they had the Cubs game on. Can't say enough great things about this place. The staff was so friendly too!

A truly unique place that you won't find anywhere else. The first thing that will hit you about Cozy is the decor...because there is a lot of it. You can spend all your time playing eye spy and taking in everything on the walls. The food is decent, not the best but not the worst. It didn't feel terribly authentic but it was still good. The prices are okay for what you get. Honestly, the best part is the decor and the workers there who obviously have a lot of passion for the restaurant. A fun place to check out and see.

Ordered: Spring rolls: not very fresh ingredients  Crispy pad see ewe: very salty Very disappointed, as I used to love this place. 0 stars for food I ate; 2 stars for good service-- they offered to omit spring roll for our dissatisfaction. Didn't have the heart to slam the pad see ewe as well, waiter looked like he was about to cry (exaggeration, but you get the point).

The decor is unique... The place has walls full of Mickeys, Donald Ducks, knick knacks, and license plates. The good things - you can BYOB, the staff were nice, and the Cozy chicken wings were tasty. The bad - their crispy Pad Thai and crispy Pad See Ew should be taken off the menu. It was a jaw exercise to try to eat those dishes. The sauce was good but the noodles were more hard than they were crunchy. It hurt my throat to try to eat it. My jaw was tired half way through the dish and it wasn't filling. I'm sure this place would've gotten more stars from me if I had just ordered the regular noodles but my curiosity got to me.

This is such a cute little spot.  A little bit off of the beaten path that is Wrigleyville.  The decorations of all kinds of toys and pez dispensers is really fun. The food is pretty basic thai. I really enjoyed the coconut soup. I had never had it before but the sweet and savory really work well together.  The pad thai and pad see eiu are always favorites.

I've been going here for about 5 years and it's always good. I get Chicken Pad Thai, Beef Pad See Ewe, Crab Rangoon, Baby Spring Rolls and Egg Rolls. I've never eaten inside the restaurant, I always get carry out. It's a very cute but tiny place. The service is always fast & friendly!

Bland, bland, bland, and bland.  Enough said. The decor is very interesting but it doesn't compensate for the lack of flavor in their food.  Customer service was nothing special and they were quick to sit us and have us pay.  Food came out rather fast which would of been great if it tasted any good.   Would I go back?  No thank you. There's plenty of other Thai restaurants to try.

Ordered delivery several weeks ago and the food arrived in under an hour. Overall, I found everything but the crab rangoons to be a bit bland. We ordered the crispy pad Thai and pad see ew. The pad thai reminded me of the frozen variety, unfortunately, lacking any real flavor or spice. The pad see ew smelled good, but again, didn't really taste like anything. I really want to like Cozy Noodles, given how interesting the space is and the sheer number of flyers I receive in the mail each month. I'd be willing to give it a shot again - maybe just for a couple orders of the crab rangoons :)

We read the awesome reviews on yelp about this place and decided to give it a try last week and it was okay. We got the panang chicken curry and it was pretty bland....not bad but just ehhh. We usually get the pad Thai but opted for the crunch pad Thai and I don't know it kind of seems like it's a way for them to recycle overcooked Rangoon shells. Again it wasn't horrible but wasn't great either

With the exception of the price, I would absolutely not recommend this place for thai food-- based on my experience. I was visiting Chicago and based on the ratings, was excited to try. I got a thai classic-- pad Thai, and have never been more disappointed.  The entire dish, including the chicken and noodles were orange.. Which I thought was bizzare. Taste was unimpressive and bland. Was never asked how spicy I would like it.. And it came out completely mild, which wouldn't have been a huge problem but I got it for take out and was SOL.  So, If you're looking for Thai food... Try elsewhere

This is my favorite Thai restaurant! I've been coming here for years and it hasn't let me down. The decor is super unique and fun, the service is great, and the food is phenomenal.  Here are some of my favorite dishes: Appetizers: Chicken Satay- absolutely wonderful. The chicken is seasoned very well and the peanut sauce is great. Tofu Satay- for anyone that is a vegetarian, or just want's tofu, this tofu satay is great. The tofu doesn't taste bland like some other tofu satays I've had. Shrimp Shumai- tastes great! Love the sauce they put on the side too.  Potstickers-they are fried not steamed, but still is great. The dipping sauce goes very well and the filling is delicious.  Spring Rolls- very fresh and you could say on the healthier side of things. Always a good choice. Salads: Cucumber Salad: The best cucumber salad hands down. I'm not sure what they do to make it so good, but I could eat a giant bowl of this if I wanted to.  Noodles: Pad Thai- nice orange color, tastes great! My favorite pad thai for sure. Pad See Ewe-Great dish! They sauce they use has the right balance of flavors. The noodles have a nice chew to them and it's probably my go-to dish. Curry: Mild Curry- this is a yellow mild curry and it is wonderful. It has a tiny bit of spice, but definitely mild. I'd always get an extra side of rice with my order, so all the curry doesn't go to waste.

We've ordered a bunch of times from here and it usually is good.  This last time, after a mess up with our order they delivered the food after it had obviously been sitting around for awhile.  When I called to explain it, the guy said sorry, but it will be better next time.  There will be no next with customer service like that.

I really like Cozy because of the atmosphere. It has such a different and non-traditional interior design for a Thai restaurant. The walls are lined with lunch box collections from like the 90s, quotes, and collectable figurines. It's not very big, but I've never seen it super crowded either, even around meal times. I've never had to wait to be seated. It's dimly lit and has kind of a hole-in-the-wall feel to it, which definitely creates that "cozy" environment. I've had the Pad Thai, Bamee Noodles, and Pad See Ew, all of which are really good. The best part is that it's so affordable! The Pad Thai and Pad See Ew are each $7.25 and the Bamee Noodles are $7.95. The atmosphere and price, in addition to the quality of the food, makes this place one of my favorite restaurants in Evanston.

Cozy is the place my friends and I will take someone to if they're new to Chicago. It's delightful in every way - the vibrant knick knacks and Cubs decor, the always friendly service, and of course, the food! My personal favorite is the Crispy Pad Thai. If you're there for lunch, try the fried rice, too. The appetizers are great, too - I can never say no to edamame.

Cozy is my go-to neighborhood pick for Thai - both for ordering in and for going out and grabbing a casual bite with friends. I normally get the Pad See Ew or the Golden Noodles. And you can never go wrong with the Crab Rangoon. Like its name suggests, the restaurant is really cozy, the atmosphere is relaxed and it's BYOB. It's on the smaller side, so it's best to go with a group of 4 or less. Highly recommend!

Ordered delivery tonight and experienced mixed reviews on the food. Here's the breakdown: Food: Pad Thai with chicken - not the best pad Thai or the worst. Fits into the middle that I wouldn't order it from here again unless I had no other options. Husband ordered Rama - REALLY good! Tastes like a delicious curry chicken rice dish. Wish I would have ordered that for myself!! (Lucky for me he's good at sharing). Baby egg rolls - weird. Won't order again. Price: Got 10% off by mentioning an online ad. Price was definitely reasonable. Overall, I would rate it a 3.5 if I could, but because I can't and have to lean up or down, I'm giving it a 4 because delivery was SO fast!!

Cozy Noodles indeed! The decorations outside were crazy legit, and the inside doesn't disappoint either. It felt super homey and a place where you can really kick back a few and have a cheap, hearty meal. I got the tom yum soup and the spicy chicken salad, which looks deceptively simply but is actually very fresh and flavorful with just the right kick. Really enjoyed this little friendly place tucked away on the corner of Sheffield.
Wrigleyville staple. I've been coming here for years. Its one of a healthy(ish) spots in Wrigley.  I recommend pad see ewe for noodles, cashew chicken for entree, and chicken satay for apps.

I don't understand why people are giving them bad reviews regarding customer service. In the past when they messed up, they always fixed my order with no charge or questions asked. They are always really friendly and accommodating. The food is great and the atmosphere is really cute and laid back. Prices are also very reasonable. Try their cozy wings-probably some of the best wings I've ever had!

Went to Cozy years ago for the first time and did not know where in the city I was. Loved every bite and wondered for years if I'd ever stumble across it again. Moved back to the city in December 2012 and lo and behold-- Cozy is 30 yards away from my front door! I have now probably been to Cozy hundreds of times since, including a very fun, boozey, and delicious new years eve. Everything is wonderful and the BYOB aspect is hard to hate on. If you're a foody or someone who rates restaurants based on super chatty and attentive american style table service... well, then, you probably don't eat $ Thai anyways. Service is prompt, kind, and efficient. Compared to its competitors, Cozy is by far the best in the neighborhood. Highly recommend for easy, inexpensive, delicious, consistent, and fun Thai food in Lakeview.

I'm giving this place four stars for the atmosphere and the decor. Everything else-the food, the service-- are mediocre. But the ambiance is that cozy and wonderful. String lights, state license plates, and robots. This might not make sense-- but it's cozy. Very cozy. The food is just okay, but really cheap, so worth it.

This review is purely based on delivery service. I ordered a meal from Cozy Noodles and Rice through GrubHub around 5:40pm. I received emails and texts notifying me that my meal should arrive between 6:40pm - 6:50pm. At 7:20pm, the food still hadn't arrived, so I called Cozy and received a less than professional and welcoming response. I was told my food was on its way, and would be here soon. at 7:30pm, I called GrubHub, who were fantastically apologetic and offered me a coupon. At 7:50pm, I called Cozy again, who were apologetic, but also somewhat rude. I FINALLY got the food around 7:55pm, over an hour late! Apparently, "traffic" (I live less than a mile away) held them up. Needless to say, I will NOT be ordering from them again, and I would highly discourage others from doing the same, unless they are happy to wait 2+ hours for a mediocre meal.

I LOVE COZY!!!! I've been going to Cozy's for a few years now and I absolutely love the food and the service is great and they are so well priced.  My favorites include: shrimp shumai and Woon Sen Khee Mao.  Cozy is my go to Thai place in the city!

I recently got take out from here. Wait wasn't too bad.  I got the Crab Rangoons and Crispy Pad Thai. The Crab Rangoon was awesome. Just the right amount of crispiness and creamy filling. The Crispy Pad Thai was interesting. The flavor was really good but (and I'm not sure if it was because I did take out) I found myself tired of chewing! The noodles were very crispy yet chewy at the same time. I don't think that I would get that dish again. At least not with take out.  Overall the meal was pretty good. I would probably go back there and try other things on their menu

I've been coming here since it opened. Tee and Julie are dear friends now and own/run the best Thai spot anywhere I've ever been. The menu comes in mostly under $10.00 and you really cant go wrong with anything. Menu highlights include Bamee noodles, spicey pad thai eith tofu, panag noodles and hands down best coconut milk soup on the planet. You get to enjoy all of this while sitting in this cozy ( full pun intended) little spot near Wrigley Field. Old toys adorn the walls and the tables are old sewing machines converted into tables. When you come and you should tell Tee and Julie Big John sent you. !

The food isn't why they get a bad review, 3 times now I've called and have received the worst customer service I've ever gotten. I was yelled at, because the dumba** on the phone didn't understand what I said. This happened 3 times in the conversation. I wasn't mumbling, or talking fast he was doing something else and not paying attention to the call, and then yells at me because he didn't understand what I said. This is a place where you have to talk very slow and dumb down your words so they can understand? I guess so.  This wasn't the first time the customer service was pitiful, one time I called at 9 pm, granted they close around this time, and before I can even say anything I was yelled at and told "WE HAVE TO EAT TOO" and they hung up. Last week they must have been busy when I called, and was literally told to "find somewhere else to eat, ok?" When all I did was ask how long the delivery would take (she said they were backed up, so I simply replied with "how long will delivery take?"). The people who answer the phones are incredibly rude, and after 3 different occasions it was time to put it on yelp. The food is fine, sometimes they make it great others meh. But the customer service is why I will never order from them again.
Placed a pickup order and confirmed our name at pickup time and when we got home (a 15 min drive to the restaurant) was the wrong food! Poor service

A gem in the city! For someone who doesn't like Thai food they still had a huge selection of options and I easily found an entree I was interested in! The atmosphere is vintage with old memorabilia on the walls. The tables are made from old sewing machines. It doesn't fit a "classic thai restaurant environment" which makes it unique! Affordable prices tat don't make me feel like I'm splurging! Be back in a heart beat soon!

Let me just start by saying that I'm a huge fan of Thai food and I've eaten at tons of Thai restaurants in California. I was excited to see a Thai place so close to where I was staying in Chicago. I ordered regular beef pad see ewe during my first visit and the dish was very underwhelming. The veggies weren't fresh, the beef was tough, and the noodles weren't seasoned well. I also ordered mango smoothie with tapioca. Bleck. The tapioca was nasty and the drink left a gritty film on my teeth after each sip.  I decided to give this place a second chance when my boyfriend visited and we were both craving Thai food. After reading several yelp reviews, we decided to go with crispy pad see ewe and crispy pad kee mao. Okay, totally not what we were expecting. The noodles were crispy to the point of almost being inedible. I think I burned more calories trying to chew the noodles than calories taken in from each bite. I noticed that crispy noodles are offered at almost all Thai restaurants here in Chicago. WHY?! This is not real Thai food. This might not even be food. I guess this must be a Midwest adaptation of Thai food. All I can say is I'm not a fan. The service here is fine as everyone says. The restaurant is cute, too. It's just the food that sucks. Sorry.

We used to really love Cozy and have been coming here for years, usually for take-out. They have always been friendly, the service has always been very good, and we've enjoyed their food. Today we ordered cashew chicken, pad khee mao, and pad prik with baby egg rolls and crag rangoon. I was very disappointed with our meal, especially since we ordered more than we usually do. Everything was very bland, the vegetables did not taste fresh, and the meat was tough and overcooked. Unfortunately, I don't think we'll be coming back to Cozy for awhile!

Warm and tasty spot...definitely lives up to the "Cozy" name. Perfect when you want a good warm bowl of noodles and a fun atmosphere.  The only reason(s) I didn't give it 5 stars is because I have had better Pad Thai in relatively worse locations (small town USA). Also, now that it's cold, the door swinging open over and over again, letting cold air in, was a little annoying.

You need to live far away from Good Thai Food to really appreciate Great Thai Food. I live in Logan Square where most of the Thai food arrives in the same greasy, over-sauced state as the worst Chinese delivery. We made the trip over to Cozy for a group dinner on Saturday night and loved it. I got a simple curry fried rice, which is simple enough, but not a combination you would usually find. Served a massive amount, too. Cozy Rice has a fun ambience (see inevitable Pez dispenser photos in other reviews). I had been to the Evanston location years back, but this visit whetted my appetite for another return trip much sooner than that.

I am blown away. This place deserves my best rating so far. like it should actually be more than 5 stars. Cozy is the right word for this place. It is very small but has the most wonderful decoration (that starts in front of the restaurant with an Elvis statue and continues to the bathroom that is clustered with unique PETZ, sooo lovely). Some of the tables were made out of old sewing machines and had nice mosaic table tops. Just very creative and very clean (I know that it is hard to keep such extensive decorations dust-free) When I came in, all the tables were occupied and there were around five people waiting for their take-away food. The staff greeted me very warmly and made sure that there is a table ready for me asap. Generally, the staff was very friendly throughout my whole stay and even though they rushed it a little with the check in the end, I never felt rushed when I ate dinner; which is nice. And I understand why they brought me the check right away, there were more people waiting to get a table for dinner. As for the food, I had Thai Iced Tea which was very sweet and very good. My starter was Seaweed Salad, a decent portion that tasted like the one I am used to. Very great. My main dish was Noodles Panang with chicken and soft noodles instead of crispy noodles. The chicken was not quite my taste but I think this is due to personal preferences. Next time I would order my food with tofu. The portion sizes were decent and I definitely had enough to eat when leaving the place.  All in all I paid 20 dollars, including 22% of tips, which I think is a pretty sweet deal! If I lived in Chicago, this would probably be my to go place because everything just seems right. They have a good menu, very friendly service and a kick-ass interior.  I love that I found this place for my first meal in Chicago. Best start to an amazing weekend trip.

Their website says they deliver west to California. When I called to place an order, the woman on the phone said they only deliver to Western. Not sure if that is a new policy, or if she just made it up, but they should probably update their information.

Went to Cozy a couple weeks ago for lunch. Not sure how I even knew of this place but glad I stopped in. First impression was great. Tons of  toys, signs, and memorabilia throughout making you feel quite nostalgic and dare I say cozy.  Since it was lunch time, they had a separate lunch menu with tons of cheap options. Each meal came with a small side. Shared an appetizer of potstickers before having the pad see ewe. Both were solid. The pad see ewe was very noodle heavy compared to the veggies but was a good lunch sized portion. I think I will stick to Garlic Chili Thai in Old Town as that's much closer to me.

Definitely one of my fav Thai in Wrigleyville area... The atmosphere is fun with all their collective toys, pez dispenser filled restrooms, friendly staff & good food!! This place is fantastic!!! Everytime I've been here it's been perfection ... I've been coming on & off now for 10yrs!!! Definitely give it a try if ur in the area!! It's byob too!!! Woo whoo!!

ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL. This is a late review - we went here on their 10th anniversary and it was SO AMAZING, the owners and employees were so overly nice and the customer service was impeccable !!!!!! The food is quite cheap and delicious. This is definitely our new favourite thai place (we live a good 15 minutes from here, but will def go out of our way to come here!!!)

I went to Cozy several years ago and remembered really liking it.  However, tonight when ordering delivery, it was quite a disappointment.  They quoted me an hour for delivery.  It ended up being an 80 minutes.  The food was cold when I opened it.  Fried potstickers are not good cold to say the least.  The pad see ewe could at least be warmed up.

Excellent delivery cuisine.  Not greasy- somewhat fast delivery having ordered online thru yelp or direct with Cozy's.  Pretty tasty- we had Panang Curry Chicken, Cashew Chicken...fried spring rolls (meh), Chicken Satay...needless to say, we love chicken and it was all, as stated, tasty. With almost 700 reviews I would say it's worth trying... The fried rice is exceptional when you substitute brown rice for white. Update...the only dish that I've come across that is below par is the Pad Thai...just avoid it. (I've tried it twice)

Crispy pad Thai was weird, like fried stale fortune cookies instead of crispy wontons or noodles which is what we thought it was. Bbq pork didn't have much flavor or seasoning. Chicken fried rice was good. Service was good as well.

Terrible food. Delivery was prompt. We had the pad se ew, the panang and the chicken satay. The pad was fine but unflavorful and dry. The panang was spicy but there was barely any chicken in it and was extremely runny and tasted like a bowl of coconut milk. The satay seemed like it was boiled chickens and was also dry. The peanut sauce was bland. I wouldn't ever order from here again... Sorry guys...
Great place, great food! This is one if my favorite restaurants in Chicago. The staff is great and I especially love the old Singer sewing machines used as tables!

This place has the best pad Thai in the city. It's also the only place I've seen that gives a lime, not a lemon. The staff there is very nice and the food always comes out quickly. The style is, to say the least, eccentric. But it adds a certain charm. Everything I have tried has been good

My boyfriend and I wanted to try somewhere new and went to this place. We love Chinese food but were very disappointed. Service was horrible. I told our waitress we had a coupon and she looked at me like I was crazy. After we ordered two entrees of chicken fried rice, edamame, and veg egg rolls, she picked up our menus and walked away. Didn't ask if we wanted anything to drink or say okay or anything. I asked for a straw for my water and she said okay but never brought it. Edamame wasn't crispy so it wasn't great. The veggie egg rolls are more like sushi and we didn't like them. Not what we expected. The chicken fried rice was good but it needed soy sauce. We waited for our waitress to come back so we could ask for it but she never came back. We want to the front counter and she finally brought it to us.  We waited another 15 mins for our waitress for boxes and the check but again she never came. We had to go up to the counter to request that stuff. Bad experience and not good enough food for us to go back.

This place is a gem. I am from the suburbs, but never pass an opportunity to go here when I visit the north side of Chicago. The food is delicious, the staff is courteous and hard working, and the physical environment in the restaurant is as their name says: cozy. I like it a lot. The only complaint I have in regards to my last visit (08/09/14) is that the portion of meat in my dish (Panang curry with chicken) was a little skimpy.
Great implementation of a simple concept. Good food, friendly staff. Recommended!

We called immediately upon ordering to confirm they'd arrive in 40 minutes for delivery as we have a child staying with us.  They took over an hour and 20 minutes.  When the food finally arrived we found shards of plastic in the bubble tea and the pad thai was pink.  I'll never order from here again.
Favorite Thai food in all the city!! So enjoy the great atmosphere, excellent service, fresh seafood for Pad Woon Sen with Shrimp and Chicken.  So delicious!

From the moment you walk in to this Wrigley Field neighbor you are having fun and great food.  Cozy Noodles  just makes you happy.  It shows in the funny, funky little toys that are EVERYWHERE.  Best of all the food at Cozy is wonderful   Every menu item is made with care and the flavors are marvelous.  We've been to Thailand and the food at Cozy is as good as the best we had there. . The appetizers are fresh and delicious.  Every entrée is made to perfection.  It's BYOB and you can't help but have a great time and a great meal when everyone around you is laughing and enjoying themselves so much. This is our fav. Thai place.  Best of all, the people at Cozy are warm, friendly and service is great.  They seem to have a love affair with their restaurant and it shows in the way they cook, serve and treat their customers. .   Keep it up, Cozy.  Yours is a gem of a Thai restaurant.
Great food, great staff and the friendliest owner. I'll keep coming back!

A Thai place in Lakeview, who would have guessed?  After getting tired of Joy's inconsistency I gave this place a shot. The menu's are eerily similar, I would have thought they are sister restaurants. After having the food, I can tell they aren't.  Cozy is super mediocre food that has no redeeming quality. No one in their right mind would order this over Joys.  I had a really good cucumber salad the rest just left me disappointed and hungry. This is a skip.

Diners won't soon forget their meal at Cozy Noodles & Rice. One would hardly recognize this as a Thai restaurant. The space, so small no more than forty people can fit comfortably inside, will either tickle your fancy or assault your eyes. The decor is a kitschy amalgam of Elvis memorabilia, fifties Americana and walls lined with vintage toys. When I first entered the restaurant I expected hamburgers and hot dogs, the kind of food more in line with the restaurant's furnishings. It's all a bit confusing but don't let the look of Cozy Noodles & Rice stop you from enjoying their tasty food. When I lunched here today with a friend I only ordered appetizers: steamed pot stickers and chicken satay. Both were quite good, especially the pot stickers, which had been hand made. They were pillowy and quite satisfying. The satay sauce was balanced--not too thick, not too oily--and the chicken was cooked to perfection. The service, like the ambiance, was rather off-putting. Everyone who works here is committed to making sure customers have an enjoyable dining experience. To that end, the wait staff was a bit intrusive. They repeatedly asked if my friend and I liked where we were sitting and if the food was good. While I appreciate all the attention-- good customer service being harder and harder to find these days--the wait staff didn't have to try so hard. The decor may be tasteless but the food is very tasty.

I hesitate to write this review because I think it's a decently well-kept secret tucked just off the chaos on Clark Street, but this place is fantastic! It's an awesome place to grab a quick, decent meal before heading to a game or show at Wrigley. The food is better than you average Thai food, with lots of choices for vegetarians and omnivores alike. The service is quick and friendly, and you won't find better prices for comparable food. It has a unique toy store decor that creates a fun atmosphere. There's a few tables outside but overall it's still pretty small so not great for big groups. Show your cubs tickets for a discount!

This place is extremely out of the box and quirky. They serve reasonable portions at a bargain price! Their food is also the  bomb.com  (especially the fried pad tai noodles)! Only thing that's off putting is their lack of alcohol but if that isn't a problem you'll love this place!

You pretty much get what you pay for at this location...which is a pile of cold garbage. The mini egg rolls tasted like they were just pulled out of the freezer and someone shat some store bought sauce all over them. In general, just very generic and tasteless. Not bad for a quick fix of some cheap asian cuisine, but ultimately a disappointment.

We used to order from here all the time, but the past 2-3 times we've ordered takeout, something was missing (like they forgot to put the sauce in the dish, so it was just bland stir fried food) or they messed up our order. I would still go there and eat in, but I'm not ordering take out from here anymore.

Always great service. Pleasant smiling faces and great food. They catered my party and everyone ate every single piece. I let them choose based on my party size. It was perfect. When we dine in, my kids love the shrimp sticks and soups the best.

Pad Thai tasted like they put too much fish sauce in it. The cold spring rolls were kinda gross. The panang curry noodles were good but didn't really have any noodles, more like fried wonton strips. The thai iced tea smoothie with boba was good. The seating is very cozy. Prices very reasonable and service good.

Almost 4 years later, and I feel like I should give this awesome restaurant another 5 stars for a total of 10! As I mentioned below, we always order delivery from Cozy, and it's still great. Last night I actually dined in for the first time, and the atmosphere and service were just as great! But the food is still soooo good! And since we had the actual menu in front of us (instead of ordering online), we tried a couple of new dishes. The basil entree with ground chicken (definitely get the ground chicken) was one of the best Thai dishes I've ever had. And the Woon Sen Khee Mao didn't disappoint either. And the food came out speedily which was perfect because we were both hungry. And the Taro bubble tea was a great cooler to the spicy foods. It's no surprise that this place is packed with a great vibe, when other restaurants on Clark or Sheffield or empty. 10 stars!

Went here a while back on a date and saw they had a lunch deal. The ambiance was very quirky, but as a college student I appreciated it. Everything from Godzilla to Elvis and license plates. Not a huge spot, but for the middle of the day and the occassion it was fine. As far as the food, I am a NYer used to huge portions for cheap fod and had been hitherto disappointed with Asian food in Chicago (had not been to Chinatown). They pleasantly surprised me. The food (fried rice) was good. My friend had the veggie and I had the shrimp. The veggie was uber good and the shrimp was tasty. They weren't stingy at all. I recommend.

2.5 stars. The decor at Cozy Noodles & Rice is really funky: there are toys, license plates, and other randomness glued to the wall.  That's about the only thing that was noteworthy here. I ordered baby egg rolls and pad see eiw.  The egg rolls were not very good; in fact, they might be the worst-tasting egg rolls I've ever had and they were a little hard (overcooked) to boot. My pad see eiw was pretty good, which is what makes this a 2.5 star review.  But, of the 4 people at my table, I was the only one to finish my entree and the portions were on the small side.  I didn't try anyone else's food but the feedback that I got from them was very so-so. I'm not likely to come back.

I visited this place based on being in the area and yelp reviews.  I am disappointed this time in yelp.  Because I had to order $10 to use my credit card I ordered a chicken rice soup and thai beef salad both very traditional thai dishes.  The soup was not bad.  The menu said what was in it but when it arrived it was loaded with another vegetable not on the menu which I had to pick out.  This impacted my eating experience.  The soup was good.  The chicken  in my soup was tough.  I would say the same of my beef salad, the toughest meet I have ever had.  It was so touch I ate the salad.  The dressing was very very sweet and off putting.  I am not sure I would do this establishment again.  My highest criteria is good food and the food was okay. The Elvis 60s replica scene certainly did not go with thai food...it's old and look like the store has not been renovated in some time.

Cozy is always a great choice for Thai. The wait staff is super friendly and the decor is always entertaining. I always go for the spicy fried rice or the pepper steak. Their baby egg rolls are so yummy, along with the steamed shumai. OH, go for lunch! They have a special and it's super cheap!!
Yum! Cute restaurant. Quick/polite service. Good prices. Oh yeah, and it tasted good too.

Best Thai Food in the Midwest!  Whenever I'm in Chicago, I head to Wrigleyville area to eat here. The cucumber salad is the perfect mix of crunchy cucumbers and carrots sprinkled with tasty sweet and sour vinaigrette. And the Pad Thai is a culinary treat, prepared just as you would expect; never been disappointed eating here. It's BYOB, so feel free to bring your own wine.

So I'm picky when it comes to Thai... Because penny's is closed I tried here! I am really pleasantly surprised! I ordered out and it was ready on time. I get home and it's delicious. Since you really shouldn't be able to mess up classics: I got the steamed shumai and garlic noodle!! Super flavorful and tasty. The dipping sauce for the shumai is really complimentary. While I always seem to forget that there's no "extra juice" on Thai noodle dishes... The food itself is fine without anything extra! Will definitely order again and will have to find those coupons they are always sending out!

Took advantage of their super good weekday lunch deal and got the Chicken Pad Thai for around $5. The store decor is very unique and the service was very quick. We got an appetizer (Spring Rolls) along with the meal. The Pad Thai was the perfect portion size for lunch and definitely a good deal for the low price. It was a Cubs afternoon game day, but it wasn't overly crowded. I'd go back again if I was ever off work during these hours.
Veggie fried rice and the veggie egg rolls were delicious. Definitely ordering again soon.

My favorite Thai place in Chicago! I love the Pad Thai and the crab rangoon. I always get a side of peanut sauce as well- I can't resist yummy peanut sauce. I usually order delivery and they are always deliver within the timeframe given. The prices are very reasonable as well- most dishes are a buck or two cheaper than other thai places I have been. Definitely recommend for all Thai food lovers!

Fun, quirky, little Thai restaurant. It would be great for date night. Restaurant is small and quaint, but there's a small parking lot next to it. The service is always friendly and food comes out pretty fast!

So good! I am a firm believer that when you find a good Thai restaurant you should stick with it. But, I got convinced to go to Cozy and try it out. I am really glad, because it was awesome.  I think i would go with the regular dishes next time, not the "crispy" version. But the "crispy" version was still really good. Just too much crispiness... haha Awesome, small, unique ambiance.
Awesome place great food great people friendly people and BYOB what more can you ask for

This is my absolute favorite Thai food restaurant in all of Chicago. The crispy pad see ew is my favorite dish and the pot stickers are amazing. I usually order food to be delivered, but every time I eat at the restaurant, the service is impeccable and the waitstaff is incredibly friendly!

The place is adorable. The food is really good and comes out super quick. We always get crab rangoon, pad see ewe and garlic chicken noodle and it is ALWAYS awesome. BYOB is a perk, they have a tiny little parking lot too if you are lucky enough to snatch one of the spots.

Lived in the area for about 2 years. This is my go-to place for Pad Thai or Chicken Fried rice. Insanely affordable and pretty good quality food pretty quickly. The crab Rangoon's and pot stickers are sometimes spotty quality wise. But I usually get them anyway.  The sauces are delicious and the atmosphere is pretty cool.  Great lunch specials too!
Simply the best...affordable and delicious! I've tried various items all supper yummy.  My favorite is the pad thai and the crab rangoos, oh and the green curry!

Great Thai for dine in or delivery. The restaurant is small with very kitschy decor that I love. In the summer they offer outdoor seating on Sheffield. Surprisingly, for being in the heart of Wrigleyville it's a quiet spot. I always get the Crab Rangoon. Their chicken Pad Thai is wonderful and I just tried the Crispy Pad See Ewe last night which was also delicious. PLUS, it is BYOB which I love! I'm a big fan!

Cozy is my favorite Thai place in the city!  So delicious-I always order the chicken pad thai and potstickers.  I have tried other things on the menu, however, you can never go wrong with chicken pad thai! Normally, I order to go (and they are always really fast-10 minutes!), but I do occasionally have time to stop in and admire the interesting decor.  There are so many decorative pieces to look at that I am often distracted, but its a cute little place.  Definitely recommend.   BYOB makes it even better!
Incredible. Superb service and delicious food. Their delivery is always fast and piping hot!

I am heading to Cozy noodle tonight and decided to send a little love their way through Yelp. Cozy noodle is the all purpose destination for delicious food and byob socializing. I've been here on countless dates and numerous lady gatherings and it's perfect for both. The dim lighting and intimate tables make it a great setting for seducing drunk, young men, while the kitschy, fun decor make for a festive evening with friends. The best thing on the menu? SPICY RED PANANG CURRY WITH BROWN RICE. Every time I go I think "I'm going to order something else". But alas, their curry has stolen my heart and even when I've strayed to some mighty delicious dishes, such as the Crispy Lard Nar, I always come running back to my truest love.  An insider tip, the chicken wings are surprisingly delicious. They aren't your traditional saucy  wings, they are crispy, juicy and delicious. I know you wouldn't think to order them at a thai place but you won't be dissapointed. Panang Curry, here I come!

After Thai Classic closed, I wandered aimlessly looking for my go to for Thai in Lincoln park/Lakeview. And I have found it. The cashew chicken is outstanding, great pad Thai, soups and salads. The prices are also pretty unbeatable. I'll be ordering from here weekly.

Much like its Evanston sibling, Cozy Noodles is well-prepared, flavorful, BYOB, and cheap...all in a kitschy and fun atmosphere. What's not to like? Of course, I am not the only sentient being who enjoys Cozy Noodles. On a Friday night at 8pm, sans reservations (oops), I had to wait 10-15 minutes. However, within about five, I was seated! The space IS very small and it makes waiting there a bit awkward. The good news is that I didn't have to endure this for long. I went with two friends. We stayed almost two hours, and nowhere in that gab fest did any employees try to rush us out or anything (of course, there were empty tables near us as the night wore on, so I'm sure that helped). In terms of food, the tom yum soup is reliably spicy, and the cucumber salad is a great way to cool down. My friend swears by the crab rangoons but abstained this time around - if you are looking for that, though, you could do much worse than Cozy!  All sorts of people come here, and that's really a testament to Cozy's atmosphere, food, and maybe its BYOB status (no corkage fee). From the Wrigleyville bros bringing in PBR, to the college kids and their flavored Andre (WHICH WAS NEVER ME OF COURSE), to the Mature and Established Adults bringing in Fat Tire or Malbec, the people watching quotient is top-notch. From the food to the crazy decorations to the agreeable prices, Cozy Noodles is an excellent prelude to whatever path you choose in the Fratopolis known as Wrigleyville!

Meh. Least favorite Thai food in the city. The atmosphere, location, and the fact that this place rarely gets the orders wrong will give it an a-ok rating, though. We get Cozy a lot at our apartment and it's usually because I am out-voted. My roommates love the food here (I don't) and it's super close. Plus, the lunch specials during the week are great (not that I work in the area to enjoy them, but my one roommate does work from home).  When it comes to the food, I find the flavors to be super watered down and generic. Most of the dishes taste the same to me, especially if you're getting one of the curries. The noodle dishes are pretty good and rather consistent, however.  We often order bubble tea from Cozy's (because we are obsessed with bubble tea) and about half the time they forget to give us straws. As a result we tend to pick up our order now instead of having it delivered because we've had too many missing parts and need to check it every time. The bubble tea itself, much like the curries, is some of the most watered down I've tried. It falls apart too easily, and turns to flavored milk/water in a hurry (either that or it's straight ice, it depends).  The inside, however, is really fun. Even just walking past Cozy it looks like a place you want to be in. The prices here are pretty good, the people are nice, and the lunch specials are killer. Although I would never pick Cozy's as my go to Thai place, on the occasions when I am out-voted I never come out of it terribly disappointed. I'll go back, but only because I live in a  democratic household.

Absolutely amazing.  Everything on the menu is both intriguing and delicious. I came here last night on a whim during a date with my girlfriend. I had been here a few years back during college and she was a newbie.  The first thing you notice is the decor. The walls are lined with nostalgia and kitsch. If you go to the women's bathroom, they've lined the walls with pez and it's awesome. One thing I remember from college was coming here and the men's bathroom featuring tons of old happy meal toys, many of which I remember having, sadly they've updated this and now the men's bathroom just has Marilyn Monroe plates...it was a major let down to rush to the bathroom and see that. I'm not sure why they did this but since the bathroom not having toys on the wall is my only complaint I'm letting it slide.  As for the food, it's nothing short of great. I don't remember what I got but it was great. My girl got the dish with Lard in the name, which usually would gross me out but I tried and I fell in love. We also tried there new wings and they were great too. They even came with a tiny American flag.  The service was fast and extremely friendly. I don't think we waited more than 15 minutes for our meals after sitting down.  Oh and the price is just right. This is now my favorite Thai Place in the city.

It's decent  When I lived in the area it was my go-to for Thai.  The flavor is always good and has a great kick to it,  Defiantly worth trying out.  I did recently have a so/so experience. I ordered the crispy Panang Noodle, at most places that offer this dish the noodle is fried in the sauce to the point to where the edges get nice and chewy/crispy but this place basically just gives you hard fried noodle pieces.  I mean it's still good but it makes it hard to eat and the fried pieces make the dish a little heavier than I prefer. Also there were about 4 tiny pieces of chicken in the entire thing.  Royal Thai are the kings of this dish.  Anyway, overall I like these guys. I think people over-hype it, probably because it has a very hipster interior.

My friend Kristen R loves this place, and we came here with her last week before heading over to IO Theater for an improv show.  I can see why she's like it! The place is just like their name says, it is cozy.  But it is cozy in a familiar comfortable way.  It was a little chilly from having the door opened so many times, but regulars would nudge the door closed anytime a newbie left it adjar. I was wordered about time, since we were cutting it close to the show.  There was no need to worry.  Our food came out pretty quickly.  We ordered crab rangoon, which was outstanding.  I had my normal Thai choice of Basil chicken, which was very good.  Kristen's garlic  chicken noodle dish with extra vegeatables looked great.  My husband's pad thai was too orange looking, but he said it was good. I would happily return and partake in their BYOB policy to go with dinner!

FANTASTIC thai food! This place is a hidden gem! Tucked away in wrigleyville this is a small funky  BYOB restaurant that serves amazing thai food. There is almost always a special where you buy one entree and get one half off so this place is beyond affordable. Great curry, pad thai, and pad see ew. It gets crowded but its worth it.

Nothing fancy, but there are always coupons through GrubHub and the mail, and they have some tasty dishes for when I am craving something savory but a little different.  I like the Crispy variations of Pad Thai and Pad See Ew, but my husband and I have been down all the noodle options and they are all pretty solid and nothing unexpected.  Haven't tried enough of the entrees to speak to those, but the appetizers are also quite good.  Other Thai restaurants in Lakeview are more authentic, but I like the variety and ease of access (delivery, pick-up, take credit card and PayPal) after working late when you just need some tasty calories.

This place has gone downhill since I started going here. I've ordered in from Cozy countless times (I'm thinking at least 20 times.) The food remains top notch, but their service has suffered.  I wrote them an email explaining my issue, hoping for at least an apology, but their email was broken. I messaged them on facebook and have not heard back.  I ordered from work for the first time and my order was promised in 45-60 minutes. At the 45 minute mark, they called and told me that since I was out of their delivery zone, I had to actually wait 2 more hours! I was taken aback, and after offering 1 hour more, I thought fine since if I order from somewhere else I'd have to wait an hour anyways.  My food ended up being delivered about 2 hours after I originally placed it. Not only did they not apologize or were even slightly apologetic after telling me that I had to wait another hour, they ran my card for $1 more for the extra fee for being out of their delivery zone. In addition, I found out that I was a mere 2 blocks outside of their delivery zone.  To cause such a poor experience for a long standing customer over 2 blocks makes me feel like they couldn't care less.
Inexpensive BYOB Thai place with great food. The crispy panang noodles are my favorite!

This is my go-to cheap date place. Honestly, I've probably taken every guy I've ever dated in this city (more than one date, of course) to this place. This is probably because it's a stone's throw away from my apartment, but I digress... It's the best place for a  date! It's freaking cheap. You can come here for lunch and get soup for $2. I mean, come on! Most of the entrees are under $10. If you want to take a potential ladyfriend here, you wouldn't be investing much money into her. The food is also not bad for what you're getting. It's, dare I say it-- good! It's not traditional Thai food, but it does the job and feels even better knowing that your meal will probably be less than $20 for the two of you. Try their specials: I usually get the crispy pad see ew, but I've been known to stray from the path sometimes.  The appetizers here are smaller portions, but you don't really need to eat them. A majority of them are a miss. Go for the entrees and share.  The decor is a bit kitschy, but that's the charm of this place. If you're in for an informal dinner date, I'd take them here simply because it's so cheap and it's a casual spot to meet someone.  All in all, I really like this place. It's BYOB, so you save on drinks. The only qualm I have is that this place is too small. There can be a long wait, and it's awkward because there's no space to wait in the restaurant, so you're standing in the middle of the restaurant!

After 6 months of going there about once a week, they declined my take out order because it came to $9.55 and they have a $10 minimum with credit cards. Been ordering the same thing every week and never had my take out order declined. Guess I am never going back to this place again...

Everything was just ok with the major exception of the spring rolls, which were awful. These are NOT spring rolls.. They are really just tofu, a slice of cucumber and a little egg wrapped in a raw, thick wrapping. In no way does this constitute a "spring roll". Will not be a return costumer here.
I always get there panang curry with tofu. It's absolutely delish! And of course, their tapioca smoothies. Everyone who works there are also always friendly.
Amazing place! Great food, very very cheap, byob. Always a go to spot in wrigley since just about every other place is awful

Hands down the best thai place around. They have a kick ass lunch special that you can't beat. It is tiny so if you come during prime evening hours, you will probably have to wait for a table but it is totally worth it.
This place is delicious and affordable. I had the pad woo sen and curry! I will definitely be back.
Best dinnah ever, no joke.  Got an allergy or annoying accommodation? Cozy's got it covered.  Great BYOB and menu for cozy meal.  :)
great food, awesome prices, BYOB. What else is there really to say?
Consistent quality food and always friendly service! Love the chicken pad thai and potstickers. Would recommend!

Some friends and I ordered online for delivery. I was a little hesitant because the price seemed too good to be true, but overall I was very impressed. We got our food quickly and the delivery person was courteous. We ordered the pad thai with tofu, pad see ewe with tofu, and mixed vegetables. The portions were generous and everything was tasty. It may not be the best Thai food I've ever had, but for the price and convenience it's definitely going to be one of my go-to restaurants.

I love this place! Some friends recommended it, and now I never turn down a chance to go to Cozy's. The food is delicious (BBQ Pork Noodle dish, seaweed salad, and everything else I've tried are great). It is really cheap, the restaurant itself is cute (lots of knick-knacks to look at), and the staff has always been extremely friendly. Parking can be difficult and it can get very crowded at night, not surprisingly, given its location.
They're serious about the "cozy" past the point of absurdity.  The food is in the same tier as cup noodle.  Overall a nice place if you're into gimmicky things.
Delivery was bad. The spring rolls were cold and borderline-inedible.  The pad see ewe was ok.  Overall not good food.  Won't go back.

My go-to neighborhood carry out place. Friendly staff whether you're dining in on carrying out, quirky decor, reasonably priced and tasty food every time. Pad see ew with beef is my jam and these guys do it very well. It's BYOB, too, and who doesn't love that?

Excellent service. They are all always very nice to us. We stop here once a year when we are visiting. Love the crispy Pad Thai and golden noodle. We start with the crab Rangoon. The atmosphere is great and there are many fun things to see no matter where you sit. The BYOB is an added bonus.
Adorable design, super food, friendly staff, and great prices. Recommend it for sure to anyone who enjoys asian flavours. I live in Asia and think this stuff is good!

The $1.99 lunch special is a ton of food! And delicious at that. The cream cheese wontons are also amazing. But bring cash, because the minimum for using a credit card is $10. It's always packed at peak dinner hours, so it's my favorite place to go for a late lunch. You can also call ahead and place your order for pick up.  The service is always fast and friendly. The atmosphere is very festive- love the American pride.

Found this place around the block from where I'm currently on assignment, and It's now a regular on my weekly lunch list. At $4.99/plate for lunch, you can't really beat it.  The food isn't the best Thai I've had, but it's good, and the price makes it that much better.  The decor is interesting, and the wait staff is very friendly. I enjoyed much lunch, kept some money in my pocket, and had a great respite from a long day at work. It's a winner in my book.
Good food, fast delivery, great prices/specials.  I will defiinitely be back!
I love the atmosphere and personality of this place.  It's fun to be at Cozy.  The food is good (not GREAT), and the staff is very friendly.  The location is nice, and there's usually not a wait.

Not bad, a bit kitschy, comfortable place to sit and have a good, carby meal. Boba is only a frozen drink here, so not the full menu I'd like of boba options, and no other add-ins besides boba. Lots of noodle dishes, including glass noodles. They take modifications to dishes. Friendly staff. They seated people up to closing, which was nice. They have cold lychee for dessert, not sure whether it was fresh, but it wasn't super syrupy in any event, so worth having. The shumai appetizer was probably reheated frozen dumplings and seemed abit sad, definitely didn't wow.

I forgot why I stopped ordering from this place.  Now I recall.  The food is seriously "Meh" these days.... I remember it being much better years ago, so not sure when they decided it was ok to drop the quality of the food...but it's helped me to remember and decide never to order from there again.  Cozy, get it together.

I've been disappointed with this place lately.  While the food is still delicious the location is ALWAYS crowded and there is always a wait.  My biggest problem, though?  The food never arrives at the same time.  You may get your entree before your appetizer.  Or you may get your entree but no one else at your table does.  So, if you're looking for a nice dinner to catch up and enjoy, this is not the place to do it.

The panang I ordered was decent! But...the noodles were crispy? I was told I would get wide noodles. Other than that, the chicken satays were good and the peanut sauce sucked. Not my favorite peanut sauce. I gave it two stars for how expensive it was and that my deliverywas supposed to be 45-1 hour...that turned into a good hour and 15 minutes. Meh.

This our local favorite go-to place. We have been going for years. Customer service is awesome. Prices are cheap. Food is good. The cashew chicken is awesome and spicy. Crab Rangoon's are a must! You can request to make dishes spicy for those of you complaining about it being bland.

This place just makes me sad. I really, really want to like it. It's a 1 minute walk from my apartment and filled with a hilarious and charming collections of toys and oddities. I love everything about it, except the food, and believe me, I've tried to like it. The food is simply unacceptably bad. I've come here three times, each time ordering a different item, but nothing has been even halfway decent. Fresh spring rolls - I refuse to waste food, but threw these away they were so bad. I didn't know it was possible to make a spring roll so...gross. I could potentially have kept coming to Cozy trying different things if it hadn't been for these spring rolls.  Tom Yum Soup - Not great, but not as bad as the spring rolls, though that's not saying a whole lot. Pad See Ewe - I often order pad see ewe at Thai restaurants I haven't been to because it's hard to make badly. Somehow, Cozy has won the prize for some of the worst pad see ewe I've had. It was peppery and lacked the distinct pad see ewe flavor. Crazy Noodles - I don't know what this is supposed to be like so it was edible. Definitely lacking in flavor though. Garlic Chicken Noodles - Again, lacking in flavor.  I love how unique and fun the restaurant and it's menu is, but I just can't justify wasting any more meals on seriously subpar Thai food. The fact that it has 4 stars on Yelp makes me really question the food opinions of Chicagoans. Step it up Yelpers. Cozy - I'm truly sorry for the harsh review, your restaurant really is adorable. I especially love the Elvis statue outside. But unfortunately, decor is not enough.

The service is good, the staff is nice, the delivery time is accurate to what they predict. I was between giving 2 to 3 stars, but because of the aforementioned compliments, they get 3. You just got to stick with only one dish apparently.  My co-workers told me, every time they deviate from their usual, it turns out to be terrible. 1 STAR: for the Mild Curry with potatoes and peas: barely any veggies, the tofu was barely cooked, it really felt like it was boiled, plain rice. This dish was so blend. 1 STAR: Beef & Broccoli 5 STARS: All the fried rice. They topped with garnish (green onions and other stuff), it's so good you can't stop eating it. 5 STARS: Chicken Pad See Ewe
Cozy Noodle is INCREDIBLE! The décor is so kitchy and adorable! I recommend the Pad See Ewe and the Crab Rangoon. Yum! To top it off its BYOB : )

I had the $1.99 soup special for lunch and I wasn't impressed. It was bland and just overall not exciting at all. Lunch for $3 isn't bad though. I can't vouch for their other menu items but after the soup I think I'll explore other places.

I've been to this place a few times, and really wanted to like it. Atmosphere and service is great.  Some of the food is good, but the last few times it was just ok. I decided to write this review after I had the pad thai. I've definitely had better. Just lacked flavor.  I'll probably be back, because the menu is great, but I'll be trying new things.

Sah wah dee cap, P'Tee. :) This place is a decent spot if you've got a craving for Thai food in . The noodle dishes and fried rice are straightforward and tasty. Curries are not bad either. The only thing one could complain about is the tight quarters, but with a name like Cozy, you should know what you're getting into.
Not surprised by anything here and that is good.   Straight forward noodles/thai style food.  They are not re-inventing the wheel.  But the prices are  a homerun and for sure will be back.

One of the best Thai places I've ever been to! I had the shrimp pad see ewe and it was delicious. The ONLY negative thing about it was that they left most of the tails on the shrimp. Which wasn't a huge issue, but a little messy. The decor is great. Old toys and gadgets from past decades. The restaurant is on the small side, and it can get pretty packed. But, the food is definitely worth the wait!

The only reason why they don't get five stars is because I'm a snob when it comes to Thai food. Pathetically, it's not even because I'm a Thai food expert but because it's not quite as good as what the West Coast offers. I do love their crispy rice noodle with curry. That's unique to them since it's the only place I've ever had this dish. I devoured this with complete disregard for public restaurant decency. Love the inside of the restaurant. They also exhibited typical Chicagan friendliness. Take the jump and try them out. If you're disappointed, you're only going to be short $9.
Fast delivery but mild and bland food. No sauce on the pad se ewe. No flavoring. Seemed like Chinese food that is called Thai, and not good at that.  NEED good Thai already!!

I met a friend here for dinner this past Tuesday.  She raved about the food here, and there were several good reviews.  We dined sans coupons, so we weren't scoring big on the deals like several other reviewers mentioned.  We started with the steamed shrimp dumplings, and I ordered the shrimp pad thai.  The food came out lightning fast.  Like reviewer, LeeAnne T. said, "It wasn't bad, it just wasn't GOOD either..." That's exactly how I felt.  My friend said her shrimp tasted funny.  I've definitely had better pad thai.  And the quest for a great Thai restaurant continues!
Great food, large variety, BYOB, and one of the coolest spaces with toys and knick knacks in Chicago. Staff is super friendly as well. Highly recommend.

Great noodle shop, crazy decor.  At about $4 / person and BYOB, there's no reason not to check it out.  The servers are attentive and bubbly.  The perfect place when you don't want to expend brain cells making a decision.
eh well my food arrived in a reasonable amount of time and the price wasn't bad. But the food itself was just meh. It was kinda medicocre

I've been here twice since moving into the neighborhood, both times for take out, and I think this place is great. The food is good, not the best Thai food I've had, but still very good, and the prices are excellent.  I've gotten the Cozy House Noodle Soup as part of my order both times and love it.  I think it's going to be my go-to soup on cold and rainy days.   Can't wait to go back and dine-in.  Check this place out, I don't think you'll be disapointed.

This place is really great. I've been visiting Chicago for a week now and have had four or five meals there.  The decor is awesome and BYOB is quite convenient. Prices are good, staff is friendly, and, most importantly, the food is great!
Cheapest sit-down meal I know of in the city, and the food is quite delicious. On top of that, this place is visually stimulating and BYOB. Just a fantastic restaurant run by good people.

Great establishment! I was first told about this place from one of my old classmates who lives off the Addison stop (Red Line). The noodles are nice, the waiters are nice and they always make you feel special. I would definitely recommend you try it. Just remember that if you get the hot noodles, please do not add the spicy sauce, it will burn your tongue! Trust me, it happened to my husband! LOL

It took almost two hours to get my food delivered and I live less than two miles away.  The delivery guy was extremely rude.  To top it all off, the food was awful.  It had no flavor to it what so ever, except some weird taste that reminded me of how a wet basement smells.  I have never been so disappointed in a restaurant!
Such great Thai food, a great place to eat, and if you live in the neighborhood super fast for carry out. Quite possibly the friendliest wait staff and owners in the City of Chicago!

It wasnt BAD, it just wasnt GOOD either.... After recently moving to Chicago from the Best Coast and then subsequently moving to Southport from Old Town, I am on a mission to locate some local Thai delivery that meets my needs for quick, cheap, delicious, delivered to my door NOMS. Cozy has unfortunately been the least impressive of the 6 or so Thai restaurants in the area that I have explored so far.  Tasteless. The only feedback I can provide. It just didn't taste like much. It wasn't gross, or terrible, or somehow inedible. It was just lacking in flavor, spice, anything identifying the dish as something besides noodles in oil. I ordered the Basil Chicken and Pad See Ew, Basil chicken is usually fairly flavorful while wide noodles are usually more mild. But both tasted boring and underflavored.  I will not be ordering Cozy again, since I have Pho's, Tac, Thai Classic, and many others that provided decent and exciting thai dishes.

Oh, Cozy, you've let me down. Where did your delicious days go? Maybe you've got a bad case of Summertime Sadness, I don't know. But after waiting 1.5 hours for really tragic Tom Yum soup and barely edible yellow curry, you've broken my heart. For the love of god, how do you forget to put jasmine in jasmine rice?

A $12 bill including taxes for 2 hearty lunches? We will take it!!! Add that to the friendly impeccable service of the wait staff at Cozy and you have a winner, my friend! Stop here for a lazy weekend after taking a stroll around Wrigley field or catch a quick discounted meal (on the already cheap entrees) by showing your Cubs tickets on a game night. Exploit their $1.99 chicken-based lunches to glory or enjoy one of their coconut curry-based typical Thai fare. Whatever you do, don't miss out on the spring rolls and be sure to Bring your own Booze. Also, stop in awe as you find T the owner, drop in unexpectedly and give away free meals and bottles of water to the wandering homeless on the streets.

to start the review let me say, my wife and i ate here on a friday afternoon and it cost us 12 bucks get completely stuffed. I have very rarely experienced such value for money anywhere in this country and i was really shocked to find this place in chicago.  This by no means the best thai food we have had, but the awesome service which has BYOB along with the beautiful afternoon did make it a beautiful meal. The waitress gave us our waters and wine glasses without even having to ask for them as she noticed us bringing it in. an ice bucket followed and the orders were taken. On weekdays they have a lot of options on lunch speicals and all of them are under 5.99 and the cheapest one being 1.99 along with a side of salad or spring roll. its just mind blowing. i ordered the pad kee mao and my wife ordered the cashew curry. both were pretty flavorful. I must also mention the quirky and really one of a kind decoration i have seen in any restaurant. One incident which really caught my attention during our meal was when the owner of the restaurant rushed across the street with bottles of water when he saw two elderly homeless people crossing the road, handed it to them and just walked back.  I had to mention that because you will sense that kindness and feeling of being welcomed by the waitresses that serve here. Surely going here again to try a few more things on their menu and have a beautiful evening on a budget.

If you want affordable, very tasty Thai food this is a great choice. All of the appetizers are good along with the curries and noodle dishes. It is really hard not to get an excellent dish here. It's funky atmosphere really gives it additional charm along with a very friendly wait staff.  If you are into Thai food, it is an excellent choice.

This place is cute! I took some visitors here for a late dinner - we wanted something cheap, quick, and close to home. We sat outside on their small patio and enjoyed the weather and people watching (Cubs game entertainment).  The food was good - my pad thai hit the spot, and it was a much better pad thai than other places Ive tried. Garlic chicken was too much on the sweet side, my guest didn't like it, and the crazy noodles was fine although my other friend said it didn't have much flavor. But for about $10 per person (including tax & tip), we couldn't complain more.  I still give this place 4 stars.
