Many time when I get home late from work, it's easy to just stop by and pick up something quick and cheap! Also portion is always generous and it's easy to make 2 meals out of it. BYOB and their fun decors are huge plus as well!

What better place to take a retired art dealer and interior decorator than Cozy Noodle and Rice. The place is so hidden away off the beaten path, that I keep forgetting about it. This was my third or fourth visit, but probably not in five or six years. It's just as I remembered it. Fun and festive and colorful with a cute and friendly wait staff-a little more animated than one expects in most Asian joints. And of course you can't stop looking at all the memorabilia and bric-a-brac as you sip some Jasmine tea and munch on tiny egg rolls.  We took advantage of the $4.99 lunch deal, which really is a good one. A choice of spring or mini-egg rolls plus a nice generous entree. It was his first time with Thai, so he copied me and got the Pad See Ew. The thing about theirs is as well as being tasty, it's also visually pleasing on the plate. Nice bright colors (or perhaps it's a reflection off the colorful wall of toys.) Anyway, I appreciate it, having had some very grey versions of Pad See Ew in my day.   Cozy Noodle and Rice would be tops on my list of favorite Thai places in the city, even though I don't get there too often. BYOB makes it an even better value. They also have a buy one entree, get the second at half price for you baseball fans. And you can check out the autographed baseball collection, too. We have tons of Thai here, but I'd have to say this one is the most fun.

I began my relationship with Cozy in 2008 when I moved to an apartment down the street.  Many apartments later, Cozy is still my go to spot.  The food is good and the price is right, in fact they always have coupons and deals going on to sweeten the deal.  I almost always order the red curry which is the right amount of sweet and spicy. The Pad Woonsen is tasty and the portions are enough for to fill you up.  Sadly, I don't live down the street anymore, but I'm still close enough for delivery!

I still really love the food here. And I would even say that I would give it a 4 instead of my previous 3.5 They also have awesome lunch specials if you happen to be around during the day. However, I have tried their bubble tea three different times (3 different flavors) and each time I have not liked how they tasted. I don't know what it is that they put in them but they all have this weird flavor I can't pinpoint and it ruins them for me. Very disappointed about this.
I love this place sooo much! It's just another unique Thai place but I love their style and flavors. I've ate Thai a lot of places and Cozy Noodle & Rice is in my top 5.
Great service and friendly staff. The environment and energy is amazing. I don't think I've ordered anything I didn't like. Can't beat their lunch deals either!
Yummy thai food, kitschy decor, and delicious noodles and boba tea :-) BYOB.  It is a tiny spot, but that's why they call it "cozy".

This place is awesome! My go to Asian take out. The crispy pad see eww is a MUST, I don't think I've gone more than a week without it since I discovered this place. Cute and friendly on the inside and the food is delish! What more can you ask for in a neighborhood joint?

Such a cute place!  I'm really glad we made a reservation for our party of 5 though, as it is small.  I spent more time than necessary in the bathroom reminiscing over the PEZ dispensers and looking for my favorite.  I couldn't choose one. We had a variety of entrees and everyone enjoyed theirs.  I got the crispy pat see eiw and it was good.  It was crispy - duh.  A little too crispy for me but that's my own fault for ordering it crispy.  Sauce was amazing and really flavorful.  The broccoli in it was perfectly steamed and still had crunch.  Am I weirdo cause my favorite part of my thai food was the broccoli?  Probably.  Not sorry. I'll be back!  But I'll probably get my noodles soft.

We had such a wonderful lunch here! We stopped here en route to a Cubs game. I usually wouldn't associate Thai food with baseball, but we saw a sign advertising 50% off entrees with a ticket stub so we decided to give it a try. I tried the bamee noodles, which was a departure from my usual pad thai order. I would definitely order this again! The service was wonderful, and the atmosphere is quirky and fun. We'll be back soon!

Cozy always has a coupon in the coupon mailers I get at my house. I've never ordered from them because I thought the coupon looked cheap and fly-by-nightish.  Last week, I had a little time to kill before a Cubs game and I gave it a shot. Boy, was I wrong about Cozy.  This place is great! The dining room is filled with retro toys and signs. The table tops are attached to antique sewing machine bases.  Very, very cool. The mom & pop family business atmosphere is absolutely perfect! The food is just as good. Whenever I try a new Thai restaurant, I always order the same thing: pad prik.  Cozy's rendition was outstanding. Very spicy--and, believe me, I like spicy--filled with chunks of delicious chicken and a unique, flavorful broth.  Real jasmine rice, too. I'm kicking myself for having skipped Cozy for so long. I'll be back again and again.
Amazing crispy pad Thai! Also, if you're the first customer of the day you get a free appetizer! Love this place :)

Food is so good! I could eat everything on the menu no problem! I don't have kids, but I took my nieces there and it's a great family environment. At the same time, it's BYO and that makes being with your family at a restaurant even better! It's very inexpensive, but don't plan on having any leftovers!! NOM!

This place is fantastic.  First, the food is good, comes out fast.  Wait staff, courteous and adorable.  Also, the decor is crazy.  I think actually the collection of metal robots and the giant fiberglass Elvis mixed with Disney memorabilia is what drew me here in the first place.  That or my friends, who dragged me to this place, which I do not regret.  I actually have a friend that has been here so often that they gave her a t-shirt.  I forget what the t-shirt said, but I would like to think it said "Crazy for Cozy" (note to Cozy: if you don't have this on a shirt, this should be made).   Bubble tea good.  Pad thai good.  Pork and broccoli good.  Appetizers excellent.   One thing - small space, tends to be crowded one weekends, so expect that. Oh, and most of the tables are old sewing machines and you may accidentally put your foot on a sewing pedal and wonder what that might be.  No sewing machine actually starts up to my knowledge.

As with any other college kid, I love BYOB, I love coupons on the back of grocery store receipts, and I love Chinese places within a block from my house.  Points for the weird ass decorations stapled to the walls, consistently okay service, and close proximity to the liquor store.  Call me a creature of habit, but, if you order anything but their crispy chicken pad thai, you're wasting your time.  Basically everything here for dinner is $7, so like, calm down. Actually, their chicken isn't that good, so just work your way around it an eat the noodles.  This is the perfect place to go with a small group of friends and a few 6 packs of beer. There's never a huge wait, and food always comes out surprisingly fast. Portion size is always just a little too much, which is a good thing.  Oh also, there's a $5 minimum on credit cards, so like, that doesn't work well with the lunch special, because most of them hit right at $4.95 if you don't do the cheap soup. And, never grub hub for delivery from here, because it takes literally 2 hours, if not more. (Be sure to hit up the Jewel Osco on Addison and Broadway for that coupon I was talking about...)
I love the quaintness inside and all the knick knacks in the bathroom. Good price on food.
Crispy pad Thai and pad seew are the best! Really cool/crazy decor with pez dispensers all over the women's bathroom

My entire office and I have been going to Cozy noodle for 4 years now. We love it! Great prices, amazing food. Cute atmosphere with all the toys on the walls.   $1.99 lunch special is such a ridiculously good deal. You get fresh chicken noodle soup and a side! The owner, T and his staff are so sweet. I'm very pleased with Cozy Noodle and would recommend it to anyone.

Been frequenting Cozy for a year and a half now.  First off - the staff is so wonderful!  They're nice, genuine, and efficient.  Their lunch special for $5.50 is unbeatable.  Their Pad See Ew is the best Pad See Ew I've had in Chicago.  Not a fan of all their dishes, but overall Cozy rocks =D

Pros:  Cheap.  BYOB.  Kitschy. Fast. Friendly. Cons: Busy. Boring. I swear, every single dish tastes exactly the same. After going here at random times for roughly 8 years, I have realized this. Do I eat there anyway? Yes, yes I do. But I can't say I ever crave Cozy. It's just one of those "Oh, we need to eat, we're walking down Sheffield, Cozy it is." places. Those places aren't my favorite, but they aren't the worst either, thus the A-OK.

Cozy has quickly become my favorite cheat-on-paleo delivery thai place.  That being said, while I find some menu items super tasty, some of it is really lacking. The pros: The tom kar soup is deliciously perfect, just the right amount of spice and flavor. I'm digging the crispy pad thai (crispy pad see eiw, not so much) Although a little sweet, the thai iced tea is tasty and a big plus on getting it delivered The cons: The noodle dishes just don't have the amount of vegetables I hope for/want.  So I tend to avoid them and get soup and rice instead. Overall its decent take out thai food.  I still like Joys better, but Joys neither delivers to my house nor do they offer the "coupons" that Cozy does.

I'll try to keep this short. I ordered  delivery from these guys. Egg rolls and crab rangoon tasted like stale paper.  My pepper steak had 4 small pieces of "Beef" in a pool of brown gravy, kinda like a soup.  The chicken pad thai tasted bizarre, can't even describe it.  And the fried rice tasted greasy.  Paid a total of 40$ for this awesome as hell meal.  There are better thai places in chicago, don't waste your time with these guys.

Good, solid this place.  Fried tofu appetizer was lacking flavor and sweet dipping sauce didn't do enough to make up for it.  Noodle dishes were standard fare but decent. The wait on a Friday night took forever but byob was a positive.  I recommend getting takeout, but the interior decor is something to marvel at as you wait. #vegetarian review

I am not sure I get the high ratings that everyone else has given this place.  It's middle of the road at best. We came in pretty early for a Saturday evening and got a table within a couple of minutes.  Unfortunately, it was the table right in front of the door - if you're seated there, ask to be moved.  Any time someone comes in or goes out, if they don't pull the door shut, you're going to get a draft.  And in the middle of winter, that is not a good thing.  We, of course, did not realize this until it was too late, so we were stuck. With regard to service, it was just ok.  We had to get our server's attention to take our order after we'd been waiting with closed menus for at least 10 minutes.  After that, two of our meals came out and the third followed 5 - 7 minutes later.  Kind of odd on the timing.  Also, we were never asked if everything was ok or if we needed anything else.  At this point, it got a little busier but I guess I don't think it was so busy that we couldn't have been checked on. As for the food, it was also just ok.  I tried the bbq beef with rice that comes with broccoli and a ginger sauce.  Flavor was not quite there on this one.  The beef was just ok but there wasn't a ton of it.  And it was hard to eat the giant florets of broccoli without a knife.  The other folks tried the crispy pad thai - kind of almost like nachos and yet not.  One of them liked the concept and the other did not - they both thought the sauce on the pad thai was way too sweet and it needed some spice to it.  So sort of disappointing in that regard. The portions are not huge but they are relatively fair for the price.  We have 3 entrees for just about $25.   The main thing I think people come here for is the decor.  Rock 'em sock 'em robots, signage, trains, a giant Mario and a giant Elvis, among tons of other things to look at here.  Sensory overload juuuust a bit for my taste.  There's a sign that says if you like something, it might be for sale so there is that. Not somewhere we would actively seek out again.

The one rating is only because I had to give it something to write a review. I ordered Chicken Pad Thai and asked for it to be spicy. Not only was it not spicy, it was bland. It was a big glob of noodles, chicken, and a few peanuts. Nothing else!

Just ordered delivery from here for the first time. Great experience overall. I expect Thai to be pretty quick so didn't love that delivery took a bit over an hour. But the Chicken Noodle soup with Chinese broccoli was FANTASTIC. Terrific crab Rangoon. So-so chicken pad se ewe so I'll try pad Thai next time. Will definitely give them another try.

I came here with a group of friends that persuaded me this place was better than my Thai love, Duck Walk. Having an open mind, I decided to see if they were right. Ugh, I shouldn't listen to non-foodies! Yes, it's BYOB, so we had a bottle of wine and drank, as most college kids do in Chicago. We had the crab rangoon which was fine. Just fine. Not amazing and finger-licking good like Duck Walk's. The texture was soggy and not freshly made. Then I ordered the Lard Na with tofu. My friend had the Pad Thai with tofu. The Lard Na was wayyy too greasy and made me sick to my stomach. The tofu was stingy and rubbery and not the great texture I've been spoiled with.  The service was also pretty crappy. Even though we quickly found a seat upon arrival, the server was MIA most of the time we were there. This was especially nerve-wrecking when were trying to get our bill to leave at the end of the meal.  I hear they have a cute patio in the summer but even so, I don't really care to cheat on my beloved Duck Walk for this place. You can have it.
One of my favorite places, always.  Delicious, cheap, cute place.  Cannot say enough good things!!

I used to go to Cozy Noodle up in Evanston for quite a while, so now that I have a day off and am down in the city, I thought I'd order in from the Wrigleyville location. Ugh, worst mistake ever.  I thought I'd keep it simple, just fried tofu and Pad See Ew, can't mess that up, right? Well, once the tofu was delivered, the condensation inside the styrofoam package made it soggy and pretty meh to eat. It was all right, but fried foods are supposed to be crispy and crunchy, and this was neither. Next was the Pad See Ew, and I would swear if anyone asked me that they forgot the sauce. Like, nothing was covering this madness, which made it even more obvious that the food wasn't great. I couldn't even finish it; the chicken was fine, but the noodles were a bit soggy and the broccoli was undercooked. Needless to say, I'm out $15 and I didn't even get a good meal. Cozy in Evanston, come back to me and save me from this drama!

Absolutely love this place. It's BYOB and the prices are extremely affordable. As far as food, gf and I get the same thing every time we go there: Pad Thai with Shrimp and Crispy Pad Khee Mao. These dishes are SO good we don't even want to venture out on the menu. Their Crispy dishes are definitely a unique offering, they consist of a traditional Thai noodle dish, but with wide, deep fried rice noodles.  My only negative comment is on the appetizers, they just aren't very good and feel like frozen food one could buy at Costco. But with how good the entrees are, who cares?

BEST. THAI. FOOD everrr. I cannot rave enough about this place. Since going the first time i've been back again and ALWAYS look forward to the next time I can come back.  Be careful, it is difficult to find parking and this place is always crowded. It is not ideal for large groups of people since it is a cozy little place (hence Cozy Noodle & Rice). They seem to be short staffed but they are very attentive and quick to refill your water and everything so in their hustle and bustle environment I would consider it very acceptable customer service.  On to the good part: Food: Crispy Pad Thai  (Chicken): outworldly AMAZING! I can't even begin to describe how much i love this pad thai. i dont ever get pad thai at thai restaurants because I find them to be too sweet. But the crispy pad thai is more savory than sweet for me. The noodles are CRISPY and gives the perfect crunch to balance the chicken. It's an experience in itself, GET IT you won't REGRET IT! Pad See Ewe (Beef): There is a crispy option for this, but if you're like me, I can get bored of the same foods and textures easily, so I get this in the normal soft noodle version. So very bomb dot com. It's like beef broccoli with thick noodles, which i love. I really enjoy the contrast between the crispy nature of the pad thai and the softness of this pad see ewe.  What sets Cozy Noodle and Rice apart from other thai restaurants is their crispy pad thai, so if you have to choose one, get that one! But I shared with my friend these two dishes and it was absolutely perfect! I couldnt have asked for better thai food anywhere else. :]

I have been going to Cozy's since I moved here; I loved it at first. It was quaint, fast, and the staff was always nice. The last two times I have been here I have to say that they have really disappointed me. I am not hard to please when to comes service, but if I could I would give this place no stars. The first bad experience I had at Cozys was when I brought my whole family who was here from out of town here. They were skeptical at first because Tai food was not a norm in Arizona. I swore to them it was great and the decor they had to see. They were slow, out of many of the noodles that are offered on their dishes and they brought out the wrong plate for my dad. We recived no apology and we were informed that if we wanted to send it back that it would take 30 mins. It took 40 and everyone else was done eating and ready to go before my dad even got his dish. Again no apology or discount. I held my tongue and swore to never return. I gave in and ordered delivery( I live about a 10 min walk away and was feeling lazy). We ordered our meal and when I was through they did not give us a wait time. After over an hour wait I received a phone call from the delivery guy who was very apologetic for the wait, but said the meal would be here soon. Great! Fine no harm no foul, I am okay with that, long wait with an apology I cannot complain. However they brought us the wrong items. When I called back I received no apology and was told it would take 45-50 mins to get another  delivery. Again implying we should just keep the wrong items. I told the lady that would be fine. It took over and hour and a half. I called to tell them just to refund my credit card and forget it. Cozy's has seemed to forget there reason they are here. To serve their customers the meals they pay for with a smile. I have to say that living in the city offers an assortment of different foods and business should appreciate their customers. A simple apology and we will get your items to you as soon as we can would have been fine, but now this being the second time I will not be going here again. The food is average, what kept us here was the staff and the ambiance. See you later Cozy's I wish you could have held up to our small standards.

I wasn't thrilled with my last order at Cozy Noodle and Rice, but when some co-workers decided to order some lunch, I thought I would give the restaurant another try.  I had previously been less than impressed with an order of golden noodles. I found the dish bland, soggy (the noodles had been overcooked), and severely lacking in both vegetables and chicken. The crab rangoon tasted...off, so I couldn't bring myself to eat them. On this, my most recent attempt at ordering from Cozy, I chose the pad kee mao, and it was much better. The noodle dish had a good spicy kick to it and came with a generous amount of vegetables (though the vegetables were a little overcooked, especially the carrots) and chicken. The orders mini egg rolls that our group shared were very flavorful, but they were also incredibly soggy. I still won't go out of my way to order from Cozy, but I would be willing to order again if that is where my group chooses to eat. The food is affordable and portions are large, and delivery was very quick, but I feel that there are better Thai restaurants out there.
Pad See Ewe. get it. its the bomb. pad thai wasnt incredible, great crab ragoons, cool atmosphere, good thai iced tea. ill be coming back for sure.

How can I sing your praises? The food is always good, the service is always super quick and friendly and the prices are so reasonable! We actually dragged 12 out of town friends to Cozy who were in town for our wedding and they not only managed to seat us (we had to break up bride party/groom party) but made sure everyone had an outstanding meal as well. Check out the seaweed salad, the curries, and the dumpling noodle. You will be quite happy.

I love everything in this place. Including the food. Take out just wouldn't be the same- I need to eat my noodles surrounded by robots and Pez dispensers. BBQ pork is tasty and not too dry, which happens at some places. Big portions, come hungry.

This is one of those charming places that's just as much a feast for the eyes as for the belly. While you wait for your meal to arrive, you can peruse the collection of vintage signs and shelves of toys that cover the walls.

Delicious curry and weird decor makes this a Wrigleyville favorite of mine. I especially like the Disney corner in back. Kind of run into a strange crowd with the BYOB element. The people are also very nice!

I love Cozys!! The food is supper good and reasonable. I also love the kitschy atmosphere! The women's restroom is covered with Pez! Also, it's BYOB which it a huge plus and the workers are extremely nice. Overall, this place is amazing!
This place is worth trying! The food is super good, no cork fee & very cheap. The staff are amazing, always making sure your dinning experience is the best it can be. I will be back!!!

Do not think about ordering delivery.  We have ordered delivery 3+ times per week from a variety of restaurants over the past few years, and I can say that this is the first time we have actually never received our order. Waited 2 hours and still no delivery. GrubHub called the restaurant and Cozy confirmed the food was 5 minutes away. 30 minutes later, still no food. GrubHub finally just reimbursed us the money because they too had no idea why what Cozy was up to and why they were so dishonest. Food never did show up by the way. Caveat Emptor....don't order from Cozy Noodles & Rice unless you want to risk not having any food delivered after 2 1/2 hours and then trying to start from scratch after things are closed. Too many other options and Thai places to waste 2 hours of your life on Cozy Noodles & Rice. Do not order from...

I can firmly say that Cozy has never met my expectations.  I'm not really sure why everyone is raving about this place, I would say their food is barely acceptable, definitely not the best I've ever had.  I've had their food on three separate occasions:   1) Ordered delivery, there was a giant piece of plastic in my food.  All they did to make up for it was offer me a discount the next time I ordered.  Gee thanks, I can't wait to order Pad See Plastic again for 10% off. 2) I somehow got conned into ordering again by a friend.  Took 90 minutes. 3) I fell for the myth (or magic) and decided to dine in with a friend again.  After waiting 30 minutes to order, they brought me the wrong dish.  And they were rude.   Maybe you'll have a better experience than me, but I'd say, "don't do it dude!"

The crispy pad Thai was weird - instead of the regular pad Thai noodles they were wide chunks halfway fried and in no way represented a pad Thai dish besides the lime and peanuts. Crab Rangoon was good though.

This is my go-to spot when I want to treat myself to some good Thai food.  Apart from really good food, this place offers most of their entrees (yes, including dinner) for less than $8.  The portions are big enough too that you can leave feeling full but also have enough left over for a meal the next day.   This place is BYOB (which is great, because it helps keep your bill low). The whole restaurant is pretty small, and every inch of wall space is filled with an old toy.  It's sometimes totally packed, but I've never had to wait more than a few mintues for a table.  The servers are quick and the food comes out fast.   Give Cozy a shot - fast, delcious, and inexpensive for the quality.  Let's hope they never realize how great their food is and raise the prices!
Solid BYO Thai restaurant. Food is reasonably priced and the portions are good. We like the Pad Se Ew and Crab Rangoon, both are really good.
Best Thai restaurant in Chicago. Very generous portions, staff is great, owners are amazing. Make it to Cozy's twice a month.

This place has my favorite Pad Khee Mao ever. I used to order from here 2-3 times a week, and the entree lasts several meals. Everything is fresh and flavorful, and the owners are super nice! There are always coupons online for a free drink with any entree, so win-win!

Love Cozy - I've been coming here for over 6 years now (I can't believe I haven't written a review on it before). I love the quirky atmosphere with old toys lining the walls and tables made from old sewing machines . The food is great and super affordable, they also deliver. They are also a BYOB with no cork fee! Staff is always accommodating and food consistently delicious.  Favorite dishes: Golden Noodles, Crazy Noodles, Pad Kee Mao (spicy), Garlic Chicken

Great Thai in the Wrigleyville area. Large menu but done well. Very cute inside that is byob and would be great for a casual date. The cozy pad see eww is phenomenal. Basically take anything on the menu and get it crispy and its ten times better. Baby egg rolls also a cheap great addition. My favorite local place! They have cheap lunch entree's that come with a side for around $7 that are dine in only.

Oh Cozy. How I love Thee.  When I lived in the area I would get my dinner from Cozy probably twice a week, no joke. The place is small, that's for sure. But the decor is so cute and kitchy, how can you resist?? This is the perfect place for a nice conversation (just not on a saturday night at 7pm), it's intimate and BYOB. The service is great, even though the waiters sometimes have trouble understanding (but I've never had an issue). Overall the owners are super nice and really love their establishment.  The food itself is phenomenal. Never had a bad dish! My favorites are always the mixed apps and Pad See Eww with beef. SO yum! The best part is that the dishes are big and cheap! Less than $8 for most! Whenever I go here it's usually for lunch or an early/late dinner. I avoid the rush at all costs. You won't be disappointed!
Adorable singer sewing machine tables and quirky decor. Had the pad Thai and yum. everyone raves about this place. stop in fer shure.

Unbelievably bad. Not only did it take nearly 2 hours to get our delivery, but once we got it the food was so terrible we threw most of it out (which I literally eat almost anything). The Pad Thai was borderline repulsive - with beef that was just not good. Wouldn't recommend the 'mini egg rolls' or whatever they are either. It's worth the extra bucks to get even decent Thai food elsewhere.

If you make it in Wrigleyville, you can make it anywhere!! This neighborhood is usually crowded because of its proximity to Wrigley field and it takes for a restaurant to continuously put out good food to be able to stay consistently good and that's what Cozy has mastered. The space is very tiny with the decor totally confusing and bizarre (A life size statue of Elvis and the walls crowded with trinkets!!). Like most asian places, the options for vegetarians are aplenty. They do however charge an extra dollar to make dishes without any fish sauce. Me n the hubby tried the tom yum soup, mixed veggies in a garlic gravy and panang curry. The food was good n the whole thing costed us less than $25. But be prepared to wait whether u r eating in or taking food out.

If I were just talking about their food this would probably be 3/4 star.  It is your standard Thai food.  It is very good, but nothing special.   Their service however, is OUTSTANDING! I had a group of 15 people and we had thought that we had an RSVP, but it didn't show.  (I would later figure out that we were at the wrong restaurant, so I am the idiot and in the wrong.) They went to great lengths to apologize and help us out.  Not only were they very flexible, figuring out a seating arrangement that would work, but they hooked us up with a free app as well. You guys know how to take care of people, and I am so sorry for being an idiot.  You guys bailed me out BIG TIME.

Got delivery from Cozy. Took over an hr but that was fine. Food was hot when delivered. I got their Tom Yum soup with chicken. That was tasty!  I also had the beef Pad Sei Weu and it was good, but alittle bland. I think alittle chili sauce could have helped.  Overall a solid place. Will order again.

As you can see, there are enough reviews already however I felt I needed to give my input, too.  Cozy is definitely my go-to for the best thai in Chicago even though I don't live close anymore. The food is always great. However, my last trip here was a disappointing experience.  I came on a Sunday night around 7:30--it was quite busy which I expected. We were seated much quicker than they predicted, which was great. However, once we sat down I think our waitress forgot about us. It took a long time for her to come back and take our order and took almost an hour for our food to come out. Just disappointing as every other visit I have had great service. The food was still delicious and I'll be back.

This place doesn't need more reviews but I feel like after eating here for eight years, I owe it a good one. This is the best Thai place in the city - seriously. The food is great, the decor is awesome and the staff is friendly. My boyfriend lived in Thailand for six months and said this is the best Thai food that he's had outside of Thailand (he actually said it's better than most of the Thai food he actually had in-country). I am a Thai food enthusiast and I've traveled across the country enjoying pad thai, garlic chicken, tom kar...  but nothing rivals Cozy.  Lately they've been a little slow but I think it's just because they're so popular. I can't ding them for that but wish I could still get in and out for a pick up order in under ten minutes. :-/
Cozy Noodle is my go-to spot before or after a Cubs game. So good. The food comes fast, the service is great, and the Pad See Ewe is delicious.
Best Thai food in the area.  This is a great local family owned shop with consistency you can count on.

I ordered a Pad Thai and Chicken Coconut Soup ( total of $16) to-go. Although I waited for 15-20mins for the order to be done, the waiter/ waitress are very nice. I found the soup a bit too milky and the Pad Thai was just average. They have a outdoor patio for sitting, which I noticed a lot of locals like to stay outside to chill. Also, thankgoodness for the parking area designated for Cozy because we all know how hard it is to find parking near Chicago downtown area.

This review is for delivery only, as I've never dined in at the Lakeview location. Even though I live blocks from Broadway and Argyle, I still turn to Cozy in times of need. Delivery time is usually 10-15 minutes under their quote, their specials and discounts are good incentives (I'm partial to 20% off delivery, or free baby egg rolls with a $15 purchase) and of course the quality is there. I love their crab rangoon enough that I typically order two, the steamed shu mai is a winner, and their beef pad see ewe keeps me returning for more. I haven't branched out into much of their menu, but when I want my old standby in a pinch, Cozy's always there for me.

I love this place for take out Pad Thai. Quick, easy, painless take out or delivery. They always offer online ordering specials (20% of delivery, free food with minimum purchases, etc.), so try to order online if you can. I'm a chicken pad thai loyalist and am in love with this place. Great food for a good price ($7.95 for a big portion of pad thai). Love it.

I guess I got lucky based on some of the reviews, but I loved it.  My brother took me here for lunch and I could not be more impressed. Fun decor, great service and great food for a good price. Highly recommended!

Cozy its real deal full of chachkes. GOOD THAI FODD the best shumai and crab ragon The list of noodles is endless and taste like there in Thailand.Tea is brewed BYOB.My choice is crispy wide noodles Pad See and knee mao .

How do you make Thai food bland? Cozy Noodles & Rice has discovered the secret. The food was flavorless and strangely textureless, like Play-Doh. The crab rangoon was sad. I felt queasy the whole next day. Pass.

This place is across the street from my house and I am stumped as to why they are ALWAYS busy. I have ordered Pad Thai for carryout on more than one occasion and it is sub-par; It is extremely bland and the noodles resemble Italian food. Maybe I'm getting the wrong thing...not sure if I'll be back to find out.

I've been ordering different types of dishes here just to find some dishes, which potentially can be my favorites but there was nothing I liked. All the noodle dishes are way too salty and especially crispy pad thai or pad see ewe was too hard to chew. I liked the amount of proteins like chicken or beef they put in those dishes but they are just too salty. Basil chicken was very salty as well and too spicy that I had a heartburn afterwards.  In terms of smoothies, they only use fresh fruit for few of them and rest of them, they use powders instead of fresh fruit and they have sour taste, which I felt really weird about. Those smoothies taste like artificial for sure.  Overall, I'd rather find another thai restaurant for me. I hoped that this could be my favorite restaurant since it is very close to my place. But well, I am done trying!

This place is less than 2 minutes from where I live and good god is it a terribly amazing thing. The atmosphere is ridiculously cute, albeit cluttered, and makes you feel cozy immediately. Even despite the rampant Cubs games and fans that will sometimes be parading around the area loudly, I can't help but be happy that such a place exists. The food has been nothing but fantastic for me. I can never help myself from getting the Tom Kah soup or a side of peanut sauce and jasmine rice whenever I eat here. The noodle dishes have always been perfect for me, as well as their curries.

I would have given a 4 star rating but 1 dish I received, the Chef's special Pad Thai w/Crispy Noodles, was probably one of the worst dishes I have eaten. I am very generous with my ratings and the dish looked great when they set it on the table...but as I was sticking my fork into the noodle, Wapow!, half of the noodle went shooting across the table. The noodles were wayyyyy too crispy. I did not know I was ordering Hard shell taco like noodles.  Aside from that catastrophe, the other dishes I have ordered are pretty good! The service is friendly and efficient. The decor of the restaurant is one of a kind and will keep you looking around the restaurant the entire time you are sitting there.
Bad experience. The waitstaff didn't pay any attention to us. The table next to us got up and left. When the food came, my food was awful.

Cozy is covered in Pez dispensers, serves unmatchable crab rangoons, and delivers with a bounce in its step and a song in its heart. My parents loved it here and it's good for a cute whimsical date or any meeting of friends. BYOB.

I have searched high and low to find better CRAB RANGOON, but to no avail.  If you get it fresh, it is far better than delivery, but it is still good delivered.  This place is such a fun atmosphere, it is worth a trip if you have never been and definitely a fun date spot and BYOB.  I have been going since this place opened and I am a regular.  Everything is good, and they have ridiculous lunch specials.  Try crispy pad see yew, or the other crispy noodle dishes like pad thai, a fun twist on classic dishes.  My favorite Thai food in lakeview!

Ordered delivery from Cozy's over the weekend and I finished the experience far crabbier than I had been before the food got there - and I'm pretty d@mn crabby when I'm hungry.  We ordered veggie eggrolls, fried pad thai, a cucumber salad, and the mixed veggie noodles. Veggie eggrolls were pretty good. Small serving, but tasty. The fried pad thai was covered in chicken per the bf's order, so I can only speak to the small non-meat bite I got, which was alright. Why pad thai needs to be fried is still a mystery to me, but he enjoyed it. So, there's an audience for it at least.  Trouble started with the cucumber salad which was diced cucumber in a Styrofoam cup... and that's all. No dressing whatsoever. I didn't plan on spending $3 on a bite of cucumber in this lifetime, but ok. The veggie noodles were just sad. Somehow my order of "mixed veggie noodles with tofu," which was supposed to be served with wide noodles in a garlic gravy became thin noodles with a broth on the side. Huh? Checking the receipt, they actually rang up some veggie soup thing, not my noodle dish. I understand that mistakes happen, but: 1) I ordered on Grubhub and clicked the exact thing I wanted 2) The $7.75 soup I was charged for ISN'T ON THE MENU! They made up some bland entree dish for some reason -- through a computer glitch or general hatred of veggies, I don't know. But even with significant doctoring efforts with various condiments from the fridge, the best the soup got was "meh." If I had been at the restaurant it would have been an easy thing to fix (or never have to deal with, hopefully), but having waiting an hour for the first delivery, I wasn't really in the mood to try and have the restaurant rectify the situation. I'm assuming they would have fixed the mistake had they been given the chance. Second star = benefit of the doubt.

I've only eaten in once, but the decor is adorable and not your usual chinese restaurant theme at all. A lot of vintage figurines line the walls, which is really cool! The place is very small and cramped, but the atmosphere is also very welcoming so it's not uncomfortable. The staff here are nice, and I always get my delivery in a reasonable time.  This place is ridiculously consistent. If i'm questioning whether or not I want to drop money on Chinese food and not wanting take a gamble, this is always my go to. Everything here I've had is good- pad thai, chicken fried rice, bubble tea and crab rangoon. I even ordered the crispy pad thai by accident one day and it wasn't bad. The only thing I wish was different is more meat choices! Everything here is so spot on though, if they ever had a fuller menu it'd be too good to be true.

Meh. I've only come here for lunch since they have a decent special, but I've never really been impressed.  My coworker and I headed in here the other day, and everything was just okay. I had a Thai Iced coffee which was pretty unimpressive. I love Thai Iced Coffee, but there's something missing here. I also went with the baby egg rolls and the Pad Se Ew with beef--the baby egg rolls were good--I really do love anything that's Thai and deep fried, so they were yummy.  My biggest issue is with their noodle dishes--I've tried a few different things over my last few visits here. The noodle dishes end up being kind of slimy. I *LOVE* Thai food, but this food always just seems to miss the mark. There is a weird meat-to-veggie-to-noodle ratio--I think they could find a better balance.  The staff is friendly, and the campy environment is kind of cute. All the knick-knacks are a little overwhelming, and I secretly love that the tables are made of old sewing machines--it's cute, but odd.  The prices for the lunch specials are nice though--appetizer and an entree for $6, but if your'e in the area looking for a Thai lunch special, I'd recommend Jitlada over Cozy. But for general Thai--go to Thai Classic!
awesome food and cool decor. A little too much sugar in the food but still good

OMG YUM! Stopped here for dinner on Monday before the Cubs vs. Pirates game. Everything was SO fresh and delicious, and the service was excellent. Will definitely be back! Oh! And make sure to check out the decor in the women's restroom! Cute!

We had a fantastic meal here. The crab rangoon is about as good as anywhere else, but the noodle dishes are incredible. And the servings are huge. Being BYOB is always appreciated as well.  This place has crazy decor that is just fun to step into and look around. Just be prepared to wait for a table during busy hours - this place is not big, and it fills up quickly.

Cozys is still great on weekdays, but if it is the weekend or a Cub game the quality goes down...green peppers instead of red....egg rolls taste like old grease..I guess this happens once a place is super busy and just wants to kick out as much food as possible..but it is hit or miss now..

Crab rangoon & chicken pad thai = sooo good! I've never dined in and not sure I would enjoy it since there always seems to be a lot going on, but I am a huge fan of carry out. Definitely worth a visit if you are in the mood for thai food!

Fantastic.  Brought my two year old and she loved the cool decor. Excellent food and service.   I have gone back several times since and I have never been dissapointed.  If you make a reservation and have kids, the back room is great.  Also, check out the bathrooms (no changing tables) as they have cool decorations.

Cozy isn't just a title, the atmosphere is nostalgic and charming great for long time friends or new sparks.  Almost every dish is a hit, you can start with a creamy Crab Rangoon and then be embraced by the bold flavors of a Noodle Panang. Don't forget to satisfy your sweet tooth with a cold and delicious bubble tea.  Cozy is bound to make it on your Top 10 list and the prices aren't bad either. Oh and don't forget to check out the bathroom before you leave, it's not just for business.

I LOVE Cozy.  I'm all about the garlic chicken noodles.  They also taste good cold the next day.   The atmosphere is cute, with toys everywhere and Singer sewing machine tables to sit at.  The outdoor patio is my favorite, though. I always seem to have a coupon, which just makes it better.  The fact it's BYOB makes it even better. And it should be noted the service is ALWAYS friendly and efficient.

Hands down best pad Thai in the city!  Not only is the food fantastically good, but there are so many toys to look at while waiting for your meal!  The woman's bathroom is especially entertaining with nearly every Pez dispenser ever made bolted on the walls! It is extremely reasonably priced, so even with a part time job, I can get my Thai food fix without feeling guilty for going out to eat. This is definitely a regular place for me to go.

Delicious spicy fried rice, always feel welcomed and important , most of the employees greet me by name. Prices are low too , absolutely one of the best restaurants I have ever patronized. Cozy loves me and i love cozy Just have to add, the hospitality I continue to receive makes me feel like I'm family, always look forward to Pam, or the owners Tee and Julie. Always leave with a smile and some of the tastiest food on earth . Keep up the great work!

I have to say, if you're looking for good food, good customer service, a welcoming and cozy atmosphere, then Cozy Noodle is the place. I always feel like a valued customer and I honestly don't have any complaints about this place.  It's a quirky little spot, with a lot of personality and charm.  I have become a regular at this place, and on top of it all, the prices are very reasonable (esp. the lunch special).  The food is consistently delicious, and they are frequently generous with the portions.   Cozy Noodle is definitely one of my favorite spots in Chicago.  Always a good experience.
Love Cozy Noodle & Rice. The food is always fresh and the service is always fast. Be sure to try the vegetables tofu soup!

I like Cozy. I went to Northwestern in Evanston and there are way too many thai restaurants- maybe 8 within a 1 mile radius. Cozy was always in my top 2.  Price- Reasonable. Entree is maybe $10.  Quality- Cozy really shines here. Somewhat creative concepts to old dishes- crispy pad thai is good Quantity- Decent amount of food. After eating you will probably be in a good place; not too much, not too little.  Atmosphere- the decor is unique- old lunch boxes, pez dispensers, elvis statues?? It's like thailand had a baby with the 60s.  Staff- always very polite and courteous. We were seated promptly and as soon as we were done with our plates, the staff cleared them. I definitely plan to go back if I'm in the area. Good food, good staff, good times.

It's rare now a'days to find a place to be a regular for me.  I feel like it just doesn't happen that often.  Cozy Noodles is my regular spot.  Everyone there knows my names and greets me with a smile.  Tee and Jenny, the owners are the kindest and most gracious  and generous people- and care so much about their customers.   The food is absolutely delicious, consistent and cheap.  It BYOB so its my favorite place to walk to and enjoy a bottle of Two Buck Chuck with wonderful thai food.  They have everything! Including free parking.  Thanks for being amazing Cozy!

This place was wonderful! I went there for the first time, a few of my friends suggested it and went with me. They have an amazing lunch special, I received a decent portion (able to be eaten for three meals) and my choice of an appetizer for $5. The staff is super friendly and it truly is very cozy and cute!

Cozy is my favorite! Service is attentive and welcoming. My favorite is the crab rangoon, Tom Kar soup, and Noodles Panang are the best. The atmosphere is cute and kitchsy, but the prices and the fact that its BYOB really cant be beat. The only downside is that it does get really busy but I think thats a good sign.

If you forced me to pick a favorite Chicago restaurant right now, Cozy would be the one. I could stare at the walls with all the zany decor for hours (on our first visit I actually did). Food has always been fantastic (everything is around 7-8 dollars), I can't bring myself to try anything besides the Basil or Pad Prik because they are just so awesome. If you come here and don't get a frozen boba tea then you are seriously missing out.  Only a couple of hiccups here: one is that the dining area itself is small, so it can fill up fast on weekends and evenings. The other is that many of the servers' English is patchy, we've had a couple goofs on our order now due to communication issues--but they've always been quick to correct it, being the nice people that they are. Overall all the good things about Cozy outweigh the bad. Keep an eye on Groupon Now!, they do deals on their sometimes.

Thai food is rarely exceptional. It almost never makes me gasp in amazement at its quality. However, some places tend to stand out as particularly yummy, and Cozy is certainly one of them. The price is good and the portions are ginormous. The best part of Cozy, though, is that the people who work here are very friendly. We came about 5 minutes to close one night and they still let us come in for some chow.  Do yourself a favor and try something besides the Pad Thai. It's all good!

Cozy is a great alternative to pub food when in the Wrigleyville area.  This "cozy" little restaurant is indeed small with space for about 30 inside and another 12 on the sidewalk outside.  Walls are adorned with all kinds of license plates, toys and other (american?) memorabilia.  Overhead music is truly eclectic, from Bay City Rollers, to Classical, to Elvis and is as interesting as the hodgepodge on the walls. The staff is incredibly friendly with smiles and "thank you's", although for some staffers English is clearly not their first language.  That's ok with me, as it is indicative of the authenticity of the place.  Just keeping it real 6000 miles from Bangkok. Cozy has a cool take on spring rolls.  They are slightly doughy and delicate at the same time, filled with fresh and tasty fillings, cut like a Japanese roll, and drizzled with a sweet sauce and topped with a carrot curl for decoration.  Well played and Mmmmm. The chicken soup at $1.99 is easily worth three times that (but don't tell Cozy).  An ample amount of rice noodles shares the chicken broth with fresh, crispy broccoli, green beans, green onions, carrots and chunks of white meat chicken.  Good for the Thai soul!  Terrific! The pad see ewe is tasty wide noodles that are really delectable topped with chicken, broccoli and finished with a wonderfully light sauce.  No surprise Cozy calls this their most popular dish.  I like it spicy, and I ordered it that way, though they took me for your average American Thai food aficionado (spicy wimp).  Not spicy enough for me...  Next time I'll get it "Thai Spicy". Cozy is definitely worth a visit for inexpensive, solid Thai cooking in a friendly, eclectic and fun atmosphere.  Go Cubbies!
Still love this place. However, the prices have increased a little and the service, though friendly, is very, very slow. The waiters almost seemed overwhelmed by the amount of people came in to eat.

I LOVE this place. I get so sick of only have bar food options living in wrigleyville. This place has a great thai food, its cheap, and its decorated really fun plus BYOB. great for a girls night. very quick delivery the only draw back is since it is small sometimes there is a bit of a weight. ps; make sure to check out the bathroom wall decorations.
Pretty small quarters, so I guess it lives up to it's name. Standard Thai BYOB. I'd just as soon go to Joy's, which is like 5 min away and has patio seating, windows that open out to the street, etc.

Great food, local flair and good prices! The specials are very tasty and again, you won't spend an arm a leg and still walk away with a full belly. Every time I've gone the food has been great and the service very good.

I live near Cozy and I have eaten there a bunch of times.  I don't stray too far away from a couple of my favorite dishes (basil leaves w/ ground chicken or beef and the cashew chicken).  Pretty good.
I went to many Thai restaurant in Chicago and I never get bad Thai food like this. The price alway cheap but McDonald is same price better.

disappointed. came here before a cubs game & got my standard thai dish (which i always get when trying out a new thai place): chicken pad see ew.  it was ewww. they forgot the soy sauce and noodles were very soggy. terrible. i've had much better.

-Interesting decor.... -Cute mini appetizers for lunch... the cucumber salad and mini spring rolls were light and tasty. -Co-worker had the pad thai and said it was pretty good. -Had the basil chicken, a little oily, but it had a good flavor.  -Service was ok, they kind of rush you to order, rush you to pay, and rush you to leave but it is a small place and they do get pretty busy so it's understandable.

WOW, all reviews here are right, so right. Mixed appetiser is superb, crab rangoon mouthwatering, vegetable rolls are nice, peanut sauce amazing:O pad thai beef great huge portion, wish i got the crispy pad thai like my gf, mmmm can't wait till my parents visit so i can bring them here

This place is a hidden gem of good food and fun decor. The prices are extremely reasonable and the portions are quite plentiful, not to mention how quick the service was. It is a great BYOB restaurant to start off your evening.

I used to love this place when I lived in Evanston. It's so bright inside, and the walls are lined with vintage toys and license plates. It's hard to be bored here, and the staff is helpful and accomodating. Sometimes there's a language barrier, but they try. I don't like pad thai, so I can't comment. I usually got the pad see ew (spelling, sry), green, or panang curries. I love that each curry dish comes with enough sauce to drench all your rice. Sometimes I even have enough to take home and drench more rice later.  The price is reasonable and I've never gotten sick from eating here like I do at some other Thai places (spice-sensitive tum). Food has always come out quickly.

I really feel like this is semi-misleading rating but I would like to explain. The service is pretty good. The delivery comes promptly when they say that they will (usually around 45 minutes). The waiter will bring you your food. The food itself is really a-ok. I have never been disappointed in what they brought me, whether it was Pad Kee Mao or a curry dish. It's only that I have had really excellent Thai food in my life and know of some really good Thai places in Chicago (Sticky Rice = Bank). I cannot, in good heart, rate them as highly as those places. That said, go to Cozy Noodle. Enjoy the silly decor and the BYOB. White socks of restaurants: Never completely right nor never completely wrong.
Cute a Cozy.... you can't go wrong with this place!

What a disappointment.  We made a reservation for a friend's birthday.  We arrived 10 minutes before our reservation and let them know we were there.  Our reservation time came and went.  We reminded them that we were there and they said they knew.  We waited.  And waited.  And waited.  We asked them how far behind they were running.  It didn't look like any of the tables were leaving soon.  They said they'd be able to seat us in an hour or so.  We confirmed that we made reservations and they said "yeah, we wrote your name down, but other people came in before you so you'll have to wait."  What?!  We had show tickets (and thought we had reservations) so we couldn't wait that long. We called Penny's on Sheffield and they were able to seat us.  They were very helpful and had tables pushed together an ready for us by the time we arrived.  It worked out for the best, but Cozy will not be given a second chance.
Pad See Ewe had absolutely no flavor at all.  Was very dry.
I love this place. The service is excellent. The eclectic design and tasty food makes this place a must go.

This place was just as good as it was hyped to be. Will be a regular stop for me. Good service. Small. Crowded. But very accommodating. What do you want, a warehouse? Sheesh. It's a busy city. Deal with it.  This place is greatness.

Yum yum! I've been wanting to try this cute little place for a while now and am definitely a fan - it was packed at 9 p.m. on a Sunday, which I took as a good sign.  We were seated right away, server was very attentive and prices are extremely reasonable; portions were also pretty impressive for the price you pay. Great for couple or even a small group, but given the place is small and popular, would recommend allowing more time for a larger group. We'll be back!

This place is consistently amazing. Food is great...fast, delicious, noodle-y. Service is always done with a smile. And I love the kitschy wall to wall toys.  Baby eggrolls, steamed shu mai, pad prick, and the panang curry are my favorites.  And this place is ghetto cheap! Family and I went here Monday night. 5 of us with apps, soup, and entrees totaled $62. Add in the BYOB and it makes a really affordable dinner.

I've been going here for about 6 years and it's one of my favorite Chicago restaurants. The food is good, cheap, and good quality all at the same time. The toy decorations are cool and the staff are always friendly. If they started another location in the Goldcoast I'd go there more often.

I've dined here in the past... such an eclectic mix of stuff all over their walls.  This review however focuses on my great experience with delivery. First there is only a $2 delivery charge - one of the lowest around. Combine that with a $15 minimum, and you're in good hands.  I used Grub Hub to order and was really happy when my meal showed up ~25 minutes earlier than promised!  They also offer coupons on delivery - I got an extra 20% off Cucumber Salad - freshly made - probably a whole cucumber in there! Tom Kar - perfect balance of seasoning, broth, and big chunks of chicken and whole mushrooms. It was so piping hot when it got here! Panang Curry w/ Brown Rice - Great... but I was so full that I only had a few bites - yay for leftovers. Thai Iced Tea - awesome The only complaint is that they didn't bring chopsticks and napkins.  They did give me a free bottle of water though.
Super cheap for lunch but well worth it in the evening as well.  The decor is entertaining, the delivery is quick.  Never had a bad meal there.

Two words: Go To. This is my "Go To" Thai spot. Quick, cheap, BYOB, reliable. First off, there are TOYS everywhere. Anyone who decorates with toys is good in my book. And, they switch them out according to seasons and sports, etc. Pez bathroom? 5 year old me would have died. Service is quick and they move people pretty fast so it's worth the wait. Food comes out in a jiffy and they won't rush you out either if you haven't finished your wine or beer. Food is great, cheap. There's always a coupon for a free appetizer or 20% off or something, so make sure to mention it! I'm a fan of the Crazy noodles, but many of their noodle dishes are awesome (and not swimming in sauce). Curry is always good too, as well as their soups. They also deliver, and they're great about that too!

I once ran into the Cozy delivery guy in an elevator and he said that the Garlic Chicken Noodle dish was their best. Of course, on my first time there, I ordered the dish and I'll be danged if I didn't eat a solid 4 cloves of garlic in one dish. When they say garlic, they mean GARLIC! Very eclectic place and I'm positive that the American Pickers would go nuts in here. Their prices are very low and their food is fresh, hot, and delicious. The employees seem to really care about being able to keep prices down for their customers, so they don't treat you like you're merely "another customer." You can ALWAYS find a coupon for a buy 1 get 1 free entree between Sunday and Thursday on the back of your Jewel receipt. Save it!

This is my go-to thai place in the city. I have been coming here for years.  The first time I came here I was fascinated with the decor, thousands of figurines along the wall, the womens bathroom covered in PEZ dispensers, vintage signs every were, its was great! As for the food, WONDERFUL! ALL OF IT! Noodles, entrees, apps, bubble tea smoothies, everything is excellent.  Dining in can be hit or miss. Ive had really, really good service, and really, really bad service. It all depends what time you go. Its quiet during lunch time, but super packed on weekends and for dinner. I usually order for pick up, most of the time it takes less than 20 minute for the food to be ready.  Some of my favorites: -crab rangoon -baby egg rolls -pad thai (obviously) -CRISPY pad see ewe -pad woonsen -green tea bubble tea If you are in the area, you should def go! And as for the $1.99 lunch special, its no gimmick- you get a huge bowl of this wonderful chicken noodle soup and a small order of crab rangoon, mini egg rolls, or cucumber salad. For someone with a small appetite, this is a perfect sized lunch! Look on their website under the coupons/specials tab, they have tons of great offers you can use for dine-in/pick up!

i don't know why this place is so highly rated. i'm asian and i think i have higher standards for asian food and this place doesn't cut it. my friend's crispy pad see ewe was way to hard and difficult to eat! plus it was way too salty. my Pad Prik was pretty flavor-less... it reminded me of bad chinese food. disappointing

For me, Thai food is the ultimate comfort food.  I love noodles!!!  So much of my life is spent in quest of that ultimate go-to Thai place:  that balance of tasty food, low price, and decent service.  And I must say, I do like Cozy Noodle!  I've been coming here for years now, and I they have yet to disappoint me.  Prices are reasonable, the food is consistently good, and the atmosphere is...well...cozy.   I generally alternate between the Pad See Eiw, Pad Khee Mao, and Crazy Noodle.  They are all pretty solid.  Sure, you have to chunk on a bit more pepper sauce, but that's why it's there on the table.   The service has always been pleasant and attentive.  And the décor is just plain cute!  Table bases made of old Singer sewing machines.   Black hawks bobble-heads lining the walls.  And the walls of the women's bathroom are covered in Pez dispensers! Does Cozy blow me away?  Well, no...  But they do keep me satisfied.   So, although that quest must continue, Cozy will continue to merit return visits.

We got this place delivered to the Brew and View, and I really liked it ... but you know what would have been clutch? Utensils.  Even chopsticks.  C'mon ... bush league. Anyways, I got Crazy Noodles, and thought they were pretty good ... but could have been more spicy.

Cozy Noodle is probably my favorite place to eat in Evanston. It could be a nice date place and also suitable for a group dinner. I am not very adventurous with the menu though as I always get the same thing- Pad See-ew with chicken and tofu. It's a good portion and taste really good. I also like that this place is BYO so it's nice to share a bottle of wine or two with my party. It has a very interesting decor with lots of toys and license plates around the walls.I do wish that they offer papaya salad though. It's probably my favorite thai food appertizer, and they unfortunately don't have it on the menu. All in all, a decent place with good service and reasonable price. You can't go wrong with this place.

I can proudly claim I have been dining at Cozy Noodle from nearly its inception (the owner also has her MBA from my Alma Mater if I remember correctly), so really, I am doubly proud. Woot! Woot! This place just warms the cockles of my heart. It is in fact as its name claims..quite cozy so if you're claustrophobic, neurotic, or a jerk please stay away.  The restaurant is oozing charm and likeability with memorabilia, old toys, and advertisements of days long past. The ladies room is plastered with pez dispensers and the mens room is adorn with transformers!  The service is sweet, attentive, and fast and everything on the menu is delicious! My favs include but are not limited to: Garlic Chicken and Lard Na, and FOR THE LOVE OF GOD, YOU MUST ORDER CRAB RANGOON!!!!  Most entrees are under $10 and you could leave with left overs or eat with reckless abandon until you have cleared your plate. It's BYOB which is clearly on everyone's radar and could not be more appreciated given it's location (a hop, skip and jump from Wrigley). This place is one of my all-time favorites. Long Live Cozy Noodle!!!

It really frustrates me when I read reviews and hear people talking about the service, or the fact that their reservations weren't ready when they got there, when the place that they're going is clearly not about that. Cozy Noodle is a hole-in-the-wall Thai place that specializes in getting your food out quick, hot, and tasting freaking delicious, not about seating your party promptly. I go here with my friends, boyfriend, everyone...it has something everyone will enjoy. My past favorites have included: Spicy Beef Salad, Pad Kee Mao, and Golden Noodles. Current favorite, and my boyfriend copies me every time: Red Curry. So deliciously coconut-y and creamy and spicy and...honestly I think I need to go to Cozy tonight.

What do I like about Cozy? Well...what's not to like? This place is great. I'll admit that if you take a look at our GrubHub orders, we are pretty consistent with what we get, so I can't comment on the whole menu. But, like I've said before, I'm a simple girl so a formula that works is always good in my book. And, this one works. First, if you eat in, the place is cute. The walls are filled top to bottom with funky little games of old.  With Pez dispensers, old tin toys, fire engines, and tables made from old sewing machine trestles, there is visual stimulation aplenty. Plus a nice little outdoor seating area in nice weather. The service is consistently pretty nice. And, every time we have ordered takeout (which is about once a week) they have delivered very fast. Of course, we live in the neighborhood so they don't have far to go. But still, we're happy. Now, as for the food...consistent, fresh and a solid value. The cucumber salad is a must in my book. Then we usually order the Chicken Satay with an extra side of the peanut sauce. The Chicken Satay pieces are HUGE! I have had this as a meal and had leftovers. They don't skimp on the quantities here. Hubby likes to get the Fried Rice extra spicy to satisfy his Texas tongue. Not me, I find that too hot, but they do put looks of good veggies in the fried rice an big pieces of meat. My main course usually alternates between the Beef and Broccoli and the Cashew Chicken, depending on my mood. Both are very good. I haven't  had anything else on the menu because even though I've thought of trying the other stuff, my tongue and tummy want the stuff I've had and loved so I never have room to order anything else. Bummer! Oh, and stop at the Whole Foods around the corner because the place is BYOB, babies!! That's right, bring your own beer or wine or whatever, they will supply the glasses and you don't have to pay restaurant markups on the booze. That really helps keep those already cheap Cozy bills down. Yay! Stop by after going to a game at Wrigley and bring your ticket stub and you get a discount!

What the hell? This place sucks. The only reason it gets 2 stars is because of the crazy decoration. Even thuogh the bathroom full of pez dispensers was pretty creepy, I enjoyed peeing while looking at all the different shapes and sizes and faces. And all the bobble heads lined up against the windows..I wondered how it would've been if there were an earthquake. Anyway...I saw the reviews on Yelp and decided to stop by after school since it's literally a minute away.  Beef salad. I asked for extra spicy. It was not spicy at all, rather it was overly sweet and lacked the tanginess of traditional beef salad. Also, the beef was so hard and dry that I couldn't even chew it. Spicy chicken fried rice. I heard they make their fried rice with brown rice so I was excited. HOLY SHIT were my hopes shot down.  It was so salty I cringed. Instead of making the fried rice with brown rice, I think they poured enough soy sauce on it to turn white rice into brown...it was that fucking salty. I had to wash every bite down with my beer, thank God they were BYOB. This was the furthest from Thai food I ever ate. And if there was such thing as sodium poisoning, I would have gotten it. I don't understand how it got such good reviews. TERRIBLE.

Cozy you are my favorite Thai restaurant hands down! I'm going to miss you being one block away. They are BYOB, fast, friendly (they remember me all the time), and the food is delicious. My favorite... Thai Fried Rice, tofu, no egg. Chili Sauce on the side. soooo gooood :)

Usually...this is one of the best Thai places in the neighborhood. (it is a race between Cozi and Jitlada).  Today, the experience was a complete disappointment, and I am talking call out of work sick disappointed.   Granted it was 3 o'clock on a Sunday, which is kind of an off time but this was awful.    Let me go over the course of our lunch.   The waitress was rude...she rolled her eyes at us more than once and we saw her walk away from a few neighboring tables while they were in the middle of their order. We got some hot tea, a cucumber salad, and Tom Yum soup  to start. The soup had vegetables and chicken in it but tasted like dead fish (mackerel I think).  It was so fishy it was inedible.  I am not sure where that flavor even came from.  Hopefully, not the chicken!   For the main course we got the Noodles Panang and Pad Woonsen.   The Panang was ok but the Pad Woonsen noodles were way over done and when I was near the end of the dish I almost chipped my tooth on a ROCK! Literally, a piece of stone!!!!!   Yet another mystery ingredient to the food.   Like I said  I am usually a fan but, I guess it will be Jitlada for a while until I forget this experience ever happened. That might take a while.....

Cozy Noodle is, by far, the best delivery Thai food I've had in Chicago.  I'm eating it as I write this from my couch.  Fresh, authentic, consistent.  Fell in love with Cozy living in the neighborhood and going into the quaint, kitsch-filled dining room for 2 for 1 entree deals we found on our Jewel receipts and on delivery menus.  If you live in the hood, keep your eyes peeled for coupons -- they give out so many you will start to feel guilty for using them, I promise. The restaurant itself is tiny, tables are small, and the style of service is somewhere between traditional noodle shop and dinner at your friend's parent's house.  I have read other reviews talking about reservations and service... not really what you go here for.  My experiences have been all over the map, but maybe it's because I am a server I can overlook the failings by having reasonable expectations.  At least one person smiles at me every time I go in, the owners are very sweet and have remembered my boyfriend for years, and I'm not disappointed I can't have more in-depth conversation with my server.  More importantly, the food.... We are both guilty of ordering the same thing at Cozy for months at a time, if not longer.  Staple orders include, but are not limited to: -- Pad Khee Mao (delicious soft wide rice noodles, a lot of fresh vegetables, spicy! and I want it every day) -- Golden Noodles (we order spicy -- Cozy Noodle single-handedly converted me from heat-wimp to red chili flake lover) -- Broccoli Beef (light almost broth-like sauce with al dente broccoli, tender beef and LOTS of shaved fresh ginger root... awesome) -- Noodles Panang (creamy, lightly sweet curry with a hint of spice, menu dish comes with large crispy noodles that aren't great for delivery, so they happily replace them with soft rice noodles upon request) -- Tom Kar (spicy, perfectly done coconut milk base, I go mixed vegetables, so good) The curries are good too, milder and mellow.  Tom Yum soup, bright and refreshing and really good.  Only thing we usually skip are the appetizers.  The Crab Rangoon are the best I've ever had (though cream cheese belongs on bagels and not Asian food for me), but all the rest are golden fried, semi-bland sauce vessels for me.  And, of course, that sauce is excellent. Delivery is affordable, friendly, and fast (29 mins today!!), and I have yet to have an issue with my order.  Cozy Noodle is fresh, delicious, and healthier than ordering a pizza.  If I don't get my weekly Cozy fix, the cravings get out of hand!!  I love you, Cozy Noodles and Rice.

We had a horrible experience here.  I made reservations for a party of 10 for a friend's birthday.  We were going to a comedy show in the area so planned the meal with enough time to do both.  Our reservation was at 8:00 but they told us they had us down for 8:30 on accident and we had to wait.  So at 8:30 I asked when we would be seated and she told me IT WOULD BE ANOTHER 45 - 60 MINUTES. So I asked what was the point of making a reservation 2 weeks in advance and she said "we take reservations as a guideline.  That does not mean we will actually have a table" Wait. What?  Isn't that the point of a reservation?  So after standing there for 30 minutes already we had to leave.  There was no way we could wait and still make our show.   SIDENOTE:  I have eaten here before and it's good thai - but Joy's and Penny's (where we ending up going and they were super nice and accommodating) have WAY better food and aren't rude to customers.

They have some of the best Thai food I've ever had in Chicago & it's super easy on the wallet! I've been going for a number of years now and I've never, ever had a bad meal there. They're also BYOB, with no corkage fee, which is always nice. (Their low prices + great food + BYOB status make it a great choice for treating your friends to a birthday dinner.) They do get pretty busy at night, but even then I've never had to wait more than 20-25 minutes for a table. The decor is bright and the restaurant is filled with old toys from years past. The bathrooms are covered - floor to ceiling - in pez despensers and other toys. It's quite fun to look around at all the crazy stuff on the walls. They have a tiny parking lot that barely fits 4-5 cars and street parking is possible but not super easy. I just wish they weren't so far from my house!!!

I respect anyone who has something negative to say, but DON'T LISTEN TO THEM! This place is wonderful. The food is amazing, staff is friendly and the decor is the icing on the cake. I've been eating here for years. Their lunch special(s) can't be beat! I've eaten here for lunch, dinner, carry-out, delivery...you name it and they haven't let me down. A MUST TRY if you're in Wrigleyville.
Awww, I used to live across the street from here so I ate it all the time.  The baby shrimp rolls are yummie, good standard pad thai, cool funky bizarre place to sit inside and eat at.

Such a great local place.  I love taking my nieces and nephews here when they come in town - the decor is really fun.  I also love going here with friends for the BYOB.  It has wonderful food and great service - not only that it is not very expensive.

What can you say?  Excellent food at an incredible price.  I go here all the time with my husband for the lunch specials.  They range between $4.99 & $5.99 and you get an appetizer and the entree.  The food is consistently great and I have never had a bad experience.  They are also very friendly, especially to my young daughter, and as a mother, that means a lot to me.

Awesome decor, mediocre food, poor service. I loved how it was decorated.  It felt like eating inside a toy store.  Lots of old tin toys and robots.  A giant Elvis statue.  Vintage signs on the brightly colored walls. I ordered the Dumpling Noodles (Stuffed shrimp dumpling, Chinese broccoli, bean sprouts, egg noodles and BBQ pork. Served in clear broth).  The pork was tough and leathery.  Didn't taste "barbecue-y" at all.  Some of it was gray, which I don't recall being a good color for pork.  Eeesh. The waitress failed to bring one of my friends the soup he ordered.  And she never checked up on the table to see if we needed anything.  The table didn't have any silverware where I was seated, so I spent a lot of the meal wiping my mouth with my bare hand. It's a shame Cozy Noodle didn't put as much attention on their food and service as they did their decor.
Place is fantastic. Very cheap, comfortable atmosphere and amazing Asian cuisine. Look forward to eating here more often

I'll start with the positive - they allowed me to switch my order when I accidentally left a few things off my online order.  The delivery guy was nice and there were no glitches. However, the food was pretty subpar.  The mild curry was bland, the spring rolls didn't taste very fresh and didn't have a lot of vegetables in it.  The potstickers were nothing great.  Not terrible but I won't be going back when there are so many other great thai places in the city.

Ordered delivery to the Brew & View which was convenient but with two big errors. They forgot to give us utensils which was requested in the original order. How they expected us to eat our dishes with our hands was beyond me.  Yet the biggest error was that my girlfriend ordered the mixed vegetable noodle dish but with one major thing missing... NOODLES! How they could forget the noodles in a signature noodle dish is ridiculous.  Bad Cozy... very Bad!

Don't think I could add much to all the praise heaped on this place - it's fantastic. Cheap, great food and service, and completely adorable atmosphere. My one tip - eat in restaurant if you can - the portions are much smaller if you get delivery!

Favorite place for a quick bite out or delivery in Chicago. Whether you're dining in or having delivered they're great with timing. I would order from here all the time and not once did I feel I had to wait too long. My suggestion as far as the food Crispy Pad See Ewe and Crab Rangoon. I now live 2000 miles away in LA and I've been craving Crispy Noodle since we've got here. Restaurant is cute and "cozy", and staff is super friendly. They also offer some great coupons online.  Highly recommended.

These Noodles are Crazy! Crazy! Crazy! I had a bit of wine when we went here and kept saying that.It wasn't really funny to begin with, but even less so when I found out the name of the place was actually Cozy Noodle (not Crazy Noodle).         Anyway, the food doesn't really separate itself from the 10,000 other Thai joints in the city. However, the atmosphere is so interesting (an Elvis statue and walls lined with strange toys), its BYOB, and it's pretty inexpensive($7-$8). Probably, closer to a 3.5, but it's Christmas time, so lets round up.

At first glance, this may seem like another cookie-cutter Thai place. Cheap prices and all the standard menu items. However, this place does not deserve such a discredit. Food is far above any other thai I've had in Chicago. Much fresher, much tastier. Menu also has some neat twists on standard items (cripsy noodle versions). Salads are delicious and Tofu is great. Super attentive staff ready to fill water and help out but that don't annoy. Place is most definitely 'cozy'. ie- small tight seating and fills up quick (especially given it is BYO) so you may have a little wait on weekends and peak times.   Can't beat getting a bill for two with an appetizer and 2 entrees at just over $20. Amazing. Highly recommended

I have been going to cozys for years and years now. I found it in college, and it has been a spot to meet the girls, take my mother, or order in with my boyfriend.  Our absolute favorite thing to order on the menu is the vegetable fried rice, but with brown rice... so good!  The people who work at Cozy are wonderful, and that is why I keep coming back. You want to give them your business.

Toys lining the walls? Check.  Tables made from antique sowing machines? Check. Great tasting food? Oh mais oui.   This place has great atmosphere, great food and ultimately a great vibe.  I used to live two blocks over, and this was a perfect go-to place, especially in the winter.  Now, it's mostly delivery, or when visiting friends in the area.  I became a regular when I lived nearby, and I stayed a regular even after moving a few miles south.   Try the panang curry, try the shrimp rolls, and wash it all down with a thai iced tea.  I haven't had anything here that disappointed me, and considering I'm still getting food from this place, I still haven't been disappointed.
