No offense to Penny's lovers, but this place is five times the restuarant in terms of food, price and overall experience.  When you eat there, you'll know why so many people love this place....  Update: Not sure what happened but they've become somewhat inconsistent with their meals.

As you can see from all of the stars and reviews this place is awesome.  I usually order take out or delivery and always get the Pad See Ewe or the Pad See Mao (sp?).  Really delicious and cheap.  What more could you want from Thai?

BYOB is sweet.  The decor is unique and you could go a few times before you have a chance to appreciate everything.  The bathrooms are cool.  Service was great.  Was pretty chilly cuz its a small place & the door always opens cuz its a small place.  Food was good but nothing spectacular.  Definitely a great place to hit up & try somethign new.  Good cozy place for conversation

Cute atmosphere, yummy food and very nice staff!  I loved the Rama dish... My bf lives down the street and suggested it.  I can't wait to go back and try more!  No alcohol but it's BYOB.  This place is always busy and now I know why.   I suggest lunch time rather than dinner if you don't want to wait.  They also deliver and do carry out.
hands down best thai food in chicago.  atmosphere is awesome, prices are cheap, and byo!

Ordered the veggie egg rolls (they sent me "baby eggrolls"), potstickers, panang noodles, tom yum soup and pad see ew.  All were bland, tasteless and severely disappointing. I even specified that I wanted the panang "spicy" and it was a creamy mess of soggy vegetables and dry chicken. The good news is the delivery was decently fast and the delivery guy was friendly. Not enough to have me patronize this place again. Stripped of all the cutesy decor, the food is just bad.

Oh Cozy how you have disappointed me.   This used to be my favorite Thai place.   I will say I was never very impressed with the bland pad see eiw or the pad thai.  I was just obsessed with the panang curry with crunchy noodles.  I only ever ordered takeout.  LOVE their potstickers, mostly because of the sauce.   Then I ate in... not a good experience.  This was post City Chase and we were exhausted.  Order my standby and it was bland.  The bubble tea was not doing it for me either.  Then the delivery truck backed up to right where we were sitting and spewed exhaust and black grime all over us.  Not ok but I let it go and went home.   Then I decided they deserved another chance and I ordered in my trusty standby and it was the worst curry I have every had in my life.  What happened?  It seems that if you don't specify that you want your curry spicy they give you this spice free slop instead.  If I didn't want spicy I wouldn't order curry.  WTF?  Cozy, you are dead to me!

Yet another mediocre, at best, Thai/ Asian fusion restaurant in Lakeview.  It's kitsch and if the food were good this would be a nice neighbourhood eatery, but alas, it's not.  In a neighbourhood with other Thai offerings, better to seek out somewhere else.

I love this place. I have been going here for years. The food is great and the price is right. My only complaint is that the restaurant is very small and can feel cramped. It is common to wait for a table for a half hour or so. But it always proves to be worth it. The staff is r as well.

meh.  was visiting friends in Chicago and decided to order in. I was really underwhelmed/ disappointed after all the good reviews. ordered tom yum soup and crab rangoon. meh tom yum, and the crab rangoon was pretty much just cream cheese. i usually get my Thai food at sri in wood side ny, or chao thai in elmhurst, ny they push the bar up HIGH.

Just ordered some food from this place. My friends and I made a group order for pickup since it's incredibly close to our apartment.  We ordered the pad thai, crispy pad see ewe, and two mango bubble teas. Walking into the establishment, the interior was cramped (cozy I suppose). As I picked up our food, the girl who greeted me spoke very quickly and with an accent, so it was difficult for me to comprehend. (which is absolutely not her fault).  When I got home, we saw that they completely messed up our order. The free crab rangoon (which is free with a $20 order) was missing, we didn't get mango bubble tea, but taro bubble teas instead. Since it was 10:20pm and the restaurant closed at 10:30pm, I didn't think it was worth it to call and get our order fixed. My friend's pad thai was bland and the pad see ewe was way too salty. Although this place is close, I don't think I'll ever order from here again.
i love thai, i really do.  but this was honestly the worst pad thai i've ever tried.  i give 2 stars, because the byob wine took the edge off.

I adore this place :) Used to live a block away, and would dine in or get carry-out any chance I could get. The restaurant itself is just adorable, like you walked into an toy store, and the staff are just the nicest, sweetest people. The food is excellent, one of the tasiest Thai places I've been to in Chicago, and their unique crispy menu is to-die-for! You've gotta try the crispy pad thai :) I'd recommend this place to anyone at anytime
The food is very tasty and not expensive at all.  What makes this place even better is the exceptionally friendly staff and servers!

We love it here! Been going for years. It's just basic, tasty and affordable. We even live outstide their delivery area and go and pick this up because it's so good. Owners and staff are always friendly and accomodating and food is fresh and lovely!  We live near Spoon and Sticky Rice and we STILL prefer Cozy! It's amazing and delicious.
BYOB, very reasonably priced, fast service and cute kitschy atmosphere. Best Crab Rangoon that I've ever had.  And the bathrooms are very cool.

This place is simply adorable.  The interior is a cheerful yellow and lined with vintage tin toys, very pleasant sitting in there.  The staff are sweet, sweet people.   The food itself is pretty average.  A friend of mine got the crunchy noodles, which I tried and they were disappointingly painful to eat, however the taste was good.  Yesterday, I felt under the weather and so prescribed myself some Vicodin and "Asian soup" so I schlepped on down to the Cozy Noodle.  I was a little upset that the counter person upsold me away from the lunch menu (where my soup would have been $5 instead of $9... yikes) and when I got it (to go) I received a box of vegetables and noodles, and then a container of broth.  The broth was good, but there was barely enough room in the veggie/noodle container to pour any of it in.  Also, the broth did not stand up to the vegetables it was so mild.  I was hoping for something like Tom Kha or Pho but it was more like a very mild, garlicky soup with unspiced vegetables.  Pretty meh.  I would go back, however, because of the atmosphere, service, and proximity.

*Review based on delivery only. My main man and I have ordered delivery from Cozy twice now, both times with relatively quick, hot, deliveries.  They also always have coupons, from those mailer packets and from their menus - even if it's for something small, I always appreciate those coupons!  Their prices are fair to begin with, but adding a coupon results in even happier customers.  :-) Penny Noodles gets our undisputed #1 spot for chicken pad se eew; the #2 spot goes to Cozy!   (side note: why is it that every single restaurant spells pad se eew differently?  I have no idea what the correct spelling actually is.  Same goes for "lad nar" a.k.a. "lard nar" a.k.a. "lad na") Cozy also offers the 'crispy pad se eew' option.  Which, I think is just a tad too crispy, it's still pretty awesome.  Our most recent order, we mixed one standard pad-s.e. with one *crispy pad-s.e., and mixed and split them - and THAT was a good combo.   Have also tried the crab rangoon, which was great (one of the best I've ordered around here), and the shrimp potstickers (okay, but wouldn't have to have them again).   If their delivery is this good, I suspect their food would be even better in house - hopefully will try it there soon!

I placed an order for delivery and it came within 30 minutes, even though GrubHub said it would be an hour and 15. I ordered the crab rangoon, steamed potsticker, rice soup and wonton soup. I probably wouldn't have ordered that much food for one person, but there was a $15 minimum on delivery, and I always order more food than necessary. I def would have gotten a pad thai or something along those lines, but I had a sore throat and mainly needed soup, so I will venture out next time.  I then got a 15 or 20 % football discount off my whole bill (ordered through grubhub.) The crab rangoons=awesome!!! I'm definitely the worlds biggest crab rangoon fan, and these were great. Great flavor, great size, great dipping sauce which was different than my usual duck sauce. Potsticker= pretty good, but sort of bland as I usually find them to be, not really sure why I ordered them.....I think I was just hungry, or sick of a 3 day soup diet. The wonton soup was delicous, I ate it all in one sitting.  I'm excited to order some real food from this place next time when I'm not sick......crab rangoons will definitely be on my next order!!

Love this place, would probably give them 4.5 stars.  I have had their chicken pad see ewe many times.  I thought the chicken was slightly overcooked and chewy this time but still love the noodles and sauce... I don't think I could go to Cozy without having this dish.  Also got the crab rangoon, and the reviews were right!  It was awesome, and the sweet and sour sauce could have been the best part since it also has just the right amount of spiciness. The wonton soup was sooo good too, both the broth and shrimp wontons were very flavorful.  I will look forward to ordering this on a freezing day this winter.  In the past I have had the baby egg rolls, to me they are just okay, nothing special.  More than anything, they are just cute and tiny :-) I have eaten at the restaurant many times, got delivery once.  Their delivery was okay.  I placed an order at 11am on a Friday and it took over an hour to get to me, I was a little surprised about that.  But I would much rather it take a little longer and have fresh, well made food than get some junk delivered to me very quickly.   This is a great place, I recommend it 100% their food is a great non-greasy, well flavored Asian food option!  Oh and prices are very reasonable too (check website for lots of coupons).

Cozy Noodles is just that, a cozy restaurant located in Wrigleyville that's well worth visiting - over and over again. The DH and I have been to Cozy over 30+ times since moving to Chicago 2 years ago. Although I always opt for the mild curry and the pad thai, my husband has tried a good number of different plates and never complains. It's a great price, the wait staff is very sweet, BYOB, and located near our place. No complaints. Cozy Noodles is excellent!

After a long on and off hiatus, I decided that writing a few reviews might change my otherwise mundane life to something a little more titillating. Having lived in Chicago for a few weeks now and having visited countless establishments both lauded and worshiped, that spark to write a review hadn't been ignited up until today.  I can't say Cozy Noodle is the best Thai food in the world because it isn't. What I can say is that their service is top notch, their nichey decor is genuine, and their food matches the nearby clientele quite well. I respect Cozy for their prices and portions. The food is less greasy and salty compared to other Thai foods I've had. I can't say much more about the food but the energy and spirit in here alone is worth a visit.

I'm going to give this place 3 stars, I've ordered food from this place a couple times and while the wasn't bad, I did not think it was outstanding.  The one thing I do order from here on a semi regular basis is their bubble tea, which I think is of the best in the area.  I may try ordering from here again as I see a lot of people give this place high reviews for the food, so maybe I did not pick the right items when I came here before.  If your looking for good bubble tea, this is the place to go.

service was great. they were really nice and engaging. cute personalities. was the decor cute? uhhhh not for me. all those dolls and toys and ... yea. no. i'm more of the modern, simple, clean type of gal. that whole mess doesn't work for me so i was glad we sat outside. although.. there was a mouse running around very near us that was not pleasing. i give this place only three stars because the food wasn't amazing. it was way tooooo salty. we had their BASIL CHICKEN.. which was a little confusing because the basil flavor was not evident. we also had one of their soups which was supposed to be spicy.. but it was not. oh  yea! the basil chicken was supposed to be spicy (enough for them to warn us about it) but it was not spicy.. at all. blehhh.. the only thing i really enjoyed was their CRAB RANGOON. it was so goood!! oh yea.. their shumai was pretty bad too.. it looked and tasted like the ones you buy at supermarkets. the ones that taste like the plastic it's packaged in.. not cool at all.. would i come back here? probably not. would i tell someone not to come here if they wanted to try it? probably not. in other words.. wasn't my fave but it wasn't horrible. i wouldn't recommend it initially to anyone though.

I adore Cozy Noodle more than I could possibly express in words. From the kitchy decor to the delicious food at reasonable prices, this is one of my favorite spots in all of Chicago. Be sure to look out for coupons on your Jewel receipts--sometimes you can get a BOGO on entrees or a free appetizer and it really makes for a delicious and inexpensive meal.  By far my favorite item on their menu is their crab rangoon--normally I find rangoon to be mediocre, mushy and just, meh. They take this appetizer to a whole other stratosphere.  And don't forget, it's BYOB. Love Cozy so much!

One of the cutest restaurants in Chicago.  This is a must-see when you have guests in town; they will remember it forever.  And not for amazing food (although it's not bad).  What really stands out is the killer atmosphere and friendly people.  But how can you not feel friendly in such an uplifting nostalgic little noodle place?

Went here on a saturday night after a cubs game let out. Ate delicious tom yum soup and  cashew chicken. The soup actually had some sweetness which I haven't tasted before and the vegetables and protein (I ordered tofu) were abundant.  The cashew chicken came in a generous portion and was well-seasoned and not overly cooked. The service was very attentive and pleasant. The only drawback is the size of the place which makes for a very long wait time. I would not risk parking my car in that nano-sized lot. Even though the menu isn't drastically different than the other Thai places I've been to, I really like the ambiance and the customer service.  I have to give this only 4 stars because I haven't tried that many dishes yet but I would trust that the others be very good and authentic.  It's on my list for places to visit next time, Chicago!

I seriously do not know how you could not love Cozy. It is the perfect restaurant. Clean, timely, and cheap. They always have a lunch special and coupons, so if you can't seem to manage the average $7 per plate, they have you covered. I have eaten in the restaurant, gotten take out, and delivery. All were done to perfection. If you are looking for a place to take out of town visitors this is the best spot as well. The decor gives you something to talk about, its BYOB and again, super affordable. It is how dinning should be.

Had my first experience with Cozy yesterday and to say the least it was ok. I had the Noodles Mixed Vegetables and wasn't sure why there weren't any noodles in my dish?  On the side there was a container of what looked like deep fried broken wide noodles.  Not quite what I was expecting in a noodle dish.  My friend got the Crazy Noodles with Shrimp and those were pretty good so we both shared those.  Just a little frustrating when you're expecting a noodle dish and all it is is a bowl full of vegetables.

Seating layout is a bit cramped, but the service was great. Food is good, but not spectacular; however it is a novel experience to eat in the presence of a Shogun Warrior! ( wildtoys.com/shogun/Shog… )

Found Cozy Noodle & Rice after a tour of Wrigley Field. The Wall outside said 10% discount with ticket stubs, so we asked if the tour counted. They Accepted! STAR!! Friendly Staff! Cool Eclectic decor. Full sized "Wayne John." And a Tall barbie that scared me in the bathroom  Seating for 5 was quick on Sunday evening.  Dishes were overall delicious. Just a little smaller in the portion sizes than the group expected. Good thing we planned to fill up on drink after.  -Spring rolls: I wouldn't consider ordering that again. Mostly just a soft  wrapper drizzled with sweet sauce. -Yellow Chicken Curry: Kinda skimpy on the chicken and veggies. There was a lot more curry sauce.  -Pad See Ew: A usual at all Thai meals I have. It was Good.  -Crispy Pad Thai: Wanted to try something new. I liked it, but my friends didn't like it too much. I guess we all kind of expected the classic thin noodles, but crispy. The noodles were like fried wonton wrappers with Pad Thai taste.  Again smaller portions.
Amazing service, yummy food, good prices, and adorable atmosphere. What more could you want?

This place is great! We've ordered from them a few times, though with minor issues each time (once a forgotten item that was never refunded or replaced, once a two-hour delivery time, and so on) and been in there for lunch a few times. Honestly, the one star off is just from those delivery issues, because the food is delicious and the waitstaff is always friendly and speedy when you dine there. Their $5 lunch specials are the best and I haven't found anything close to beating them in taste or price!

Pretty decent Thai food for your money, but nothing to write home about.  Their delivery service was pretty quick the couple of times I've used it, which was nice.  I like their curries (particularly the red), but the noodle dishes fall into run of the mill, IMO.

I got takeout and paid $30 for three entrees and two appetizers (the crab rangoon was free with a purchase of $20+). I went with the green basil chicken which was tasty, but the proportion of chicken to vegetables was too high in my opinion. Chicken Satay strips were huge and the peanut sauce was some of the best I've ever tasted.  The interior looked cozy and the staff was helpful when I picked up my food. I am looking forward to trying some of their curry the next time around!

Pad see ew was decent. We asked for spicy and yes, it was spicy. Good job. It was a bit salty though. Crab rangoon was nothing to brag about. The sweet and sour sauce was a bit runny. The potstickers did not seem like there was anything inside. And the soy sauce given was a bit too thick and sweet. Outdoor seating is nice though. Not sure if I'd make an effort to come back.

The crab rangoon were yummy! The pot stickers were a bit too fishy for me (I believe they're shrimp - also, they were fried and I prefer my pot stickers to be a bit more succulent and soft). I had the Pad Woonsen with Beef and it was delicious! The veggies tasted fresh, and the flavor was spot on. Plus, I have a thing for those see-through noodles :D My friend had the Bame Noodles and he said it was good but it was too peanuty for my taste. It tasted like peanut butter noodles to me with meat and I don't like that; I like to keep sweet and savory separate. For these 4 dishes the check came out to $27, and I think that's pretty reasonable, especially for the area AND it was a good sized meal for the two of us. Check it out if you're in the area and looking for some decent Thai!

I love this place. You get a lot of food for your $. The pad thai is great, not that it's the most authentic tasting, but still delicious. The Tom Kar soup is also really good.  The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because when they deliver food to me, they never include chopsticks and soy sauce :(

LOVE Cozy Noodles!  I used to live right around the corner from here and we would go there quite often.  It is always busy and that is a good sign.  BYOB.  My favorite dish here is the garlic chicken.  I always order the crab rangoon which is always great.  The servers are all very friendly.  Food is always out very quickly and they are very consistent.  The food is always right on point and tastes great!!  I would say one of my favorite things here is the decor!  It could keep you entertained the entire time during your meal.  There are tons and tons of toys all over and old signs.  Its so interesting!  I would definitely recommend this for a great cheap and delicious meal!
One of my regular go-tos for Thailand.  I've only had better Thai food in Thailand.  I usually grab carry-out, but it's a fun place to dine-in as well.

The lovely Jerry M and I met for lunch here one weekday. I had been here once before, long ago and didn't really remember much about it - except the decor. The decor reminds me of Club Foot; there are toys and figurines everywhere; there are also an assortment of license plates and jewel-top sewing machine tables that serve as two-tops. It's kitschy, kooky and kreepy all at the same time (sorry, had to keep the alliteration going).  We picked the place based on location, but they do have a pretty stellar lunch special. For $5, you get a choice of three starters (cucumber salad, egg rolls and spring rolls) and one of six different noodle dishes. I opted for the cucumber salad and shrimp pad thai (shrimp is a few dollars extra).  The cucumber salad was good, but not what I expected. The cucumber was cut into little nuggets and seasoned with what tasted like some sort of vinaigrette. Service was efficient, almost too efficient, I got my entree before I had the chance to finish the salad.  So why 3.5 stars? Despite being new to Thai, I wasn't that impressed with my pad thai. The size and texture of the noodles surprised me. The noodles were wider than expected, they were the width of fettuccine as opposed to ones the width of linguine. The noodles were cooked al dente; I'm not sure whether this was intentional, but I didn't care for the firmer texture. While the portion was generous, the flavor fell flat with me.  Prices are reasonable - the lunch deal is a steal IMO - the space is cute, it's BYOB, and service is friendly, but the food just didn't impress me. I might be back, but I'm in no rush to do so.

What do Elvis and Thai food have in common? I didn't check Wikipedia for confirmation but I'm assuming...absolutely nothing. Nonetheless, there's a person-sized Elvis to stop and stare at should you happen to find yourself at Cozy's.  I had a most random order of stuff yesterday, I just couldn't decide what I wanted. I haven't even touched my pad woonsen yet, as I got full off of the appetizers. Everything I tried thus far? Yum. So very yum. Not greasy, no weird after taste, and I don't feel nauseous in any way. These are very vital aspects of my Thai food dining experience. And it's within walking distance of my place. What more could I ask for? Well...I could ask for a life size replica of Jimi Hendrix to be placed next to Elvis. How cool would that be?

I had never had Thai food before moving to our wonderful city. After being introduced to Thai by a handsome man, an awesome relationship was born. Not with him, but with Pad Thai. Imagine my delight when my awesome roommate, Lori, tells me that there is this awesome Thai restaurant that delivers to the Dollhouse (yes, that's what we call our house. Shut up.) One taste of Cozy's Pad Thai and I was in luuurve. I mean, to the point that I checked my GrubHub ordering history and over the winter, Lori and I were ordering Cozy once every three days. I'm actually full on Pad Thai as I'm typing this. The Pad Thai is good (I order mine spicy) and Lori always gets Pad Woonsen. We also get the mixed appetizer and when our order is over $20, we get potstickers, which are delish. Their physical location just happens to be around the block from the Wrigleyville bar that Lori and I work at, so we've taken to grabbing a six-pack at 7-11 and stopping in to get fresh noodles, no delivery necessary. It's a small place so there can be a wait on busy nights but the service is awesome and the decor is quirky. The Pez dispenser bathroom freaks me out but that might be because I have pee-formance anxiety. Love. Love. Love. Cozy.

GREAT food, GREAT price. You can't really go wrong with that combo.  They have a lot on the menu, fortunately I have tried a lot on the menu and it is all stellar. Their crab rangoon..I DIE. The curry dishes are super tasty and not just hot. Of course, the pad see ew and pad thai are a go to dishes.  I always stop by if I am in the neighborhood.

This place is really yummy...a friend and I shared the Pad Thai noodles with chicken and fried rice with chicken...both were fabulous!  Service was pretty quick and the lady at the counter was friendly enough.

Ahhhhh! I love Cozy! Their food is so good tasting and their crab rangoon is absolutely fantastic. The decoration is really creative and totally original. The walls are covered in random stuff from shelves of vintage toys to 1960's radios. The tables are even made from Singer Sewing Machines - how awesome is that?! I love the life sized Elvis in the corner and it's really funny when we sit under him because I always think our waiter is coming.  Their Rama Chicken w/ peanut sauce comes in a giant bowl made of broccoli (as do many of their other dishes). The great thing about this is you definitely get a full serving of delicious cooked fresh vegetables. They also have no problem giving you some more white-rice if you need it, at no charge. Every time I get a coupon on our Jewel-Osco receipt for buy one get one free entree, my partner and I can literally both eat there for less than $10 (not each, just in general, $10 for the two of us).  Last thing, the people who work here are the nicest servers ever. They're extraordinarily attentive and always smiling. They understand that fantastic service helps make people want to come back, and we have several times.  Writing this review has definitely made me crave some Thai food.

I would walk in here every day if it was closer. I love their service and their portion size is always generous. Despite a glut of thai places in the last 10 years they still stand out due to their awesome decor and the quality of their food. I tell tourists to stop here if in wriglyville. I believe their Chicken Rama is the best around and they have some really good tom kah kai. One of the best thai places in the city. Avoid the overrated, overcrowded pennies and stop by.
I ordered delivery - broccoli with beef, chicken fried rice, and fried baby tofu. The food was practically flavorless and not worth the $20. Don't plan on ordering from this place again.

I have always been a fan of Cozy's delicious food, friendly staff and super fast delivery but last weekend they outdid themselves. I had planned to have a dinner for 12 at Firefly on Friday, May 13th at 7:30 but found out on Thursday May 12th they had closed without warning. In a scramble to find a place near the bar where my birthday party was to be held, I called up Cozy to see if they'd be able to accommodate (not expecting much since the restaurant is small, I was giving less than 24 hours notice and had 12 people coming - on a Friday night in Wrigleyville). Without hesitation, they took my reservation and saved the day. What was better was that the service was phenomenal, the food was outstanding and my guests (many of whom had never been there) loved it! Thanks Cozy for always being awesome and saving my 30th birthday!!
Love this restauran! Food is good. People are always nice. cute decorations!

Great Thai spot.  My buddy took me to this place and since then I have been back several times and ordered delivery a few times as well. The staff is extremely friendly and always keep your drinks filled. Chicken Pad Thai is my goto meal and the appetizers are also delicious.   Can't go wrong w Cozy's.
Decent food, that is fast, and great value.  Lunch specials are amazing value.  Love how they have mini egg rolls as an appetizer.   Food is decent, but nothing epic.  Good tasting, fast and cheap.

I used to live close by to this place and I took it for granted.  We were in the neighborhood with a group last night and ended up going here for dinner.  We were a group of 9 and they were great with us.  They put us in the back group which was a huge treat!  It was like we had our own dining room.    The group had a blast!  I forgot how eclectically decorated it is, it makes for a fun group dinner inside.  The service was great, food was top notch, sometimes I feel like Thai can be a little greasy, not at all!  I loved their glass noodles.  I had the Pad Woonsen and highly recommend it.  It had  the perfect ratio of noodles and vegetables and meat.

I LOVE it her. I mean really love it. I come in here at least once a week. Easily my favorite Thai in the city. You gotta try the garlic chicken, or crispy pad thai. The Crab Rangoon are also fantastic. Great prices, great atmosphere, great fun.

I don't understand how this place got 4 stars judging from the dishes I tried. I ordered the Tom Yum Soup, deep fried Shu Mai,  and Crispy Pad Kee Mao. Tom Yum soup was super sweet w/ no sour taste and when I asked the waitress, in case they forgot to put some ingredient, I was told that their Tom Yum is sweet and not sour. I've tom yum in over 200 Thai restaurants over 3 comtinents and this was by far the worst  The Pad Kee Mao was really salty and the noodles were not crispy but hard. The fried Shu Mai was okay. I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 since they had BYOB.

This place is perfect for a cheap date - incredible coupon deals from their website, BYOB, walls decorated by an obsessive toy collector, and delicious food.  I'm a big fan of their cashew chicken entree.   Also, if you're ever down the street at Guthries Pub and looking for a good food-delivery option while playing board games, Cozy is one of your best options.
I love Cozy!  Great food and they deliver, too!  Crab rangoon, shrimp salad, and cashew chicken are yummy and food is always fresh.  Great BYOB and fun for a group.

First of all, the decor is awesome. I started with the cozy rice soup with shrimp which was pretty good. The shrimps were cooked perfectly and the broth was really flavorful.  I choose the dumpling noodles for my entree. It was pretty decent. The broth was great and the pork was tasty but the noodles were awful. The dumplings were excellent. My real issue was that all my waitress did was take my order and drop my check. Someone else brought my food and cleared my plate and no one ever asked how things were going or if I needed anything. It wasn't busy, she just stood at the counter and chit-chatted with her friends.

I love this place so much! Great food, great service, and an eclectic space. I always get the pad kee mao, but with tofu. I love it! The only issue is that the spice level tends to vary, but it's never been a big deal. The crab rangoon is a must! I'm also a big fan of the curries, especially the red.

I stopped by in my first night in the 'hood. I was all dirty from moving and dressed in sweatpants and a HS Powderpuff Tshirt figuring "Eh, it's a Thai restaurant - it won't be that busy on a Sunday night" WRONG! Cozy was packed to the gills with 20-somethings and I ended up looking like a character in a bad romantic comedy. But I digress.  I came back a few days later and the staff (who are all SUPER sweet!) instantly remembered my name! The crab rangoon is great - it tastes super fresh and the sweet and sour sauce they serve with it HAS to be made in-house - it's fresh and tangy and amaze-balls! Same goes for the shrimp rolls. Their bubble tea is delish (I'm addicted to the coconut!) and all of the main dishes I've had have been great, especially the crispy pad thai and red curry. Note: if you're used to spicy thai food like I am, I recommend asking for it to be extra spicy. Even at "extra spicy" status, it's still pretty mild ;-) Yeah...  I spend way too much of my paycheck here each week.

Cozy has been my go-to Thai delivery for over 3 years.  The restaurant is a super cute BYOB date night spot - the knick knacks on the walls are a great conversation starter.  I highly recommend the Tom Kar soup, panang curry and spicy fried rice with brown rice and vegetables.  Cozy is one of my favorite spots for light and crispy crab rangoon.

Cozy Noodle and Rice is a sweet little spot to come with your sweetie. I came here last night with my current guy.  Sweet! We agreed on everything except for the star rating.  So since I am writing this, you get 4 stars, Cozy.  If the man was writing this, you'd only get 3.  Not so sweet....  We loved the decor.  So fun and interesting!  And cozy!  Perfect date place.  I also think this would be fun for young people.  I want to come back here with everyone I know between the ages of 16-23.     The service was very friendly and attentive.  We had the potstickers which were passable.  I had the beef salad which was good, bordering on very good, but had a little too much dressing (a little too sweet, next time I'll ask for it on the side).  And I loved the decorative artwork made of carrots and cucumber in my dish.  The man had the golden noodles which were a big disappointment.  I can attest to this.  They were not at all yummy. Despite this, I definitely want to come back.  This place is cute, the bill was cheap, the service was very good and overall the food was good.   Sweet.

When you walk through the door of Cozy Noodle & Rice you can't help but smile. It is certainly a cozy space filled with fun trinkets and friendly people. Prepare yourself to WAIT, WAIT, WAIT, on a Friday or Saturday evening. Cozy is BYOB so pop open a bottle/can while you wait! The menu is typical of a most Thai restaurants with a few interesting additions such as crispy Pad See Ew and Crispy Pad Thai. I recommend the crispy dishes as an appetizer vs. as a main course. While the flavor was good, the "friedness" became a little overwhelming towards the end. The curry dishes were good and full of flavor, with serving sizes large enough to last you a few days. ALWAYS a good thing, curry gets better with time! The Dumpling Noodles was bland, and seemed to be missing something.  Overall, Cozy is a fun and enjoyable experience. Although I wont be running back for the food, the atmosphere and good deals are a draw.

My girlfriend and I hermits, for the most part, so this review is only for their delivery. Overall, we love the food, and it shows, since we order from them at least once a week. They aren't afraid to spice things up if you ask (I'm addicted to hot & spicy cuisine,) and the quality of the food is excellent.  The only bad part? The delivery results are sometimes a bit iffy; we've had  dishes missing from the order (but they certainly made up for it), and sometimes our special requests (no plastic utensils, *please*!!!) get missed. That said, we've ever gotten an order that's cold or of sub-par quality.
Great place.. As the name suggests its very cozy with some delicious food... tasty crab rangoons & the panang curries are just yummy

This is my favorite restaurant of all time! I would give it 6 stars if I could. Inexpensive, huge portions, and the best pad see ewe I have ever had! Staff is very kind and quick, and the decor always keeps things interesting. The mixed appetizer is a must, as is the coconut bubble tea. I've been here probably more than 15 times and it never gets old!

This place is wonderful. I live close by and stop by every now and then for dinner with friends. The service is always attentive and friendly, I don't think I've had to wait more than a few seconds before someone is there, smiling, and waiting to seat me. Really cute decor, though verging on creepy depending on your point of view.. The food isn't mind-blowing, but consistent and always very good and fair, even cheap, prices. BYOB is always appreciated too.
I thought this place was great.  Incredibly reasonable with huge portions of really good noodles and chicken.  And it's a byob.  I love that about chicago.   But i will be going back.   Tony

Are you a toy lover with ADD?  This place is made for you.  From the huge collection of bobbleheads to the adorable metal washtubs in which your bill is delivered, you could spend hours just checking everything out.  Cozy's colorful decor is balanced out with friendly servers working their butts off to make sure you get your food hot.  The tables are close together, and there's really no good place to stand while you're waiting for your table.  We kept stepping in and out of the host stand trying to get out of the way of the servers.   For the price, this place is a great value.  Right now, they're running a special for buy one get one free entrees (dine - in only).  We tried the Woonsen salad, which had a great vinaigrette and a lot of variety as far as veggies go.  We also had the Bamee noodles, which had a pretty random mix of toppings such as BBQ pork, a fried won ton, and imitation crab meat (something that always turns me off).  The crispy pad see ewe was really unique with it's fried noodles.  This was the best dish - combining texture, sweet and savory balance of flavors, and well cooked beef (aka: we didn't need a hacksaw to eat it).

Had lunch at Cozy Noodle last weekend with some friends and man was it YUMMY  We had multiple orders of Crab Rangoon, which was super yummy.  I forget the name of the noodle dish I had, but it was very good.  The restaurant was a happening place for a Saturday afternoon.   Service was pretty good.  The staff may have been a bit slow to take our order, but our food did not take long and we had been enjoying conversation. I'm looking forward to my next visit to the Cozy Noodle.

I love cozy.  The atmosphere is like a beautiful wonderful gem in the heart of BRO-ville (wrigleyville)...although i wouldnt suggest going there on a game day....hectic. Ive been a regular at Cozy since before i moved to the city. The main staff there is genuinely sweet and take good care of you....although i think a lot of the new staff should take note (not nearly as attentive or nice as the staff from 2 years ago).  Their lunch specials are great and food is consistently great. I love it.

My beautiful pal Molly recommended this place. You better get your ass in here to eat the best homemade crab rangoons you'll easily ever have.   Try also the beautifully presented seaweed salad complete with a cutout carrot star wedged into the center of a cucumber slice.   For entree I ordered the Pad Woonsen: Stir-fried glass noodles with shrimp and chicken combo, onions, carrots, bean sprouts, and peapods.  (minus the chicken). It was amazing and I feasted on it all day long! This place is cute, "cozy," and definitely worth coming back to!

It's a Thai restaurant. The soup was supposed to a Thai version of hot and sour soup. It was awful. Incredibly sweet. The entree was chicken cashews.  Was served in a lake of soy sauce.  Incredibly salty. I had to stop The service was excellent.  Extremely friendly and on point.  The walls are covered with drek.  Pez dispensers, robots, an Elvis statue, and I don't know wtf else.  Since none of this low-end eBay stuff has anything to do with tai food it seems that the point is that the owner is  "a really big fan" of collecting and is just SO proud that he wants everyone to see his neato stuff.   For the record, I like off beat decorations. But there has to be something original or interesting about it. There is nothing original here. It's just random toys etc for the sole purpose of seeming offbeat. This stuff is as "cool" as a middle school jazz band solo.  Ostentatious and dorky Its BYOB..That's nice. FYI, miller chill pairs well with crappy thai food Seems like other people like the food. It's a low price point so I'm inclined to have some patience.  I  would give it another shot but would be much more careful about ordering. Maybe if it's good, I'll leave some Vulcan ears as a tip.
Great prices, super fast service. The lunch special soup is delicious and cheap! Only $1.95 for a decent portion. BYOB, and the service is wonderful.

I like this place so much I wanna marry it and live a quiet life in the suburbs.  Entering to your table there's a wall adjacent full of mini robots. I swear their eyes follow me as I walk. There's also walls of vintage pez dispensers, model trains, army toys, kewpie dolls, ect. Cool, but they could take the kitsch a step further. Instead of a rug use a floormat keyboard ala the movie Big, flashing lights, tableside lava lamps,  glow in the dark stickers, and glitter never hurts. When I leave a ceramic kitty statue by the cash register waves bye at me. Ok I won't flatter myself, it waves the whole time which is true hospitality. Oh yea, they also serve food. It's pretty good and it's byob and there's buy one get one coupons. The service is phenomenal. I will return but it might be my last time since I'll probably play with some of the toys all over the walls, I'll try to resist the impulse for some inexpensive, yummy, food and great service.
I loved the decor.  The food was affordable and very good.  One of my new favorite spots.

This review is completely based on the food at Cozy Noodle & Rice as I ordered carryout from the restaurant twice in one day (thanks to a great Superbowl promotion).  I tried the Chicken Pad Thai and the Chicken Pad Khee Mao.  Both were good, but not the best I have had in Chicago.   I also was able to try the Panang Curry which was very flavorful. Overall, my experience with the food from Cozy was good.  However, I will likely try other establishments in the future since I live so close to the Thai hot spot area of Uptown.

I keep coming back to Cozy time and again. My gf loves Thai food and although this may not be considered an original Thai menu it is still very good.  Everything we have ordered here has been pretty good. The rice is good and the noodles are very good as well. The appetizers have all been good I just tried the new Orange Chicken Salad and it was so filling i thought it almost had 2 much chicken, but hey im not complaining. To top it off i think its cheaper than other Thai restaurants. I spent $25 for 2 and then the real deal is that its BYOB. I think I've been here about 3x in the past month, so YES i like it. Although, i do live like across the street from here so that might have something to do with it, but if you live in the lakeview area this is a cool place for a more relaxed and cheap but good Thai.
I love this spot! Probably most for its interior and service, but the food is also good. Cheap place great for a weeknight dinner.

I ordered delivery from here based on all of the rave reviews but was sadly disappointed. First and foremost everything we ordered arrived cold.  Not just not hot, but straight up cold.  We ordered the pad see ewe with beef, but the egg noodles were so overcooked that they were more of a mush than anything else.  The seasoning was nothing to write home about. Due to the extremely unappetizing texture, (although we felt very wasteful) we actually just tossed the whole dish in the trash. We also ordered the Bamee The flavor was OK and it should have been edible...  But these noodles and the BBQ pork that accompanied them were so dried out when they arrived that I couldn't eat more than a bite without chasing it down with a long gulps of water.  I felt like they had just boxed up a dish that had been sitting on the counter for an hour. Maybe if we'd dined in the food would have been better.  But given the terrible experience we had tonight, I don't think I'll be giving it a second chance.

I love this place, I love the staff, I love the owners and I love the food. The people here are very friendly a few of them have a difficulty with English but they try their best to understand and provide excellent service. I have been eating here for nearly a year and I will continue to eat here. I take people here, even people who do not like Thai food and they always love it. My brother who dislikes Chicago, would solely visit me as long as he got to eat Cozy Noodle. I can not say enough great things about this place. Order the Panang with beef!

One of the first BYOB's i went to Chicago and still one of my favorites! The food is good and cheap, especially if you find a buy 1 get 1 coupon that they distribute almost every week.  The restuarant is really small so plan accordingly. Great place to go for some pre-gaming before hitting up the bars on clark street.

Love! Love! Love this place!  My fiancee and I eat here regularly (close to once a week),  In past we've eaten there two or three days in a row!  Everything here is great although I encourage you to avoid their beef.  The people are nice.  We do carry out, delivery and on occasion, dine in (BYOB!).  There are a lot of Thai places in Chicago.  There are a lot of Thai places in Wrigleyville (5 within walking distance of my condo).  Cozy is by far the best of the bunch!!!
Nothing goes better with Thai food than TOYS! Everywhere! This place is happy and yummy. I love eating outside in the summer. I also love visiting the pez bathroom.

One of the better Thai restaurants I've been to in the city. Their portions are great, although the amount of rice they give you is not sufficient for most of the rice dishes they serve. The atmosphere is really unique and worth a trip. The decorations and knickknacks inside are more than enough to keep you occupied while you wait for your food. If you're claustrophobic, this is not your cup of tea seeing as how everyone is in very close quarters, and I have never been there on a "slow" night. BYOB suits this place well. Also, there are BO-GO entrees Mon.-Thurs., which you can usually find on the back of your Jewel-Osco receipts or those neighborhood coupon books. Makes for a REALLY cheap meal, however I always find myself getting an appetizer or soup since it's such a great deal, and then I end up paying what I normally would have. Staff has always been cheerful and polite.  The only downside to this place really is the capacity, although I'm not sure it would be the same if they had more space.
New to the area and our neighbors recommneded Cozy and I am glad they did!  Great food at a great price!  Very friendly service and cool atmosphere!  I will definitely be eating here again!

AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH, I come here at least once a week. Their crab rangoon is to die for, and I've tried about ten of their entrees which are all great.  They have specials running all the time which help everyone out.  I don't think any of my take out orders has taken over fifteen minutes. The only reason why I'm taking away a star is because it IS quite small in there and I've had to wait a few times for seating.  It's better when it's warm out and there is outdoor seating as well. (Insider trick: with every take out order, you get free pop with each entree.  Make sure to ask. Juuuust sayin'.......)

Oh... Man... This place was absolutely delicious. I had the crazy noodles, and the textures and flavors were to die for. Also, the bubble tea was quite delicious. All of this combined with the interesting decor provided for a great dining experience.

Every experience that I've had with Cozy has been really great EXCEPT one, which is why I'm giving them 4 stars instead of 5.  We always get some sort of spicy noodles with tofu, and maybe an app, and my favorite food on this planet which is tom kha soup.  Now, if tom kha soup is on a menu somewhere, and I see it, and have any room in my stomach, and a few bucks in my pocket, I'm buying it.  The trouble is that I don't always love what I get, even when visiting the same restaurant it seems as though consistency with this item is hard to maintain.  However, at Cozy I always always always love it.  It's perfect!  The seasonings are great, there are plenty of veggies, and it's exactly what I want, every time.   The reason for the missing star is that I came here once and my beloved tom kha soup had a big rotten tomato in it, like seriously, jet black.  Gross.  And the waitress didn't seem phased by it when we complained!  Like it was strange that we were less than excited about a big black rotten tomato in our soup.  Anyway, we got a new bowl and I was in love again.  Really like this place.  The inside is adorable too.  Outdoor seating is perfect during the summer (but beware of cubs games) but we usually do take-out during the winter.  We usually split two things and it's about 6 bucks each.  Can't beat it!

I love Cozy Noodles. From selection to price to service, you can't beat Cozy. I have them on speed dial. Just make sure you ask for chop sticks and soy. For some reason they just stopped adding it on delivery unless you ask for it.

The $5 pad thai lunch special alone is enough to earn cozys five stars, then they add a sample side for free and totally blow you away. The pad thai is great, which is my yardstick when measuring thai restaurants.

Been going here for over two years, but a recent experience ruined it! For starters, all of the coupons are somewhat of a scam. Just do the math and you will realize its not such a "great deal". For carry out. We ordered at 8:30 PM on a Saturday, they said it will take an hour. Understandable. Even a little over, I would understand. We waited for over two hours. Each time we called to check we were told the driver was "on his way".  This is frustrating, and unfortunately, we will never order carry out again.  My advice, always pick up, or dine in. The food is ok , can be bland at times compared to nearby Thai restaurants, but the baby egg rolls are very good, and the fried rice is enjoyable.

Of the places I have eaten at since moving to Lakeview in August, this has to be number one or number two.  Went here with a large group and they were able to accommodate us even though the space was small.  They also still brought out our food very quickly.  And to top that the food was absolutely delicious!  Had the Pad Thai and can't wait to have it again. My friend and I actually plan in advance and anticipate our trips to Cozy Noodle.  I will definitely be a frequent customer here.

I've experienced Cozy Noodle twice. Once for dine in - that gets better marks, as the environment was cute and I made a good spicy noodle meal choice. The bubble tea was good as well - however, the service was off and errors were made. Second time, we ordered for take out. The person on the phone was literally impossible for us to understand, but we did manage to place our order and communicate the location for delivery (three times) and understand that it would take an hour for delivery at 7pm on a weeknight. An hour and 40 mins later, our food finally arrives and it was pretty cold. I did not like the pad thai that much either, furthering the disappointment.  Even after all of that, I don't think I would rule out going there again, but I'd rather opt for a Penny's noodle night instead.

Simply amazing. I return to Chicago for this Thai restaurant. I have been a customer for 8 years. They know me by name and what I order. Decor is great. 4 stars because crab Rangoon used to be my favorite and the last 3 times I have gone the quality has not been as great. Still the best crab Rangoon in the world. I wish I could have kept this restaurant my little secret...I question if their cooking has become sloppy since their business is booming. Get reservations or get your name on the list ahead of time Thursday - Saturday night. Best for lunch!!! BYOB!! Word to the wise: do not park in the Einstiens parking lot! Not even for 5 seconds to run in and grab your take out order. Your car will be booted immediately with a 115$ fine to get it removed. The owner of the lot has hired someone to sit in a car with boots and boot your car immediately.

Although this place has an eccentric collection of decorations that make you think "what kind of restaurant is this REALLY???" the food is really good and the service is great.  The prices are good as well, and the portions are big so you can probably take home whatever you don't finish for a snack later on.  I wish I lived closer.

cute little thai place. great for lunch during the week as they have a special. i recommend the pad kee moa. i had the curry once and i would have liked it to be thicker... the whole place and bathroom is covered in toys. pez all over the bathroom walls, a little overhwelming lol.

Asian cuisine is my all-time favorite kind of food...and Cozy is my absolute favorite place to go in Chicago!   I initially became addicted to Cozy when I was living in Wrigleyville. I seriously would order it 1-2 times each week!  I then moved out of state, however when I would come back to visit, I HAD to get over to Cozy to fulfill the void. I've since moved back to Chicago though am not living up in Wrigleyville anymore...but I still make the trek up to that area just for Cozy.  HIGHLIGHTS: -Reasonable prices -Overly friendly staff (almost annoyingly friendly actually) -Rad atmosphere...especially the PEZ dispenser collection on the walls of the women's restroom...and the license plates from different states throughout the dining area. -THEY DELIVER!  This was always clutch during the winter months when I needed Cozy but was too hungover and/or it was too cold to walk there and get it. -BYOB...I always appreciate BYOB places...lets you save a little cash on the drinks -My top food choices are:  Cashew Chicken (it's spicy...and oh so delicious!)...and also Pad Khee Mao -Street parking with a FEW spots in the parking lot along side the building... -It's usually pretty crowded on weekends...and it's hit or miss during the week.

I enjoy my time almost every time I go.  Most of the food is great, but I do have to say that the curry is not all that good... kinda borderline.  Other than these dishes, I normally order anything with noodles and, at times, entrees.  And yes, it does get a little packed in the evenings, but that's normally on the weekends.  If it is packed, they get a little anxious when a table of 2 sits for a long time.  So eat your food and go... haha.  But otherwise, Cozy is still on my favorite list for dine-ins simply because of the decor... and the food.

I have ordered from over 20 Thai Restaurants in the city and was disappointed with Cozy. Tons of recommendations from friends, but 2 main problems: 1) The food was not overly impressive to me (bland seasoning in Pad Woon Sen & Crab Rangoon, very little shrimp in the shrimp dishes, Pad Khee Mao noodles were like eating beef jerky toughness). 2) I confirmed both online and over the phone that the order was for delivery after 9:30pm (as that's when I get home), yet they were at my place at 9:00pm trying to get in. They did not re-cook or discount, but instead had the driver wait for 25 minutes until I got home. Person on the phone, Julie, did not understand why I was frustrated. Food not worth giving them another shot.  Either I had a very outlying experience, or all these good reviews come from people who have not tried better fare.  I'm an optimist.

This place is always packed. So that is usually a good sign. It has a good, casual atmosphere. The location is ideal for grabbing some food before hitting the bars or after a Cubs game. I had the crab ragoons and they were a nice size with a better than average amount of crab filling. My fried rice was good, not great but still not bad. It tasted even better reheated the next day. In addition, service was pleasant and the final bill was very reasonable.

My favorite Thai place in the city. I get carry out probably once every week or two. The decor is awesome, BYOB is great and every dish tastes great. The M-F lunch specials are great, too - for 5 or 6 bucks, you get an entree, an appetizer and a soda. Whether you're going with friends or on a date, you're sure to enjoy this cozy little spot! (see what I did there?!)

I really like this little cute thai restaurant. Service was great but the food was just okay - my dish was too salty! I only give 3 stars because the waiter threw out one of my dish - which i told him that i would like to take the leftover to go.

This place is Cozy.  This place is quirky.  This place has some tasty-ass food.  It probably seats 30 people max.  The food is good, probably better than Joy's for the price.  (Also, Jewel down the street gives BOGO coupons with their receipts sometimes.)  I love this place because it is literally down the street from where I live, and it is my type of "soul food."  Sounds weird, but its perfect for a cold crappy winter Chicago night.  Or a Sunday lunch.  Go here.  It's COZY.

What a funky little place in Chicago.  I was in here for a late lunch one Sunday afternoon, and we sat down among a ton of random stuff spanning many decades. I had a fried noodle pad Thai.  It definitely had some crunch to it, and was overall a nice change of pace from normal pad Thai.  Another nice aspect to the place was that they had reasonable prices for being in the middle of Chicago. Definitely check out the bathrooms.

Our delivery came a little bit on the tepid side and I was relatively unimpressed, but my leftovers bumped it up a notch (which is a pro when it comes to reheating stuff).  That being said, I did try the crab rangoons and had much better back home in my quaint city of 50k - I guess I was spoiled!  Worth the money, and so far my dinner has turned into 2 dinners and a lunch with some more leftover.

Clearly this place doesn't need another review, so I'll keep it short and to the point.  Really amazing, inexpensive Thai food.  The crab rangoon was the best I've ever had and the Crispy Pad Thai was incredible.  We also tried the Crazy Noodles and they were delicious.  The leftovers made a fantastic lunch the next day.   Stop reading reviews and just go here.

Check the back of your receipt from the Broadway Jewel. You will have a 2 for 1 coupon for entrees here. At that price, this is the best dinner you'll eat.  Unlike the coupon you get from Joy's, you don't need to spend more than 14$ to use the coupon. Also, unlike Joy's, you won't walk away from dinner feeling bloated.

Best Place to Eat in Wrigleyville!!   Crab Rangoon is the best I've had in the City!  I work in the area so I prob eat there around 20-30 times a year, even when not in the area I will go there for a great dining experience.   The staff and the manager are the nicest people you will find at any restaurant!  At any given time during the cubs game you will likely find pedicabs parked out in front, while the drivers are enjoying a delicious energizing meal.  Lunch special is great price and always Byob.  I recommend the Coconut bubble tea and of course the Crab Rangoon

I like this place. Its got very small seating capacity though. The prices are really reasonable. The crab rangoons are very good. So is the red curry. Staff is very friendly and I love the interiors. Always brings a smile.
Really good food and good location. Best to go before or after the dinner  rush as the place is small and there isn't really anywhere to wait for a table without being in the way.

OVER AN HOUR AND A HALF FOR DELIVERY!!!!!!!! First off, the food is very good.  If I were rating it on food alone, it would be higher.   Sadly, the customer service/delivery is TERRIBLE.  I ordered, and was quoted 45 minutes for delivery.   After I waited more than an hour, I called back. I was assured that the driver was already on his way, and would be there in 5 minutes.  I waited another 15 minutes, and still no driver.  I live 6 blocks from the restaurant.  I know how long it takes to drive 6 blocks. I call back, and I am assured that the driver is right outside my door.  The manager discounts my order by 20%. I wait another 15 minutes, and there is still no driver.  I call back.  I am again assured that he is pulling up to my house.  I look out the window, and he isn't there.  I tell the manager, but she assures me that my eyes must be playing tricks on me, because he says he IS "right outside".   5 minutes later, I see his car pull up, and he delivers the food.  I open the bag, and it is cold.  The crab rangoon were even soggy.  I called back to let the manager know, and she comped my order.  Normally, this would be satisfactory (i used to work in the restaurant biz)... but that isn't the point.  I understand when nights are busy, but I also understand when I am flat out being lied to. This marks the third time it has taken more than an hour for delivery from a place that is 6 blocks away. Go for the take out, but avoid their delivery.  HUGE waste of time.
This place has the best crispy pad thai and bubble tea ever! And they are always giving coupons at Jewel. Love em!

I agree with Colleen C., "The food is good, the interior is fun and cutesy, but beyond that, not totally impressed." I found the service to be slow. Actually, the service staff annoyed me a little bit because I didn't know that they were supposed to take our names. Our names were never taken, and I'm not sure why. Was it because we were the only Asians there? Strange. I also thought it was funny that they have a sign on their door that they welcome everyone, regardless of where they come from. Hmmm. I don't know what to make of that. My friend ordered the Pad Thai, which I've never found to be good anywhere else but here. It was actually not so out-of-the-world orangely and mushy! Score one for the Cozy! Based on our server's recommendation, I ordered the Crispy Khee Mao. It was wayyyyyyy too crispy. It hurt the roof of my mouth to try to eat this. Still, it was quite good, if not a little too salty for my taste.  We also ordered the tom kha gai soup to start with. That was good. I liked it, but I think I'd have preferred the tom yum soup. Dang. Perhaps another time.  I may actually try this restaurant again given that it's in my neighborhood... alone. They apparently cannot split checks. I don't understand how they could have charged everything to one card without noticing the other card underneath it. What? I'm sorry but that seemed like a bad excuse.

Having moved back to Wrigleyville recently, I was craving Pad Thai and immediately thought of Cozy because I always wanted to try it. It's a small place and was backed on a Tuesday night, so I sat outside. It was a little chilly, so the tables outside were open and I started with their special Cozy Rice Soup with tofu. It was a nice veggie broth with some pan-fried tofu and Jasmine Rice, scallions, etc. It was a pretty hefty-sized bowl and it was great, but lacked the spice I was looking for in Thai food, so I drizzled in some rooster sauce. Rice was slightly undercooked, I felt, though. Which is weird, because it must continue to cook a bit in the broth, right? Also, though I did get a larger portion than I expected, this soup wasn't all that filling. The Pad Thai (w/ beef) was really very flavorful. There was a lot of beef in the big portion and they didn't skimp on the peanuts. In fact, they gave me a little cup of crushed peanuts to add to my liking, so I was happy. Too many Pad Thais lack the texture when they skimp on peanuts. Noodles were cooked perfectly. However, also had to add some chili sauce. Where's the heat? Though the portions are big (enough Pad Thai to share, I'm sure, but I destroyed it) and quite tastey, I take one star off for undercooked rice and lack of spice. I'd definitely go here again.

This is the best and most fun Thai place in east lakeview. It's super cute and everyone who goes has fun right away. The staff and owner are social and fun and the prices are really great, on top of that there is always a special or coupon you can find on their website. The only negative I would say is that the menu isn't very big and you'll want more. Mixed Vegetable with tofu FTW. BYO

This place rocks!  My partner introduced me to this place and I fell in love with it right away.  The interior is uniquely decorated using a combination of Thai & American cultures it is rather cozy!  The staff is very friendly and they fill your cup with water every so often! The food is also affordable, and they do not charge for a corkage fee!  Moreover, this place has a mini parking lot if you cannot find any parking.  When I go here I always get the Crispy Pad Thai, it is one of their popular dishes, but if you are not into crunchy stuff or have a loose tooth I recommend something else.   Try it out!
Good food, big portions, cheap prices, really cute ambiance!

A must see...the 12" Pez Dispensers in the Ladies restroom! Great antique toys thruout. What a delightful small dining area with the great antique toys on the walls. Oh, it's about the food...and might I add, the food is rather delicious!  The Pad Thai is the best I've eaten at any other Thai restaurant.  Every meal we've had, has not only been great, but the quantity of food is plenty.  You will take some home for later.

The reviewers are right! Cozy is a lot of fun, and the fusion meals they offer are quite good. The decor is an obvious standout, with trinkets, figurines, license plates, collector editions of just about everything, and bathrooms loaded with memorabilia to keep you busy while you relieve yourself. This was the first place where I have eaten something akin to deep-fried wide noodles in a stir-fry dish. Garnished with cilantro, peanuts, chicken, and veggies, it was surprisingly good, although HEAVY. Also, big high-5 to the staff: my girlfriend and I walked in about 10-15 minutes to closing time, but they sat us down promptly and told us to order whatever we wanted.  This place gets a bit rowdy on the weekends, so if it's just two of you go hide in the corner or by the window. There were two huge groups, one all-male, one all-female, both total drunk train wrecks (it being Wrigleyville and all). Fun in its own way, but just beware.

Normally, I don't write reviews for establishments with over 100 reviews... But I took my friends from out-of-town (rural Pennsylvania) here and they loved. It might as well be a tourist attraction. Okay, not really.  It's so damn quirky and cute, hardly expected of a Thai restaurant. For out-of-towners, Cozy Noodles offer cheap, standard Thai food. Nothing too wild, although there were several dishes that were purely of their own creation (in other words, not authentic). Seriously, my friends took more photos of this restaurant than Wrigley Field.

My boyfriend and I are OBSESSED with Cozy.  We take pretty much anyone who comes to visit us here...and we probably get it a couple times a month.  I haven't gotten anything but the red curry with tofu (extra spicy) in ages, because it's just too good to stray from.   The crab rangoon is DELIGHTFUL and we almost always finish our meal with a Taro bubble tea (so delicious), even though we're always stuffed! If you're in the area, don't miss it!  There's also a sister location in Evanston, where we orginally fell in love...it's just as cute and delicious!

AWESOME!!! If you love thai food / asian stirfry / NOODLES- this place is one of the best. Cute atmosphere, covered with old fashioned toys (and the bathroom is covered with pez dispensers from floor to ceiling!). A perfect, relatively inexpensive place to eat before a Cubbie game!! I got the crazy noodles-- they were awesome. I would go back anytime I was in the area, in a heartbeat.  ...oh, and it's BYOB- so that's pretty damn SWEET.

5 stars all the way! This place has been around for years and is still as cute, consistent and affordable as it always has been.  I am not an authority on Thai food (like other people have written); I always get their golden noodles. They make it with tofu instead of chicken for me.  The appetizers are always awesome too. I recently took a friend here for a late afternoon lunch and was surprised to see their dining room so busy at 3 on a Tuesday!  The decor is awesome and makes for a great place to eat. I love that the pop (I am a Chicago boy who says pop) comes to you in a can with a glass.  The price is *just right*.  Sadly, I live far from here and am just outside of their huge delivery area. It is always worth a trip to Wrigley for this one!

Very reasonable price and very good thai food.  My favorite dish is the Crazy Noodles.  You can call for pick up and it's ready in less than 15 minutes.  They even have a small parking lot so you don't have to worry about street parking.

Cheap, kitschy, fun, bright and tasty. Most of what I'd say has been said but I love Thai food and the only thing I had here I didn't really like their version of was the cucumber salad. It was missing something. Not sure what.  TINY parking lot but there is a small area on the side.

I have learned to love Cozy's for what it is.  A great cheap way to fill up on delicious authentic cuisine, around a kitschy 1950's-present environment.  I work in Wrigleyville as a rickshaw driver and this establishment has become my energy sustaining meal of the day.  All I have to say is Lunch Specials, from $4.99 - $5.99 are friggin incredible.  The waitstaff is very nice, and enjoy talking to you.  My water cup never goes empty here and it is indeed very cozy.   The very best lunch experience you could have in wriggleyville!

I came here a few weeks ago and we ordered an appetizer and 2 entrees. The place was nearly empty and the service was incredibly slow... but we didn't mind because the food was good. We had a lot of leftovers so when the waitress came with the check, I asked if we could have a box and she said she'd wrap it up for us. After I went up and paid, I asked for the box and the waitress and hostess looked confused. They told me to hang on and they went to the back. They came out and said sorry but they threw them away. Keep in mind, at this point there was only one other table of people in the place, so it's not like they were swamped and just forgot about us. I said "ok, so now what?" And they started laughing at me and kept saying sorry. She then lifted up her hand and waved goodbye to me, as if she had enough of me and it was time for me to leave. I couldn't believe they had such awful customer service. The next day I called to speak to the manager and I was told he was on vacation until next week. I then called two more times the following week and was told he wasn't there and they'd give him my name of number but of course, I never got a call back. Thai food places are a dime a dozen, so I'd never go back there. Obviously, they have no sense of customer service. I'd suggest Joy's Noodles on Broadway and Belmont-ish. The prices are the same and the food is great... and guess what? I went last week while the place was crowded and the service was top notch. My food was wrapped up and brought back to me before I even had time to sign the check! Now THAT'S customer service for ya.

A top 10 of our fav eateries. Thai doesn't get much better than this: Surrounded by kitchy toys and cool stuff from robots on shelves to Warhol Marilyn plates in the crapper, COZY is cozy, cheap, and fulfilling on several levels from amount of food to overall cuteness. Before a Cub game or just to grab a quiet moment wit a friend, we couldn't recommend a small, happy place more than COZY. In fact, if the Cubbies win or lose, COZY will remain the day's event to beat. Tiny, close tables made from old sewing machine stands (Singers, for their ironwork). For someone in a wheelchair and if it is summer, outside dining is easier. Side parking for 3 or 4; 1 block south from Wrigley Field.   Mark B, Associate Publisher, Food Industry News

Fabulous BYOB restaurant in Lakeview.  Wonderful, attentive service - literally a "cozy" and kitchy atmosphere.... tasty thai food... and BYOB!   On top of this the prices are crazy inexpensive.  Three of us ate dinner here Friday night - two appetizers and three dinners - and the check was $35.  The menu has a ton of selections - my shrimp pad thai was really, really good.  The curry dishes earned rave reviews from my co-diners as well.  A sure hit!

Dear Cozy, I couldn't be happier with you. You are cheap and delicious and fun and have vegetarian options. Done and Done. AND, every time I shop at Jewel, I get a little coupon for you so my food is extra cheap. Awesome.

I am still amazed by how much better Cozy Noodle's green curry is compared to other restaurants. I have moved farther away from this great little restaurant and have been going to a couple of different places looking for Thai as good as this. Apparently it does not exist when it comes to green curry. The best green curry ever!

hi id like to place an order for pickup...be ready in 5 min?! wha?! had to take a ride around the block today in order to get a spot so i could pick up my grub...ended up cornering their delivery guy who was ok waitin a few min so i could pay super nice ppl and yes i would like extra chopsticks :P the interior looks o so cute i should have eaten there or on the patio but i was lazy and came home beef pad see eiw...yummy...beef was a bit tough and noodles were a tad too greasy but the portion size was huge and if i werent a glutton i coulda gotten 2 meals outta it

This is my hands down favorite Thai restaurant in the city. I have tried quite a few and hope to try more. My favorite dishes at this place include: Basil leaf Chicken and Panang Curry. I always toy with which one of the two dishes I am going to order. One thing I can not go without though is ordering their Crab Rangoon appetizer! This is the best! Its full shaped and tasty! There are always coupons on the back of the Jewel receipts (Broadway & Addison) that gives you buy one get one entrees on M-Thursday. I suggest you get a bottle of wine from there and head on over if you want a cheap way to try it out! My friends go here every week and now the staff knows them and welcome them by name. They even will call and be recognized! They also have a huge collection of random toys that are on display covering all of the walls. This quaint small place has a small outdoor patio, BYOB, and amazing food! Make your next Thai meal...COZY!

I've lived in Chicago for over a decade now and this is my favorite Thai spot. Visit the bathrooms as they're quite interesting, bring a cubs ticket from that day and get a free entree, and don't forget to BYOB as they have a very lenient policy.

This place is a decent Thai restaurant in Wrigleyville. Know that this really isn't a noodle shop, though -- it's a Thai restaurant, so if you're expecting lots of options with broth, you'll be a bit disappointed. We ordered the crab rangoon which was delicious! Perfectly crisp and good consistency inside. We both ordered the dumpling noodle entree; it was ok. Pros: pork and dumplings were excellent. Cons: noodles weren't homemade and the broth was pretty watery, not very flavorful. Sure, the interior is cute, but I'd rather have great food. I'd recommend Thai Classic over this place in terms of food, but this place is still an ok option.
I absolutely love this place and usually do lunch here once a week.   Their bubble tea is awesome and I'm addicted to their Tom Kar Tofu soup.   Prices are inexpensive and who doesn't love a BYOB?

Listen, there are plenty of solid Thai places in the city. I can't say that Cozy is the best of the best. But I can say it is my personal favorite, in quality of food and service. I've never had a bad experience, and I've always liked what I ordered.  My personal favorites are the Garlic Chicken, Panang Noodle, or the Crispy Pad Kee Mao. Crab Rangoons and Spring Rolls are also solid. The delivery service is great, but the dine-in experience is way more fun.

This is the best place in Wrigley for Asian food! The Pad Khee Mao is AWESOME!!!! Spicy and del-icious!! Order from here all the time. Food comes pretty fast, never waited more then 30 min for delivery. If you want to walk there and pick it up...way less time! Staff is pretty friendly and helpful too. Never dined in, but their patio seems nice in the summer!

Thai food in Chicago. There are tons of choices and most everyone has a favorite or opinion about this one or that one. Since I tend to stay with the same dishes (Pad Siew, Panang or Mussman curry), I'm probably not an authority on Thai cuisine.  Given that, Cozy is fantastic. They have some of the best crab rangoon I've ever had (and I've had a lot!). The portions are huge, the price is right and I like the kitch-y atmosphere. In some ways, it's a little Asian oasis in a sea of douchebag bars.

I like the original flair of this place. I spent a month in Thailand a few years back and while the food is not exactly the same it is good, They have a few other Asian dishes and drinks to try if you can handle a restaurant being a bit creative. Also, the food is cheap and the portions are large. Finally, if you show them your Cub's tickets you get one dish free on game days!

I have to admit that I have never actually set foot in Cozy. I was introduced to this awesome Thai spot by a co-worker a couple of months after I moved to Chicago. I'm pretty sure that their delivery kept me going through my first midwest winter! Everything that I have had has been fresh and delivered really quickly and it is at the top of my list of go-to takeout places. My favorite dishes are the crab rangoon (which, shockingly, contain a substantial amount of crab) and the panang curry (which is perfectly spiced). The panang is great with chicken and I always get a side order of crispy noodles to add into the curry broth. Another big plus is that they always have delivery specials like free eggrolls with a $15+ purchase.

This is the second time I've been here.  This time there was five of us.  I really like the decor-cute toys, Pez dispensers, etc.  It's quite a small place so you may need to wait a bit for a table.  They have some outdoor seating.  This time I got fried tofu and a spicy soup.  It was really good and they have enough options for me as a vegan (as you can order some dishes without being made with fish sauce, even if it cost $1 more/per dish).  They have a good menu selection.

We went there yesterday after the Yelp event and ended up sitting outside (there was a heat lamp and it was a perfect crisp night)!  Except I forgot that there was a Cubs game last night and people started to trickle on the sidewalk... cascading into rambunctious crowds gushing between our table and Cozy. But the food was excellent.* Well, the Crispy glass noodles were.  Yum! Yum!  Definitely will get that again.   *However, our Tom Kha soup, while tasty, had spoiled tomatoes!  Really, the cook couldn't see the black circle diameter size of a pen?  The black circle was big and on 2 different cubes of tomatoes!!!  I asked the waiter what he thought about this strange vegetable and he was trying to form words.  We sent it back and they gave us another soup and that was spledidly tasty. I really want to give it 4 stars - Because, the food tastes really good and the service was amenable in giving us a new soup.  But, really, being careless enough to have a rotten tomato in a dish is not something that gives me assurance that anything else they prepare is totally safe.
