Cute place. Good food, though we've only tried it once, so we only had one thing. The robot/toy motif is nice, though my son was a bit disappointed he couldn't play with the toys--parents, keep that in mind.  Overall, a good experience for a sidewalk Thai lunch.

Best Thai in the city. The decor aside (which I LOVE!!!) the food is just amazing. And CHEAP! I consider myself a Thai connoisseur and their Pad Khee Mao and Tom Khar soup are second to none. Additionally, any place I can get a kiddy cocktail has my vote. I used to live right up the street and I went there all the time but I forgot until last night that they deliver so I went to their site (which is ADORABLE) and ordered from Grub Hub. A large meal for two, soup and an appetizer came to $22. Can't beat it!

Delicious food and extremely cheap for the portions! Go there for lunch and you won't be disappointed, nor hungry for the rest of the day. The service is always friendly and the decorations are fun to look at while you either wait for takeout or sit for service. Oh but make sure you get the right noodles before you leave if you do takeout, had a mishap once, that's all the negative I can say, but will be going back again, and again, and again!

One of my favorite places in the city!!  Good food...BYOB....cheap and great location! Couldn't ask for a better deal!!  Try the crispy pad thai....my favorite!!! I recently got my boyfriend hooked on this place and now when ever we get noodles it's always from Cozy!

This is my favorite Thai place...ever. I have lived around the corner for the past year, and every experience has been positive. I frequently get carry out but dine in as well. The decor is cute, and the staff is friendly and efficient. The food is always excellent and fresh. No complaints!

I'm a bit of a survivalist when it comes to food.  Sure, it should always taste good, but if my Pad Thai is lacking pepper or whatever, I'd probably never know unless it was really blatantly bland.  When it comes down to it, food is just fuel for your body. That said, Cozy Noodle is only my third Thai food experience ever, and I left totally happy.  The portions are generous, maybe a bit more than I should have had.  I ordered the Noodles Panang, a red coconut-curry cream sauce dish with crispy fried noodles (kind of like a fried wonton dough) fresh basil, and choice of meat (chicken for me, please.)  The curry was sweet, yet had that kick I needed that necessitated many refills of water.  I was bummed they were out of Thai iced tea. Their website mentions a buy-one-get-one offer if you bring in your Cubs ticket.  It never explicitly says Cubs, but the ad is red, white and blue.  So for a good six months out of the year, people have the opportunity to scavenge the grounds at Wrigley for a used stub, so they can eat well and eat inexpensively at Cozy.  What a deal!

GO HERE!!!! I have eaten at this place (at this location and the one in evanston) for over 7 years now, on a near weekly basis.  I LOVE THIS PLACE. Food:  everything is good.  everything.  The noodles panang holds a special place in my heart.  Deep fried wide noodles in panang curry with fresh vegetables and meat of your choice. Ginger chicken is spicy and delicious.  Wanton soup warms you up.  Chicken satay is generous hunks of white meat chicken, served with a refreshing cucumber salad and fantastic peanut sauce.  Deserts are the only weak spot on the entire menu....lychee over ice is just not that good....but the blended boba teas are delicious. Atmosphere:  So much weird kitsch, it's outstanding.  Lunchboxes from 1950s, robots, and musical monkeys in lederhosen.  Old advertisements from major companies from the 60s.  Where else can you go and see this stuff.  And where do they get this stuff?  The lights are even cool.  The tables are old sewing tables and you can actually still turn the spinning wheel on them.  Simply put, you won't find another place quite like it.  Because it is popular, it can get crowded, but I've never had to wait that long.   Service:  Great.  Fast and attentive.  Sometimes they get overwhelmed by the sheer number of people, and they don't quite grasp the bring all the entrees at once concept (I prefer they serve it when it's done anyway). Price:  CHEAP.  Good god it's cheap.  Just find one of the ubiquitous 2-for-1 entree deals (I even have coupons texted to me from their store, just ask them about it) that never expire.   2 entrees and an appetizer will run you around $13!!!!!!! JUST EAT HERE.  If you don't like it, I'll fight you.

My first 5 star...  What a place, great atmosphere, and even better food.  I'm a huge Pad Thai fan and their "Crispy Pad Thai" is exceptional.  I went there on a Friday night and sat right away, albeit in the weird back room, but the decoration was fun and the food was dynamite.  The crab rangoon was perfect and the Pad Thai was the delicious.   This is the type of place you can take your mother, or sister, or stranger who lives close.

I never go a week without ordering Cozy! The food is great. I suggest the Chicken Rama, Pad Thai, Green Curry, Pad Prik and baby eggrolls. Also, if you are planning on dining in there isn't much seating so put your name down early and go grab a drink at one of the bars across the street.. The staff is also very friendly!
Best Thai food I have found.  Excellent delivery.  I love the red and green curry and their Crab Rangoon is perfection.

I almost always order the Pad Si Ewe and Cozy's has the best in Chicago.  Their food is consistently great plus they're always sending out coupons.  I don't think I've ever had an order without at least a free can of pop!

Super good, super delicious.  Best Thai place in the city, I would say.  The decor is by FAR the best of any diner in Chicago.  Lots of cool toys and lamps and all kinds of stuff.  Can be a bit tough if you are vegan or vegetarian, because some stuff will have fish sauce or shrimp, so be careful about that. The family who runs this place are the sweetest people ever.  Pad Thai, super awesome, and the Fried Tofu with the peanut sauce...  oh yeah....

I've gotten take out from Cozy a few times now. They always have great coupons coming in the mail (and on their website), and I'm a sucker for a coupon. I've had the Pad See Ewe a couple of times now. The flavor is delicious, although I wish there was more sauce on it. It hasn't prevented me from getting the dish multiple times, though. The mini egg rolls are delicious, and their tofu soup was just eh (I'd pass on this). The boy loves his fried rice and got their Thai Fried Rice one time (this rice had him in tears because it was so hot), and regular fried rice the other time. Both are solid.  Overall, good take out, but I don't think I'd stop in there for dinner.

Favorite thai place ever. The food is delicious (Pad See Ew, Pad Thai, Crazy Noodles, & Vegetable Egg Rolls are all great), well-priced (not to mention they have mad coupons all the time), the decor is awesome, and the employees are all really nice.

Meh, overall I found the food bland and unexciting.  Not bad, the prices are pretty cheap, and the delivery service was fast, but nothing particularly great either.  Green curry is one of my favorite things to eat, and Cozy's green curry really had very little flavor or heat.  Disappointing.   It's also located about two blocks from Penny's, which, while it has a smaller menu (noticeably lacking in green curry), is much much better.

Cozy is amazing.  We have been frequenting for about 4 years....they have our order memorized.  Which is a little embarrassing that we go that much!   All I have to add to everyone glowing comments is that they have the best and I mean BEST crab rangoon!  Out of town guests insist we go to Cozy when they are here!  I even had a friend eat the last one after it fell on the floor....yes it was after a cubs game where many beverages were consumed, but still they are that good!
Best BYOB on the north side! I highly recommend Cozy Noodle to everyone. I hate to write such a great review, because I love that I can always get a table and there is never a long wait.

I've been eating at Cozy Noodles and Rice for more than 10 years. In this time I've gotten to know the owners well, Tee and Julie are overwhelmingly generous and talented restaurateurs.  The food presentation is artwork, and it's absolutely delicious. The restaurant ambiance and decor is unique and fun. All of the tables and restaurant decorations are handmade by the owners. It's the perfect place for a group of friends, or a fun date night. I simply can't recommend this place enough, it is my favorite restaurant in the city. If you're looking for a place to eat before the Cubs game or any time of the year, don't miss Cozy Noodles and Rice.

This place is awesome! The decorations inside are amazing... who has that many pez dispensers?? Life size barbie kind of creeped me out in the bathroom but overall the place looked so cool! It's like the childrens museum on crack! Crazy model car collectibles line the wall as you enter this small yet brightly colored Thai restaurant. The food too was great. I ordered the tofu pad thai and was happy with my meal! Also ordered the fried tofu and shrimp spring rolls, so good! And its BYOB! :) Me likey the restaurant and food, me no likey the parking lot where you have to reverse into traffic to exit... but hey next time I'll walk no biggie.

I ordered from Cozy Noodle & Rice for the first time this evening, and I think i'm in love!  This all started with a craving for spring rolls, and they were just what was I was looking for.  I'm definitely not one of those-needs to be authentic ethnic food- type people (i'm not sure what authentic thai would taste like).  I got the Crispy Pad See Ewe, crab rangoon, spring rolls and then the mini egg rolls (free with $15 order, which is also the minimum for delivery).  It was all very tasty!   The delivery did take a little over an hour, but i think  it was worth it.

Cozy can have all the stars, seriously. I'm not sure how I went this long without reviewing it.  Food is excellent, and all the people who work here are really awesome. I had a chance to spend a month in Thailand, and when we are really missing it we like to come here and reminisce.  I've never had bad food from here, I literally feel like I could order anything off the menu and not be disappointed.

I LOVE Cozy Noodle!  When I lived in Wrigley I was definitely a regular.  Cozy is a pretty small restaurant with limited seating and can get pretty crowded on weekends for the obvious reasons like BYOB and damn good Thai food.  My personal fav is Lad Nar. The portions are generous and the Cozy lunch specials are really wicked deals. They have bubble teas too, which is always a plus. Another plus is that practically everything you order gives you a choice of beef, chicken or tofo (so vegetarians have plenty of choices.) I'm a chicken kinda gal myself, but have tried all three in a variety of different meals, and all are made to please.  The entire place is covered with vintage toys and knic-nacs, so don't be surprised if you spend your first time there chatting with friends about how they have the exact same Sonic the Hedgehog piggy bank that you had when you were little.  Delivery is fast and easy, but no where near as good as eating in (hence it pains me to only give four out of five stars). There is a mysteriously large gap in quality from eat-in to take-out that can't be explained. My suggestion is to get off your lame ass and go have a bite to eat there, because its definitely worth it.

This is such a cute little Thai place.  It is very cheap and the food was excellent.  It is a must try if you like spicy thai food; their chicken curry is fantastic!  If you are on a tight budget but still like good food, this is the place to try!

(review of delivery only) I have had nothing but positive experiences eating at Cozy Noodles.  I love to eat here in the summer with a six pack and pooch in tow and have a wonderful meal alfresco.  PLEASE only consider this review if thinking about delivery!!! We ordered delivery last night and it was pretty disappointing. I took two bites of my pad thai and was done and the dog got the bf's pepper steak!  All in all just not what I expected from a restaurant that has served me delicious meals in the past.   Not to worry Cozy, I will return and hopefully have my faith restored in your belly pleasing yumminess!

Oh cozy, how I miss you!  We used to stop in here every few months for the Crispy Pad Thai Chicken and Shrimp- YUM.  Now we live too far away for frequent stops at this gem.  No where else in Wrigleyville will you find such a welcoming waitstaff.  Cozy is just as it sounds (maybe a little noisy when it's crowded).  Stop in for a cheap and tasty BYOB experience.  Your server will always have a friendly smile and you can be sure to be surprised by the options on the menu.

I really like Cozy Noodles, so don't be thrown by my 3-Star rating...it's just that I want to save 4 and 5 stars for really phenomenal places. But as far as getting some solid Thai food, Cozy is definitley a good choice - very tasty and very affordable.  I've eaten both at the location (tiny, but cute and cozy - not just a clever name!) and last night we ordered delivery. I ordered the Panang Noodles with Chicken - very good, although not as spicy as I would like! Scuba Steve got the Pad Se Eiw with beef, and it was delicious. The best was a surprise - we got a free order of mini egg-rolls, and while they do come with any delivery order of $15 or more, I thought it was great that I didn't have to ask for them!  Definitley in our Thai delivery rotation!

What a unique place.... They have a cool bathroom with toys all over the place... I mean everywhere! They serve yummy bubble teas and you can also bring your own bottle of wine.  It has been awhile since i have been her but i remember enjoying it!
Consistently delicious, inexpensive and quick. This is one of my favorite fall back picks in the city.

I used to live right down the street and would eat-in or get take-out often. Now Cozy is my go to place for Thai delivery, frankly, it's my go to place for food delivery in general. Menu highlights include: Crispy Pad Thai, crap rangoon, pad woonsen and pad prik (if you like it spiiiicy!) It's cheap it's delicious. They have all kinds of deals so you pretty much always get something or a few things free with your order. I love my Cozy!

Got some very tasty Thai takeout from here the other day!  I had the Pad See Ew...Hi, I know, totally boring.  But it was SO GOOD and sometimes you just crave those big fat noodles, you know? Pot stickers and bubble tea were okay, tea was a little too fakely sweet for me.  And delivery took about 15 minutes longer than they said, which saddens me greatly because I'd like to give them 4 stars.  Maybe next time - and there will be a next time, I will definitely give them more chances.

I have never been inside Cozy, so I cannot comment on the decor. However, from all the lovely comments on it, I am looking forward to dining in.  However, I have ordered several times from them now, for delivery. Every time I have spoken to them, they are quick, attentive, and get my order right. The order always arrives on time or early. The food is tasty, hot (or cold, as it were), and delicious.  The menu is not the most expansive thai/asian/whatever menu on the planet, but what they have is great. The new spicy tofu salad is pretty awesome. And when they say spicy, it's *spicy*! Imagine that. (I'm eyeing several of you, Lakeview Thai Restaurants).  Also: very reasonably priced. Woo.  So, yes, yummy, on-time, spicy, not pricey. I think what we have here is a "win."

As long as you aren't accompanied by someone who is spilling water all over other people's laps, you can expect a fun experience at Cozy. The food is quite tasty, and they have enough random crap on the inside that if you run short on conversation you can point at something and say "HEY LOOK!"

I have to say I was disappointed.  We used to go to the one in Evanston a lot. Never disappointed at all. Even that we had to drive 1 hour to Evanston. Last weekend, we brought some friends and we raved about this place.  We all ordered crispy pad thai and crispy pad see ew. Our favorite dishes. The pad see ew was extremely salty and the crispy noodles were too chewy and hard. I was totally surprised since we were never disappointed with the one in Evanston. One of us even laughed and said she's burning all the calories she got from the pad see ew by chewing the food :) We love the decor and the servers. They're very very nice (that's why I gave them 2 stars instead of 1). We won't stop going to the one in Evanston, they're fantastic... but my friends said they won't come back.  Sorry,... I tried.

Yum!!! This place is definitely cozy -- especially if you go on a weekend night. Both times I've gone during the weekend, there's been about a 20 minute wait. The last time I went, they seated the three of us at a 2-person table so it was a little cramped but DEFINITELY worth it. I've had the garlic chicken and the rama chicken and have not been disappointed (though the former was a little better). The crab rangoon is out of this world - and I don't even like seafood! Also, BYOB is always a win.  This place is also definitely affordable. The last time we went, we got two appetizers, two entrees, a salad, and a bowl of soup all for $33. They also gave us a bunch of coupons when we left, so next time it'll be even cheaper.  Since moving to Chicago, I've eaten at a lot of great places so it's hard to settle on one go-to place for a nice dinner, but this place is awesome whether you're looking for a cute date night or a fun dinner with a few friends.  My only qualms are that it can get pretty cramped during peak hours, and I wish the dessert menu were a little more expansive - other than that, this place is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago!

Cozy, how do I love thee?  Let me count the ways. Your baby egg rolls are delicious And always discounted when I order 2 dishes! Your noodle bowls have veggies galore I try to resist, but I always want more The thai fried rice is my husband's go-to For me, any noodle you create will do Delicious food, fast delivery You also give us 2 pops for free For the best thai food and your value You can't beat Cozy in Lakeview!! PS I'm a bit obessed, it's true Try Cozy and you will be too.

Cozy Noodle & Rice is not my favorite Thai restaurant in Chicago. I'm starting to think I don't have a favorite Thai restaurant in Chicago. Maybe Siam Noodle and Rice. TAC Quick and Spoon are up there, but *only* for eating in, not for delivery. Don't talk to me about Arun's unless you're taking me there. Mama's not made of money. Cozy is, of course, cozy, and cute as hell. The owners are nice, and the atmosphere is fun. None of this matters when I'm ordering delivery, unfortunately, and the food is nothing special. I can't tell the shrimp rolls from the baby egg rolls. The barbecue pork is a little chewy. The spring rolls don't taste like much. Maybe I've been spoiled by overly spiced Thai food. This just isn't cutting for me. I do like their crispy noodles. They travel better than regular noodles, for one. But they also seem to have more kick, and the contrast of the crisp and tender parts on the dish create an interest I find lacking in some of their other offerings. On the plus side, they're currently offering a coupon on Grubhub for 20% off delivery. So they've got that going for them.

I frickin' love this place. I go on an average of about twice a week, and rarely order anything but the Basil Leaves w/ chicken. Not to say that other things here aren't good --everything is good, very good-- but the basil chicken is one of the best Thai dishes I've ever had. Sweet, spicy, saucy, lean, full of a rainbow of fresh bell peppers, it would be great even as a vegetarian dish, but the chicken is what really makes it for me. I often find that chicken in Thai food can be dry, bland, and separate from the sauce/veg's. Not here- the chicken is ground to a perfect texture (it actually looks more like it has been tenderized with a sharp meat hammer) so that it soaks up the sauce and stays perfectly moist (maybe a mixture of dark and white meat?). Anyways, a killer dish. I also love the baby egg rolls- not overly breaded like many places and not overly greasy. Really tasty meat filling and a great spicy/sweet dipping sauce. On a last note, I will describe how awesome it can be to eat at Cozy: I went with 5 friends the other night. I brought one of the "free entree with purchase over $16" coupons that seem to litter the streets of Wrigleyville, and after two hours of great food and an unhealthy amount of delicious top-notch booze (it is byob, and everyone on a weekend seems to take advantage of it by bringing anything ranging from Belgium beer to Hypnotiq to Mickey's forties) our total came $38. That's for 6 people! After tip we were still paying about $8 per person for a delicious meal in a lively, fun environment with our hearts content of good beer and an attentive wait staff.  Because of pocketbook constraints, I might never eat out at another place! Cozy rules. But do me one favor- Don't buy your booze from the Eastern European gangbangers at Gold Crown- worst liquor store in Chicago. Their ''$50" kegs actually cost about $200 when all is said and done; they are some of the most vile, unfriendly people running a business in Chicago; and their prices suck. There is a Binny's a few blocks down on Clark and a Jewel at Broadway and Addison.

The atmosphere alone here is sometimes what makes me walk the extra few steps to eat here. And when That doesn't do it the price will push me over the edge! Cozy's inside is really neat with lots of old toys everywhere.  The menu is generally cheap and while the portions aren't as big as Joy's Noodles, they are almost equally tasty and there is plenty to fill up a hungry belly.   Their 1 dollar lunch special is AMAZING and they are constantly offering coupons on the receipt at the Broadway Jewel. also, if your deciding between Cozy and other local Asian noodle shops you should know that , THEY HAVE BROWN RICE. This makes a difference for me and might help any other health conscious people out there!

Consistently fantastic- LOVE the fried rice with brown rice and the garlic chicken with broccoli. These are the nicest people I've ever encountered in a restaurant, ever. We order at least once every two weeks. LOVE them!!! Their delivery is also super fast.

I love Cozy! The food is always spot-on. The decor brings a smile to your face. The service is wonderful. The prices are great. I first went to Cozy visiting friends in Chicago, and fell in love. Now after living in the city for two years (and many visits to Cozy in our time here), husband and I are moving out of state, and I had to bid Cozy my farewell last night. Delish as always. I will miss you Cozy, and will make a point to visit whenever back in the Windy City! :)

Super yummy. I miss them terribly since moving from Uptown to the West Loop last summer. Back then my boyfriend and I would enjoy a leisurely stroll from our apartment down to this place, enjoy some pretty cheap and smashing Thai food, then burn some calories on the walk back home.  This place is incredibly tiny, so be ready to hear your neighbors conversations and be ready for a wait if it's busy. Luckily I come from a big family so tuning out noise is easy for me. The decor is fun with all sorts of nostalgic toys, minus the creepy doll in the ladies room that totally freaked out my little 10 year old sister.  BYOB and outdoor seating make this a great summertime destination, but we would go in the winter too. Great prices and they also have coupons on their website. The wait staff is incredibly friendly and remember you if you are a frequent flier like we used to be. Don't forget to take a yummy little candy from their candy pot before you leave.

I'm addicted to this place!  it's a must have for me every Sunday.  The staff knows me by my order because I usually get the same thing (chicken fried rice).  I'm a big fan of Thai food and there's so much flavor in the dishes here.  The decor provides a fun, bright, and animated atmosphere.  The staff is nothing short of amazing.  If you're in the neighborhood, stop by and grab a bite.  You won't break the bank, and you'll leave satisfied.

Full points for the decor, but the food was pretty dull.  I ordered the pad woon sen and while nothing was really wrong with it, it wasn't really exceptional in anyway.  Given the plethora of thai restaurants in the area, I can't really see a reason to pay a little extra just to eat mediocre food while looking at kitsch.

I was in town visiting Chicago Yelper Beth E. and she suggested we come here for a bite. Upon entering, we were greeted with a warm welcome and asked if we would like a table by the window. We brought a couple of bottles of wine (I like red and Beth likes white) and our server was more than happy to uncork them although he was a bit amused we had two bottles with us.  The atmosphere consists of shelves of neatly displayed retro toys on the walls; old soft drink signs are scattered about and the windowsills are lined with more toys. Loved the life size Elvis statue! But the coolest was the women's bathroom wallpapered with Pez dispensers and lunch pails.  Now onto the food, I ordered the Dumpling Noodles - stuffed shrimp dumpling, Chinese broccoli, bean sprouts, egg noodles and BBQ pork served in clear broth. The broth had great flavor and I enjoyed every last bite.  If I lived in the area, Cozy Noodles would be on my regular rotation of Thai restaurants and definitely a place to take visiting guests. The staff here is super friendly and the food, atmosphere and price points made me a fan!

Pros:  The atmosphere is amazing. My first time there (ordering take-out) I was waiting in a small room in the back whose walls are covered in dozens (maybe hundreds) of bobble head dolls. Additionally, the restaurant, while close to the Clark St. Wrigleyville madness, is tucked away on Sheffield and thus avoids some of the drunken testosterone-fueled mayhem less than a block away. Cons:  Having gone on a search of the best local Thai food, I think Cozy's food itself isn't as good as some of the neighboring options.

Great little place. Truly  is cozy! We went with a group of 7 on a Saturday night so we expected to have to wait. Felt bad about being in the way and tried to not disturb those who were actually seated.  The food was great. Our table had orders of the BBQ pork, Crunchy Pad Thai, Wonton Noodles, and Garlic Chicken Noodles. We also got edamame and the mixed appetizer.  The Chruncy Pad Thai was unique but everyone really loved it. Some of the men who ordered the BBQ pork were a tiny bit hungry, because they didn't eat the white rice that accompanied it. Everyone ate all their food and were pretty satisfied with the portions and flavors. The food was presented nicely, arrived quickly and the service was super friendly.  Very happy, would have given it 5 stars if it was a tiny bit bigger, but then again, that's part of the charm! . My sister had a coupon for a buy one get one free entree. Our bill was about $60 for 7 entrees, 2 appetizers and a bubble tea. Super good food and great prices. Love the BYO! Will definitely eat here again

My husband loved it but I was disappointed.  The steamed shumai was really good, but my entree of pad see ew was underwhelming.  My husband prefered mine over his own entree.  I think he must have liked the decor.  The service was very good.

If my life were the show "Cheers," Cozy Noodle would be the place where everybody knows my name.  My first visit to Cozy was about 2 years ago, before I lived in the city. While we did have to wait quite a while to be seated (we had a party of 5) the food made it well worth the wait. My best suggestion is to go EARLY and OFTEN. The prices are more than reasonable, food is quality, decor/ambiance is one of a kind. I took my brother and his girlfriend here when they visited me last week. My brother's girlfriend, who had never had a "good Thai experience," was hesitant at first, but after eating asked if we could come back before they left on Saturday.  Service is fast, food is great. My only complaint is I wish they had more room. While the smallness of it is cozy, it's not so cozy having someone's elbow in your ear while they wait for a table to open up.

A few Mondays ago, I would have given my arm for some Tom Yum soup. Correction, I would have given my arm for some Tom Yum Soup without me having to venture out into the bitter cold. Penny's is my go to place for TY, but for whatever reason, they don't like to open on Monday's. I figured I'd give Cozy a whirl, and was pleasantly surprised to find out that they had no delivery minimum (all I wanted was soup!) and that I could get TWO servings of soup (one for later!) for under $9. The delivery was quick, and my soup was piping hot despite being delivered in single digit weather. When compared to my standard (Penny's) I found it to be a suitable substitute. I would have preferred a thinner base and more lemongrass, but my tastes were easily appeased by adding lemon juice. The only thing that would prevent me from coming here Tuesday-Sunday is the tail on shrimp. I can't for the life of me understand why tail on shrimp would be used in a soup!

Aside from giving me ideas for my own home decor, Cozy Noodle & Rice is a total win. My friend, Amanda, has been a patron since day one and insisted on taking me there for dinner yesterday night. Her sell? "The interior looks like your brain." I was sold. I had the Mixed Vegetables Stir-fried with tofu in a garlicky gravy sauce. Yum to the  tenth power. I will be back again soon. Be sure to wash your paws in the bathroom. You will not be disappointed.

I can't believe I have not reviewed this joint by now!  Been here too often to count - great atmosphere with all the toys!  Fun to take kids visiting town too because they don't get bored.  Food is always satisfying and filling.  You really can't go wrong here with noodles, rice, curry dishes.... all good stuff.  And it is BYOB!  I would say it is good for groups because of the atmosphere, but not really because it is so small.

this is one of my favorite cheap eats in chicago! i go in there a couple times a week during the summers.  Its byob which is nice and does not have a corking fee if you bring wine. The kitch factor is hilarious and awesome. you never run out of things to look at, every time i go back i find something new on the walls that i haven't noticed before. The food is always consistently good, hot, fast, and cheap.  i have come to get to know the people who work there, so now i always get free appetizers and sometimes they just bring random stuff out for us to try, they are very nice. the tofu is awesome and the lard na is fab. (get it spicy <3 )   if you haven't expierenced cozy noodle, i suggest you get off your computer right now and go check it out, i promise you wont be dissapointed and you will be wanting to come back tomorrow!

Food is consistently delicious and the prices are reasonable compared to other spots in the area. Dine-in is a great experience - I love to bring out of towners here to revel in the decor. Delivery is also consistent - comes hot and when they say it will (usually less than an hour). I love the crazy noodles and the pad thai. They also have some good bubble tea - great during the summer time.

The healing powers of the crispy pad see ewe can not be understated.  It is, without a doubt, the most effective method to rid yourself of a hangover.  Make sure to use plenty of sriracha as well. Since I left Wrigleyville I jump on every opportunity I can to revisit Cozy for some tasty Thai treats.  I've tried most of the items on the menu with the previously mentioned crispy pad see ewe and the curry fried rice nabbing top honors.  Don't forget to hit up the liquor store before hand because BYOB makes everything taste better.  The staff is super (duper!) nice and attentive. I also feel extremely safe knowing that dozens of robots are protecting me while I shove lovingly prepared Thai food in my face.

I tried the chicken pad see ewe and it was pretty good. It's better than Sura in the neighborhood, but I've only had the pad thai at Duck Walk, so I can't compare the two easily. I got delivery and it didn't take terribly long, and they give you a free soft drink with every entree ordered.

Awesome.  They make this crunchy noodles and vegetables dish (with your choice of meat or tofu) that is unique to any Thai place I've dined at.  It's nutricious and delicious.  I love it with tofu.  Everything is great here and I've tried probably all of it.  Awesome ambience...a place I would take a Chicago visitor to for sure.  And, of course, it's famous women's bathroom...another reason to see a Cubs game...just a block south of beloved Wrigley field.

Pretty good!  Glad I tried it, but I can't say they completely won me over.  I ordered my new favorite dish from Cozy through grubhub, Panang Curry over crispy noodles. The dish was good but no where near as good as Joy's!   Their fried rice was quite mushy, even for delivery...  Also, can't say their portions were HUGE like other yelpers claim.    What was good was the rice soup I ordered...   I feeling a little guilty for cheating on Joy...  and unfortunately I'm feeling a little duped by these yelp reviews... I was expecting such greatness!   Perhaps my expectations were simply too high.

My friend has been trying to get me to go here for the last few months. The day finally came! If I had read the menu before, it would have happened sooner. They offer Crispy Pad See Ewe, which is ridiculously tasy. I'm a huge fan of the crispy noodles! We ordered take out, so I didn't get the chance to dine in but the space is cute. The bathroom is a must see...trust me on that.

Cozy deserves a Nobel prize for my first dining experience there in August 2009. I was with a birthday party of 11 who somehow managed to ring up a tab of only $60, emptied approximately 9 wine bottles and a case of beer (it's a BYOB joint) and then topped off the  evening by having the birthday boy vomit  merlot and red curry chicken all over himself as the busboy was mopping the floors and putting the chairs up.  The staff may have amassed a small fortune from us as various members of our guilt-ridden party slipped them twenties, but I still revere them as saints in their own right for putting up with us. Though their proximity to Wrigley probably wins them worse customers than us (if possible), I would recommend Cozy for anyone on the north side looking for a fun, inexpensive BYOB place with awesome staff. Solid Thai choices (my favorite in the city for pad thai tofu and pad see eew) and really low prices - both of these dishes run $6.95. They also have awesome delivery and run lots of promotions (right now you get a free drink with every entree!) and will probably deliver to you, wherever you may be, since they seem to have the largest delivery radius in the city.

As far as Thai restaurants are concerned, this one easily takes the cake for decor: quirky, bohemian and humorous, it's kitsch-meets-Andy Warhol. The Crispy Phad Kee Mao was unlike any I've tried: traditional Thai flavors throughout, but with crisply-fried wide rice noodles infused with flavors of soy and--I'm guessing--nam pla (fish sauce).  While I didn't try it, I don't doubt that the $1.99 (!) special of Chicken and Rice Noodles would be the finest Asian food value in all of Wrigleyville. The Won Ton soup, Phad Thai, and Mixed Appetizer were all delicious.  Everything was plated simply and tastefully. From the decor that looks like an post-modern art project on steroids to the letter from mom in Thailand to the food, everything exudes an ambience of, well, joyfulness, a fine accompaniment to a chilly Chicago winter. [N.B. This is a BYOB establishment.]
When I'm back home in Chicago, I visit CoZy Noodles. Period.

The crispy pad thai is awesome.. ? Lies! It's a huge portion too? Lies again! You lie reviewers. Quit lying you pollyanna's. It was iddy biddy, on a small rectangular plate. They don't skimp on the meat though so plus on that. I guess it's huge if you eat like an anorexic bird or a 3 year old human. I only bought mine home cuz you know when you wait a long time to eat then when it comes time to eat you're no longer that hungry?- so I only ate about a quarter of it and it was okay- not dream worthy at all though. It was more, "oh, okay... hmmm. Glad I checked that off my list of things to try and get over it finally" It gets annoying after awhile chomping down on all that crispiness so ordering it regular would be better. It's only fun after the first 2 bites. It's cheap here though but then again it was small. If they were to charge me 10 bucks for that like they do at thai places out west and I'm not even at a nice restaurant, I'd be so pissed! Fuck that. It did come with meaty baby eggrolls though. It's a cutesy little place and I'd probably come check it out again especially cuz it's byob. I love byob. Don't google map this shit cuz google maps totally fucked me up on this when it ended up being simpler than said directions. hmmmph! I really wanted to pull over, hail a cab and make them take me there instead. There's really nice people here but they can chill out a little bit.. I felt a little rushed at times and it wasn't even packed. This could be a cute, casual date spot; I want to drag someone here.

Fabulous, delicious, cheap, huge portions, BYOB + no corking fees.  I started off with an appetizer combo of Crab Rangoon, way more flavorful then your average glob of deep fried cream cheese, then the Baby Egg Rolls, were tasty and very tiny but my favorite was the Shrimp Rolls. Small but bursting with perfectly simple flavors. Crispy and not greasy, just enough seasoning so I could still taste the shrimp.  For my entree I got the Crispy Pad Thai Special. Stir-fried crispy wide rice noodles with shrimp and chicken, egg, green onions and bean sprouts for only 7.50. I eat a lot, especially when I love something, but there's just so much! I only finished half. The noodles are so crispy with a candy like coating with a touch of sweetness. It's so well done. This place is truly one of those 'small treasures'. I was with my husband, we got the combo appetizer and two entrees, cost only $23! I wish this place was bigger, it was packed and there's no waiting area. Totally worth it though.

This is my favorite Thai restaurant!  I used to live around the corner from this place and my now-husband and I would go there all the time. We now live in the west loop, but still venture there from time to time to grab some dinner. The staff is the nicest I've ever encountered, the service is great, it's BYOB (no corkage fee), and it's a fun, little "cozy" restaurant.  I recommend it hands down and I have no complaints at all!  Try the Chicken Pad See Ewe and the Crab Rangoon - to die for!  The prices are very reasonable too!

I love Cozy Noodles!  The Wrigleyville location is just like the name sounds - totally cozy.  They staff are friendly.  The food is delicious.  My go to is the Chicken Pad Thai, but all the appetizers and curries are great.  My roommates and I will sometimes just order delivery of one of each of the appetizers and share.  Baby Egg Rolls, Crab Rangoon, and my personal favorite - Vegetable Rolls with Peanut Sauce (not vegetable egg rolls, very different!)  And Thai Ice Tea is a treat! I went to the Evanston Location for the first time the other night.  It is larger but still holds the same charm.  The Chicken Pad Thai although delicious as usual had a darker thicker texture to it that didn't sit quite  right with my stomach.  The Veg Rolls were identical to those in Wrigleyville.  Yummy! Overall a great experience.

I just so happened to stumble along this place... Luckily, i went there on a nice quite afternoon where I could enjoy a meal. The inside is small, kept clean and the two behind the counter were nice. I ordered the chicken Pad tai.  Lots of chicken and it was filled to the top.  Very filling and Very delicious! MMMMMM!!!   They asked if I wanted the lunch special that came with egg rolls for $5. Great deal, but! Would have been fine with out the egg rolls... The sweet and sour (?) sauce they had with it was good, but the egg rolls basically are the size of your pinkie and could be finished in less then a bite.  I also ordered their pot stickers... again would have been fine with out them. Came with 6 bite size again. But that sesame sauce was great too! Just kept dipping my pad tai right in there I couldn't get enough of either them! Would defiantly go back when ever I am in the neighborhood!

The decor makes it seem like an Asian TGI Fridays, but the food is really quite good.  Reasonably priced at about 7 for main dishes and cheap apps and salads (around $2).   BYOB is both a plus and a minus here.  And the only reason I'd give it a lower rating is that it was absolutely filled to the brim with drunk people.  One table had stopped eating long before and was just sitting there, yelling at each other and finishing their wine.   I didn't quite enjoy the drunk (and probably underage) people, but the food outweighs it and I'd certainly go again.

I have eaten here about 100 times because my husband used to live 2 doors down when we were still dating. BEST crab rangoon in the city - hands down. My husband is obsessed with the cashew chicken. I really like all their curry dishes and anything with peanut sauce.  I prefer to just grab take out lately but you have to dine at one of their sewing machine dinner tables at least once. The owner collects old toys and pez dispensers and the entire place is filled with fun!  A great little place to check out for amazing food and fun/casual atmosphere.

New in town and we have found our neighborhood Thai place!! We stopped in on a walk one night because we loved the look of the place from outside. We both ordered the Pad Thai... really yummy!! The ambience is very fun, cute, warm and welcoming... for sure not a typical Thai place. We can't wait to go back! :)

Really enjoyed my meal here -- had crispy pad thai (never tried it before, delish), friend had crazy noodles (also good), and we split the appetizer sampler that had crab rangoon, spring rolls and egg rolls. Everything was yummy (we thought the sweet and sour sauce and the crab rangoon were particularly good), and -- even better -- we got out of there for under $30 INCLUDING tax and tip. We also brought a bottle of wine, as it was BYOB (no corking fee, nice). The portions were generous but not over-the-top: we both came hungry, ate most of what was on our plates, and left pleasantly full but not stuffed. Really nice dinner. The restaurant itself is pretty small and cozy with all kinds of crazy toys and kitsch on the walls. Fun, but definitely more on the casual side. It was fairly full on a Tuesday night -- mostly younger couples taking advantage of the BYOB. Will definitely go again.

I love the low prices, the amazing red curry (the best I have ever had) and the funky ambiance - all of which make this one of the best casual, BYOB Thai spots in Chicago! No complaints except that last time I went they wouldn't honor the coupon they sent in the mail! Kind of a bummer but everything else is great so I can't complain too much! Oh, the coffee they serve is awful so stay away from that and order a bubble tea instead.

Eat (bomb Thai food), drink (your own wine) and be merry! This place is fabu - from the friendly staff to the kitschy décor - I am a fan!  I have never had to wait for a seat here when dining in, and their delivery is super prompt!  The one time it took a little bit longer than they said, they arrived with a coupon in hand for my next order!  The bathroom is awesome.  Menagerie of Pez dispensers. You must check it out.  My favorite thing however is a framed letter and returned Pez dispenser that was mailed back to them after a friend stole it while in an altered state.  Food wise I would recommend the Shrimp Rolls. HOLY SCMHOLY.  Shrimp wrapped in rice paper and fried.  Fat kids rejoice! Crazy Noodles and Pad See Ewe are always a good choice.  I always get noodles and have yet to branch out into the entrees or curry. Additionally, it's BYOB.  Only heads up on this place - the parking lot is teeny tiny.  Took about 15 minutes for me to navigate mom's rental car out of it.  Little Austin Powers golf-cart action.  Also, paying with multiple cards is iffy. I can't remember if they only take one or two cards per check, but it's best to just bring cash when going Cozy.

We were unimpressed.  First the language barrier caused our sit down order to be made into a to go order.  We both got the Pad Thai.  It was extremely bland.  My husband's chicken Pad Thai had too much bones and gristle to be edible.  Go there for the atmosphere, but eat elsewhere

Cozy Noodles is my go to place everytime I see a show at the Vic Theater.  I took my boyfriend there for the 1st time last Saturday night, and he loved it...  We had the Shrimp Special Appetizer, and we both had the Crispy Pad Thai with chicken and shrimp.  It was delish!  We also split a Coconut Bubble Tea - YUM!  I love everything about this place - the location, the atmosphere, everyone who works there is friendly, food is great, and it's BYOB!

I'm a fan! Super cute little restaurant, and open on a Monday - fantastic.  Best part, they are always busy and there is almost always a wait, but if you give the host your cell phone number you can go off shopping nearby and they will call you when your table is ready.  We always go off to the nearby (great) used bookstore that is practically across the street and then come back for dinner when our table is ready. Try the crispy pad thai, and make sure to visit the bathroom while you're there - amazing collection of Pez dispensers!

Cozy is our go-to spot for thai food.  The prices are reasonable and the food is very good.  It is also BYOB.  The decor is awesome, full of retro toys.  The table are also converted sewing machines.  Delivery is very speedy as well.  We've timed them at 30 minutes in the past.  My favorite is the panang curry.  Yum!

How exciting is was to discover that Wrigley offers some cultured fun.  Admittedly, Cozy is Americanized, yet it appears exotic in comparison to Wrigleyville barscape. The restaurant is consistently packed with happy patrons, excited to taste new Thai specialties and sip their favorite wine.  And everyone should be happy.  The food is good, the decorations are playful, and modest dining area is exactly what its name indicates - Cozy (yet not cramped)! Highly recommended as a fun alternative to the conventional Wrigleyville hangout.

I eat here way to much! It's good food. I have always feel like it is a 50/50 shot at these kind of noodle places when it comes to quality food, but Cozy's pulls it off.  Their Pad Thai could not be a more perfect choice to fulfill any lunch or dinner. Consistently nicely cooked noodles, the right amount of egg, green onions, and chopped peanuts. This any the mini egg rolls and you will fall in love as well.  The one thing I do find odd about this place is the mixed interpretation I have gathered from the decor. I just can't figure out what they were thinking between the 60's like hanging beads to the license plates, and overwhelming amounts of colored tiles. But the food they offer and the friendly staff do more then enough to make up for the odd decor. Oh, and make sure that if you are in the area for a ball game to bring your ticket in. I believe it's buy one entree get one free with proof (ticket stub) of attendance to the game. Enjoy!

Favorite restaurant bathroom in Chicago. Hands down. I love this place! I went on a Saturday for dinner with friends who live in the neighborhood and eat here regularly.  It did not disappoint.  I had the red curry with tofu and it was delicious but way way more than I could eat. Seriously ridiculous portions.  And our server was very accommodating with my friend who had several special requests including substituting rice for noodles.... probably more accommodating than he should have been.... Would also be a great place to bring a date, the vintage toy collection on the walls spawned some great conversation topics.
Gotta love this place. Cheap food with a byob patio. Love it!

There is not enough time to say all the good things about Cozy.  But I will try: 1. They have, quite simply, delicious food.  Their Pad See Ew is unrivaled in the city, their curries are delicious, and I highly recommend anything with the garlic sauce.  My roommate went to Thailand and said he couldn't find anything as good as Cozy, and I believe it. 2. The prices are very reasonable.  And a free soda with every delivery or take-out entree! 3. The people are the nicest.  The manager (and I think owner) Tee is a delightfully kind man.  Introduce yourself once and you'll be a VIP for life. 4. It's a fun place to eat.  The decor is retro-tastic.  (Make sure you see the bathrooms.)  The place is never empty but rarely overcrowded.  And it's BYOB, which is always nice. 5. Delivery is prompt and accurate. Why are you still reading?  Go eat something! (For those who might think I'm on the payroll of Cozy for writing a review like this... trust me, the opposite is far closer to the truth.  I am there at least twice a week.)
I had the Pad See Ewe and it was very good. Great toys. Waiters are really nice even though they don't speak English. I'll be going back

I've been wanting to try this place out for a few months and finally convinced my husband to come along.  The decor is interesting-there's a lot to look at and it's far from the typical thai place.  It took forever to have someone take our order but the food came quickly.  It was delicious and very reasonably priced.  i had the shrimp pad thai, i can't remember what my husband but he seemed to like it-especially after dosing it with hot sauce.   While we were sitting there, we noticed a lot of people coming in just for take-out bubble teas.  By the time we got the waiter's attention again we decided to just get the bill but also ordered two of the green tea bubble teas to-go.  The first few sips were delightful but then we were both surprised by the black gel-like balls that got sucked up in the big straw.  i'm assuming they serve a purpose in the creation of the bubble tea but after awhile i was just spitting the flavorless balls out in garbage cans i passed as I walked down Clark St.  The drink got a little bland after awhile, but it's a big cup and maybe i wasn't drinking it fast enough.  I'll definitely come back and probably get the pad thai again but maybe try the mango bubble tea instead.

HOT HOT HOT! Robots and Pop Culture Flair really get my motor going. Throw in some tasty Thai noodles. Sprinkle in some sassifyin' BYOB beverage of choice and I'm bound to be drooling at the mouth in ecstasy! They frequently have coupons in the mail and a nearby liquor store has them too if you happen to be en route and wanna save a buck or two. I feel pretty special showing out-of-towners this eatery because of the awesome decor and the barely-there dent in my wallet afterwards.

What a wonderful ambiance and delicious food. This is the best Thai I have had in a long time, and since they're BYOB, it makes it even more delicious. I highly recommend their shrimp rolls, edamame, and, well... everything! I have eaten here more than a dozen time, and have never once been disappointed. I'm unsure what I would do without it.  Lakeview wouldn't be the same without this place. Even if you just want broccoli and beef, Cozy delivers.

i can't say enough about cozy noodles. it's byob, the food is delicious and cheap (their crab rangoon is tops!) and the decor makes it way more special than your typical thai restaurant. cozy has taken great care to make sure everything in the restaurant has a loving touch - from the tables, the menu's design to the bathrooms - it all works and brings personality to the place, making it perfect for parties. avoid long waits on fridays and saturdays - although they don't advertise it on their website, they DO take reservations. and they're not pushy about turning over tables or limiting you to a certain number of bottles per person (but still, be polite for those who are waiting.) back to the food, i've ordered at least ten things off the menu and they're always spot on. good portion sizes too. oh, and if you're into bubble tea - you have to try it here. their honey dew and mango teas are the best. i always get one whenever i'm in the area. i've also ordered delivery from here; it always arrives within 20 minutes, nice and hot. check the website for coupons!
This is my favorite Thai place in Chicago!  I love the crab rangoons and Green Tea Bubble Teas!  I order out mostly and the service is quick and the food always delcious and hot.  LOVE THIS PLACE!

Cheap, delicious Thai. Love the quirky decor. Try not to order the special crispy pad thai though because apparently there are no noodles involved in that dish! They're replaced by this bizarre crispy crackers of some sort and as the dish cools down, it becomes tough and chewy.  Nevertheless, everyone else enjoyed their meal. I'd still come back for real pad thai instead.

5 Stars for: Great Food, Great Service and very friendly owner (although some of the new kids are a little slow), Convinience: Just down the street from me, and of course it is BYOB!   Some favorites are: Steamed shrimp shumai (with fried garlic on top), their mountain of a portion of Seaweed Salad,  Lard Na, Pad Khe Mao, can't go wrong with their Pad Thai either.....and to wash it all down (that's if you don't bring a nice bottle of white wine), a refreshing, ice cold Thai Iced Tea..... Damn, i might walk over there after posting this review....i've made my own mouth start to water....

Cheap Thai.  Ahhh, such music to my ears!  As far as Thai places in the Lakeview area are concerned, this place is one of my favorites. I've tried the Pad Khee Mao, Coconut Curry, Pad Prik, Cashew Chicken, and Crispy Pad Khee Mao, and the only thing that I haven't enjoyed was the Crispy Pad Khee Mao. I enjoy crisp noodles, not hard noodles, and these were painful to chew. Not cool. My other gripe is that in each of the 10+ times I have been here, our table never gets all of our entrees at once. Usually it only takes 3-5 minutes to get all the entrees out, but there were two times where my girlfriend and I had to wait over 20 minutes for one of our entrees. The worst part is that you have to go through the "you should start eating your food!" and the "no, that's okay, I'll wait for you" awkwardness that lasts until everybody finally gets their food. Or you could just start eating and forget about everybody else at your table. Both options work just swell. Aside from Cozy's timing mishaps, this place is a solid spot for deliciously cheap Thai food. Just remember to print out a coupon from Cozy's site before you visit!
BYOB. Fun atmosphere. BYOB. Great food. Try the Veggie Tofu Soup and the Crazy Noodles.

We call this place Robot thai :)  fun times... Great decor and good crab Rangoon..  I also had a Lychee smoothie with pearls which was delish.. I didn't really eat any of their entrees but I would go back for the funky Robots lining the walls of the store and the bubble teas alone! :)

How have I not yet reviewed Cozy Noodle?! The food is good, and service is super fast.  The place definitely has a fun interior with all their toys all over the walls and you are eating on converted old sewing machines for tables (i think anyways).  Delivery always shows up piping hot, which is great, and if you go to their website they usually have great coupons.  They're also BYOB which is always near and dear to my heart, and everyone there is really nice.  I'm actually going here tonight for dinner with some friends, nom nom nom.

the food is ok my noodles were overcooked and the price was a little high, i would go there in jam and if in a hurry for a carry out order but would never bring a family member a friend in for lunch if they were visiting from out of town, its just one of your standard neighborhood hole in the wall joints. Jitlada is waaaaaaaaay better!

Hands down, my favorite Thai food in Chicago. The food is delicious, the service is friendly, and the prices are cheap. The decor feels like the owner of Uncle Fun came in one day and went crazy. Pez dispeners line the wall of the bathroom and robots cover the walls of the dining room. My one complaint is that the dishes rarely come out at the same time. Although I realize that some dishes take longer to cook, this never seems to be a problem at other Thai restaurants. There is a very small parking lot on the side of the building, but it's almost always full. You're better off parking on Sheffield (no residential permit needed.) Also, check the Cubs schedule before heading out unless you're okay eating Thai food next to drunk  and loud Cubs fans.

I think the first few times I was in here I may have just been enchanted by the adorableness of it all.  I loved the Singer sewing machine tables and the toys.  But I also loved that they could make just about anything on the menu without fish sauce!!!   So it was kind of my go-to because my new boyfriend loved thai food and I loved him and I also loved feeling comfortable that I wasn't ingesting meat products against my own will.  In the intervening time I've continued to love my boyfriend and I've acquired his affection for thai food and my affection for Cozy Noodles and RIce hasn't waned in the least.  Still love the red curry and the panang curry and the panang noodles and the pad thai. Also the fried tofu and the spring rolls. I also am a fan of Jitlada and Opart but Cozy is kind of my benchmark for vegetarian thai food.  I just love it, yo.

First things first, whoever eats at Cozy Noodles and doesnt use a coupon (assuming you can spend at least $15), you are just dumb in my book and should leave Chicago. That is like going to Bed Bath and Beyond and not using a 20% off coupon. At some point it is a matter of principle. If you forgot your coupon, they have a box outside of the store with hundreds of them (they are on the takeout menu) and there are some by the cash register. So here is the deal, I dont officially know if Cozy is as good as it gets, to be honest. But it is pretty freaking awesome. You get a ton of food and enough for leftovers and usually cant spend more than $7 per person. I always get the chicken pad thai and it is always consistently delicious. The flavor is just incredible. How do you do it Cozy? I always bring people here and they always love it, no matter what they order. The ambiance, especially if you sit outside, is just great. It is so eclectic! I have tried the beef salad and it is very good.  Ok so the one thing I HATE about Cozy - They dont know how to split a check. Dont ask. They look at me like I have 9 heads, and I know they understand me, but they just wont do it. They also dont accept more than 2 forms of payment per table. Dont go in with 4 friends and expect to pay with 4 different cards. 2 people will be out of luck.  Oh yes and one more thing - If you have leftover and want to bring them home, DO NOT HAVE THEM DO IT.  They will try, but BE STRONG. Everytime they do it, I seem to lose half of my Pad Thai, which to be honest, I would push my mother down stairs for. I now ask for the box myself (always a hassle) and do it. Its worth the effort. GO INTO THE BATHROOMS! And for whichever gender you do not identify with, have someone else open the door so you can peek in. It is worth the creepiness. A great Chicago place, and potentially a landmark in mind. I would go here any day over Penny's.

I really wanted to like this place. I love their "Thai restaurant in a tin toy store" decor and crazy signage. But the love stops there. I admit I was initially intrigued by the "super fried" options on the menu. Basically you can get any noodle dish with deep fried rice noodles instead of the usual pan fried noodles. I expected crispy noodles but instead they were just stiff and hard to chew, both times I tried ordering it.  This seems like a poorly executed attempt to make the dishes more enticing to an American palette (as to "Americanize" any ethnic food seems to mean to make it bigger and deep fried.) which doesn't enhance, but undermines the flavors and textures of the traditional dish.  So, D- for the noodle dishes, and only a C for the beef salad, yellow curry and tom yum soup which were all on the bland side. I've been here twice and was either underwhelmed or outright disappointed in everything I've ordered. Sorry Cozy, but I'll be leaving you to your fan base of Wrigleyvillers who enjoy watered-down Thai.

K so I arrived at my friend's house to watch a movie. On the way, I had a granola bar and that was about all I had that day. My friend asked if I was hungry...um...STARVING thx4asking! Now, what to eat...this whole dinner thing became epic. "Chinese delivery?" He suggested. Why, yes, that is what I was thinking about on the way. Monday night movies pair well with takeout. Tried one website...online orders were down and so was the phone line. Okay, next. Started looking at another place's menu when he said, "WAIT I know the PERFECT place. AND. They have Thai." My brain exploded. A quick survey of the menu and I knew what I wanted: Cashew chicken with brown rice. As he ordered, I perused the beverages menu. HOLD THE PHONE AND ORDER ME A THAI ICED BUBBLE TEA. STAT! 30 minutes later, we were sitting on the floor eating and watching He's Just Not That Into You. Dinner was amazing! Just the perfect amount of spice with the perfect price tag. Free baby egg rolls, too (Or fried tofu if you're into that sorta thang.)!

What an interesting little place! For a Thai restaurant or any restaurant for that matter, the decor was very unique! The restaurant is filled with antique toy collections ranging from Betty Boop to Pez dispensers which adorn the walls. Not your typically Thai restaurant!  The food was delicious, inexpensive, and the service was great! And it was nice that it was BYOB! Helped us save some money from spending dinero on overpriced drinks! Their was a bit of a language barrier and we had some difficulty ordering, but no big deal!  A friend and I came here to celebrate his birthday. We both love Thai cuisine and Cozy definitely is one of our new favorites. He loved his food - he ordered the Pad Thai, said it was delicious and is already planning on coming back their with his girlfriend.  I ordered the Beef Salad - very good, very spicy and flavorful, full of veggies, and appeared relatively healthy.  If you look at their take out menu or website, they have a lot of coupons/deals. One of the coupons was if you ordered one dinner entree, your second entree was free as long as the bill came out to at least $15 dollars. We both had soup and an entree and w/ using the coupon, our entire dinner was only $17 and we had leftovers! What a great deal! Loved the place! Can't wait to go back :)!  Just as good as any other expensive Thai restaurant in Chicago with a fraction of the cost! Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.  Oh, by the way, they do have parking but their are only three spots so it might be difficult to find parking around the restaurant. Luckily, we found street parking!

I get the same thing whenever I eat Thai, so I feel particularly qualified to judge a city's worth of "mixed vegetables with tofu and brown rice."  Cozy's is great, but the attention paid to the decor is what sets them apart.  It's plenty kitschy, but not self-consciously so.  Unique place with good food that is affordable even for this student.  Cozy Noodles, I'm glad you're here.

Vintage action figures, PEZ dispensers as art, low prices, and delicious Thai food.  If these things appeal to you, 1) you are awesome, and 2) you should visit Cozy Noodle & Rice. We had the $4.99 lunch special.  The baby egg rolls and spring rolls were tasty and adorable - a nice size for lunch appetizers.  The Pad Thai and Spicy Khee Mao were excellent and generously, yet appropriately, portioned. Service was great.  Couldn't have asked for a better experience.  We'll be back.

Americanized, but what the hell. The restrooms are Pez'd or Warhol'd out. We had photoshoots in the bathroom--unashamedly. after we finished our food, of course. oh yeah, back to the food. I had the pad woonsen with the spring rolls; the noodles came with shrimp and chicken and...I have nothing much to say about it (I'm from super Asian Cali) but oh, the kitschy decor...

I don't even know where to start on this one! THE BEST THING EVER! If you like Thai you are in for it! Very pleasantly situated right next to the CUBS Stadium for those of you Cubbie Fans - on the Sheffield Strip a good two blocks away from the stadium... and YES you can find peace & quiet here.  I came across it accidentally... & due to the OUTSTANDING service from every single ONE of the smiling, overly attentive staff makes it SOO hard to want to go anywhere else! I have found happiness. Pure Thai Happiness. And for even more happiness: try the Smoothies: Green Tea, Lychee, Mango.. anything! More of a coffee person? $1 coffee my friends.  Hungry before the game: go here. Hungry after the game: go here. Hungry the day after the game: you get it  Everything from the classic Thai options to the exceptions: Veggie Spring Rolls & Lycee on Ice!  Originally, I arrived to a flux of coupon galore... they were flying everywhere - deals here and there! It felt like I hit the sale aisle & hit the jackpot. 1. Coupon DEAL: Buy 1 entree get one free as long AS the total bill hits $15. Until 5.31.09 Keep this in mind people. 2. Lunch specials during the WEEK are $1.99. Total Craziness. 3. NEWEST SPECIAL: Cub Fans: free entrée with game ticket!  BONUS POINTS: BYOB includes chilling your lovely bottle of bubbly or Shiraz in a snazzy steel bottle holder insulator. No cork fee's/no chilling fee's. You've lucked out on ALL accounts.  I almost had to give myself a double take. "Tee" the owner makes you feel like VIP. Taking the time to say hi, chat it up a bit & wish you well on your journey home is a natural for him. After my first appearance I was greeted with a coupon upon my second journey into the Cozy World. I was given the coupon! Didn't have to ask, beg or give a friendly reminder. Now that special is over... BONUS POINTS: With proof of  Cubs Ticket... ah hem... free meal. I mean come on.  Let's speak décor for a moment:  A children's wonderland. Full of Barbie's, Toy Trucks, Pez & Route 66, Fast Food Memorabilia. To compare it - Willy Wonka. That which made McDonald's such a commodity back in the day is at Cozy: Happy Meal Toys! If you ever inclined to go back in time or entertain a group of kids, this is the place. It is so different you just have to try it.  Group seating: CHECK. Romantic seating for two: CHECK. Outdoor Seating: CHECK. Amazing food & service: DOUBLE CHECK. What are you waiting for? Tell Tee I say hello & I'll be there this week.

I don't like spicy food but I will eat it at Cozy. I don't even know why. This is the one place I will allow my tongue to feel like I used it to rearrange logs in a fire. I'm sure most people will think this place isn't all that spicy and it's probably not. I'm just a wuss.  Decor is fantastic. Service is always great. Food is excellent, never a complaint. One of my top Chicago Thai restaurants. BYOB within a 1/2 a block from a large liquor store is a huge plus.  I do have to comment on the guy that lives across the street though. Maybe he moved out by now but I swear every single time I eat here (going on 3 years) there is a man in the apartments across the street that leaves his shade open and does odd things in his apartment with very little clothing on. This is not the fault of the restaurant's, clearly, but dude, if you live across from Cozy and you're reading this and you're a white guy with a hairy back rocking the tighy whiteys, you might wanna draw the shades.  Unless you're into it. In which case...more power to ya' buddy.

A definite 4 star place, possibly 5. I actually liked the kitschy decor, but then again, I used to live in Asia and there is NO ONE else on the planet who can do kitsch like Asia. The whole theme things is kinda silly, but at least less of the cookie cutter sports bar that the rest of the street is.  Meanwhile, the green curry was pretty good. Not the best in Chicago, but a decent deal and a TON of food. I love the BYOB part of this place and it was a fun dinner overall.

Definitely a solid 4 stars. Super cutesy decor and friendly enough servers. At 5:45 pm on a Friday, my boyfriend and I were the only customers for about 20 minutes, then it definitely started filling up. We would have loved to sit on the patio, but no BYOB out there, well you can't keep your wine bottle, and I'd like to refill when I'm ready and not have to wait (half the beauty of BYOB if you ask me), so inside by the window it was. I had chicken pad thai, which was really good and my boyfriend had pad see ewe. We both devoured our meals. Prices are fantastic, especially for the quality. If you're looking for a cheap dinner, Cozy is the place! My only big complaint is that my dinner came out 10 minutes before my boyfriend's. I'd prefer they just didn't bring my food out if everyone's isn't ready, but other than that, I'm a fan!

I dont really have a strong reason not to give this place 5 stars.  It is the kitsch capital of the street. The walls are lined with Lunch boxes, Pez dispensers, license plates and the man himself - Elvis Presley. BYOB. I like a lot of the rice and meat combinations - Cashew Chicken, Red Curry etc.  They have a $5.95 lunch Menu which is very cool. You will get value for money in these hard economic times.
Finally! Cheap, delicious, and friendly! I had the Cashew special in chili paste. It was the best i've had in a long time. I love Chicago.
I just got an order pad see ewe delivered for lunch from here.  It was overly salty and didn't have the sweet, carmelized noodles that I love so much... It was cheap, but meh.

Hmm...I thought I had reviewed this place but I guess I'm wrong (unless it got deleted from when I was a skill-less Yelp Newbie).   Come step into an antique McDonalds toy store that happens to serve Thai cuisine.  You must not make a stop in without visiting the bathrooms decked from the floor to the ceiling with McDonalds Kids Meal Box toys.  (Wait, I thought they were made in China, not Thailand...)  Everyone knows what Thai is all about but what is unique to Cozy, other than the decor, is that they offer all your favorite Thai noodle specialties as "Crunchy." Last time I came here I had the Lard Na for the texture fusion between crunchiness and softness.  On that visit, the noodles were ultra salty, plah!  So much so that I felt like I were eating the formaldehyde they must have soaked all those spooky-ass Furbie toys in to last through all those years being nailed to the male washroom walls.  If the Lard Na is salty, I wouldn't like to try any other noodle dish as crunchy.  Maybe it has improved since then... This time I had my friend's recommendation of Garlic Chicken Noodles (egg noodles with bean sprouts, crushed peanuts, topped with garlic chicken).  It was tuly yummy and made up for that Crunchy Noodle disaster. Another HUGE plus is that they're super gay friendly.  It's the perfect place for a date because if they're a boring person you can stare around at all the wonderful, OCD clutter decor.  Check out Cozy's website for coupons (lunch, Cubs and Spring delivery coupons).  Although beware of those that require $15 worth of food for a free entree (where you have to then buy two appetizers which equals about the same price).

Ordered in the other day.  While totally economical, you do get what you pay for.  It's just ok as far as delivery is concerned.  I haven't been there to eat in yet.  It could be that my appy sampler just doesn't travel well.  Not terrible, not great, but the prices are very reasonable.  There were some difficulties in getting the complete correct order (I had to wait an additional 25 min).

I went here last night for the first time in a few months, but as long as I've been in Chicago, it's been one of my favorite places to eat. In the summer, I was disappointed to see how off the service was when everything took way too long, I was brought my dinner before my appetizer, and the prices went up a little. However, after going here last night, Cozy has reclaimed the Thai section of my heart. As soon as I arrived, I was greeted by the owner, who recognizes me now because I've been there so much. When we sat down he immediately grabbed my bottle of wine and popped it open for u us. The crab rangoon was more hearty than I previously remember, and my noodles panang had a great flavor. The fried rice noodles were not overcooked and absorbed the panang curry for a flavorful and semi-crunchy combination.  If you're anywhere in the Northside craving Thai, Cozy would be the number one place to go. (I didn't bother commenting on the decorations [which are great] because everyone else already did)

Oh how I love this place!! I love the decor - the walls covered in old toys, the giant (and a bit terrifying) Betty Boop and Elvis statues, and especially the note from a remorseful customer about the stolen Pez dispensers.  I love everything I've eaten there, especially the crazy noodles (get 'em spicy!) I even dragged myself out of bed to have some crazy noodles the day I stayed home sick as a dog from work.  And I especially love everyone who works there, whose beaming smiles and adorable nature instantly make me happy. And though I love everything about it, I always feel a little tiny bit guilty that I can get away with not paying a lot to enjoy it all. But I figure, more left over for me to go back again and again... which I do often since it's only about a block from my apartment.

With the popularity of BYOB, this is the best BYOB Thai in the city.  Get a good bottle of red and tear it up.  The place is fun and delicious. the prices are amazing for what you get, and they always send you home with coupons for the next time you go.  Best red curry I have had in the city

BYOB baby!! Brought a friend here and we nailed the perfect BYOB place and closed it down and they were very friendly for how late we stayed but we couldn't help it. Captain Morgan....hum kinda abused the BYOB on that one but they brought us coke (the pop)  food was great and lets say awesome for that price. The toys covering all the walls were a trip and we couldn't stop reflecting and talking about our childhoods. So if you wind up bringing a date here I could see that scoring you major points for deep conversation.

Every time I come here I have a great time! Its a small Thai restaurant with a great atmosphere. The whole place is decorated with vintage toys and the bathrooms are also decorated. The colors are great.  The food is great. I usually get a noodle dish and a bubble tea or thai iced tea. They serve your food pretty quickly and the price is great, the usual affordable thai food! Its also a great date restaurant! Its cute and its cheap! Also BYOB! It could be bigger though!
Close to my apartment, good food, super cheap, wait - free soda? SCORE!

How this place doesn't have a perfect score is beyond me! The room is adorable, the menus well designed and the staff is sweet as pie. And that's just the aesthetics.  The foooooooood is faaaaaaaaaaabb! Some of the best curries in the city. apps are awesome, every noodle I have tasted has been best-ever and yummy yummy soups. They have great brown rice for those of you that are trying to stay complex with your carbs. And for those of you that like to cry while you eat (like me) if you say extra extra spicy they will not disappoint. Please go here and enjoy and even if you don't have to use the restroom, make an excuse to check it out. It will make you very happy, i promise.

I like this place fine enough, but the food can be hit or miss. I love the cashew chicken and the crab rangoon.  I used to get the Chicken Satay, but they started to water down the peanut sauce and it isn't as yummy.  I don't like the Pad Thai. The kitschy decor is awesome, but I can't eat that.

Cozy Noodle holds a special place in my heart. It was Cozy that first introduced me to the deliciousness of Thai food. It was Cozy who weekly delivered the Pad Thai that would allow my roommate and myself to perfect our chopstick skills in the comfort of our dorm room. And, yes, it was Cozy that contributed significantly to my college weight gain. Nevertheless, you can probably imagine the excitement I felt when my friends and I discovered Cozy's second location just blocks down from our apartment upon our move to Wrigleyville. It was just as yummy as the Evanston location, and two years later, we still enjoy the occasional trip up to Clark and Sheffield. Such a cute little spot, dirt cheap, consistently good food (Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, Panang Curry, etc. etc.), and you can't beat BYOB. If you're looking for a cheap, delicious meal with a unique edge on the typical BYO spot, Cozy's your place.

This place has gone downhill. The Tom Yum tasted like a syrupy oil. It was very, very sweet. And oily. I'm really sad to report this, but its the truth. Worst Tom Yum I've ever had in my life. But how can I give such a nice, friendly place 2 stars?!?! Pez dispensers as wallpaper? I feel really guilty because its still a great place even though I don't want to think about the Tom Yum ever again. They delivered quickly and got the order correct. I don't have anything else to say. I think it would be a nice place for a family to go to introduce children to Thai food.

I'm going to have to disagree with popular opinion and rate Cozy Noodle average at best. I'm not one for halving stars, but I'm going with 2.5. So, I'm perfectly content in the current relationship with Joy Noodles, but just wanted to make sure I wasn't missing out on something better. Hotter. Sexier. I ordered the basics to ease into something Cozy-- crab rangoon and chicken Pad Thai. Nothing crazy. But I didn't expect the food to be so bland. The Pad Thai was a bit watery and suffered from a serious lack of flavor. And the seasoning was just off. Crab rangoon? I've had many and these did not satiate my wonton wanderlust. Lesson learned: Cozy Noodle is no Olivier Martinez. I won't be unfaithful again.

I've been coming here a few years and this is one of my favorite Thai spots. The first thing you notice is the charming, kitsch-galore interior. (Trust me, it's cute.)  It's small but comfortable. The staff is always really friendly and you have a bunch of people waiting on you, which can be good and bad.  The only bad being that they sometimes get confused because it's not just ONE person per table. They tend to bring out one plate first, while the other plates in your party sometimes take another 10 or 15 minutes. One time, it took an HOUR for my boyfriend to get his dish after I got mine on a busy weekend night.
