That's an instance where it was pretty bad to have so many people serving you, because no one knew what was going on. Other than that though, I really do like this place. It's the best coconut curry I've had in Chicago. Almost perfect. Highly recommended. The pad thai is better than most for such a standard dish. I've tried the pad kee mao and that was very good too if you like things a little spicier.  Oh, and last night they had tea ON THE HOUSE! Awesome. I got green tea and it was very good.

ok so the joint's right by my digs and I've read good things from fellow yelpers (and was feeling particularly BYOB-ish and Thai-y), so I invited my friend, the Heidster, to be my date for a little winin' and dinin'.. it was a Tuesday night around 8, so I figured there'd be a little bit of a wait.. Unfortunately for us, the lady she gave our name to forgot to put us on the list and after the third party got seated before us, I was ready to crack the wine open and just get blitzed on the curb.. fortunately for my dinner companion, I have vocal cords and finally was like uh hey next table, ours, whaddya say? they sayed surely.. we were in.. after a 35 minute wait.. oh well.. long story short, got the steamed shrimp pot stickers for an app.. not so much.. bland and cold.. ordered chicken pad thai and Heidi ordered red curry I believe.. my entrée came out before hers, but ok.. all in all, entrées were really good.. flavorful, good portion size.. service, on the other hand, was lacking.. I asked two different people if they could bring Heidi's food out.. bottom line is I really want to like this place because it's cheap, fast, close to home, and the ever-awesome BYOB.. as a server who's had an off night before, I'll try em out again, maybe order out of my comfort zone and try something new-- give em the benefit of the doubt.. keep ya posted..

Good food for a cheap price! My pad thai (which was a full plate) was just $7 and the best part is that it is BYOB! (and no corkage fee) It is really tiny though - I recommend making a reservation. And even if you don't have to use the restroom, you must go in! I checked out the ladies and mens - craziness haha

Most of the Thai food I've had has been pretty mediocre so I'm not a huge fan of it, but Cozy seriously changed my perceptions.  I went there on a night when it was below freezing (before windchill), it took forever to find parking and when we finally did we ended up walking for about 20 mins...by the time I got there I was so cold that I was literally numb.  (Turns out it was only a 5 min walk from the car but my friend took a wrong turn...good thing I didn't find that out until after the fact because I may have had to throw down...)   Anyhow, needless to say I was not in a very good mood and was seriously hungry.  Cozy definitely did not dissapoint.  I am generally not a fan of peanut sauce, but the vegetable rolls came with a peanut sauce that I absolutely loved.  Also got the crazy noodles which were delicious.  Quick service, extremely fair prices and BYOB...doesn't get much better than that!

This cheap BYOB spot, conveniently located near a liquor store, has a small but cheery interior.  The portions are fairly generous, and they don't charge a corking fee.  Some of the menu items are a miss, but there are enough really good options on the wide-ranging menu to make Cozy a solid contender in the neighborhood.

The design is great,  the food is better than reasonably priced, and they deliver.  I would give five stars, but when you call to place an order, well, let's just say that if you don't speak the language, it's a little difficult, but that's sort of par for the course for an Asian place. The chicken pad thai is phenomenal as is the crab rangoon.  In fact, I don't think I've ever had anything I didn't like here.

As picky as I am with Thai food, Cozy won me over immediately. There crab rangoons rank in the top 5 that I ever had (and Ive had a lot). While their meal portions are that big the price is reasonable.  I also love the eclectic atmosphere inside and the patio seating during the summer. Its a very chill place to go and is almost never packed.  If you havent had Thai before this is a great place to start and I recommend the Chicken Pad Thai.

If you love Robots and Thai food (like me) - then you will love Cozy. I'm still shocked this little gem is in Wrigleyville scattered among all the Chad/Trixie Bars and still its little kitchy cuteness remains untouched. The food is cheap cheap cheap, its BYOB and they don't charge a corking fee. Its a tiny joint and they don't take reservations - so you have got better luck at getting a table at off times. But they have plenty of outdoor seating during the summer so they helps out with the crowds. They're getting 4 stars instead of 5 because their delivery quality has really gone down. Its almost like you are not getting the same food at home as you do in the restaurant - at all. My last couple take out orders (while prompt even in the snow) have been so so.  So to get the full Cozylifexperience - go eat in person and please bring me some takeout. Thanks!

Ah, after being away from Yelp for a while ( I thought I could just sit at this desk all day, Yelp and get paid...you mean I can't?), I really should probably start back into it with a five star-wowsa-everyone should know how great this meal was kind of place. Or at least a one star-I got food poisoning-the dinner killed my dog kind of place. But I thought Cozy was due.  I honestly can't believe I missed reviewing it until now. Which really is indicative of how I feel about this place in general - I'll frantically search for a place to order good Asian/Thai/etc noodles and then, after patting the food baby in my belly, think...why didn't I think of Cozy?  Maybe because I've never actually eaten IN the restaurant, which I've heard means I'm missing out on a key part of the charm, I just can't quite get past the three-star hump. Their crab rangoon is average, though their pad thai is better than.  Someday I'll eat in and update my review, I just may need a reminder to actually get my butt into the darn place.
Great decor and good food.  It's a unique experience and the service was really astute.  Certainly a fun, nostalgic atmosphere.  Cheap eats in a lively area.

When something is less than a block away from you down your street, there's no excuse not to go right?  Wrong!  The excuse is, you don't go because you know it's going to be good and you don't want to get addicted.   Well, we broke down and finally did it.  Trudging through the snow down our own damn street, to that place that I smell every day on my walk home from the train.  The smells wafting out of Cozy's makes it impossible to resist.  We were strong for about two and a half years, but now are lemmings that just dived right in. Enough of that, what about it?  This is the only place that I will forgive my knees constantly knocking against the table.  Because they're Singer sewing tables!  Too cute!  The surroundings were amazing, with so much to look at and admire.  I loved all the little banks on the windowsill next to us.   The food was wonderful which I expected.  I had the BBQ Pork and broccoli.  Yum!  And a beautiful presentation!  Crisp, green veggies made into a nest with some yummy pork inside!  A side of jasmine rice and a glass of ice water that was never over halfway empty made my night!  Our bill for two was around $15 with the tip!  Incredible deal!  We'll take advantage of the BYOB next time I'm sure.  Free corkage?  I didn't know that existed anymore! All in all we're hooked on Cozy's like a bad drug now so next time you walk in to pick up your take out you might see me sitting in the window next to the banks so turn around and say hi!

I think I beat Lindsay to the punch for a change! After living down the block from this place for 2.5 years, we finally trudged through the snow Saturday night and found a little heaven at the end of the street.  The staff is SO friendly, welcomed us the moment the door opened, sat us down, and were extremely attentive. The food was fantastic.  We were both very happy with what we ordered,  and even ate off of each other's plates since we liked what the other one had.   Very sad that it took us soooooo long to go here, but we will be at Cozy A LOT now!!

This place is literally right across the street from me (seriously as I am writing this I am looking out my window and wishing I was eating some chicken satay) so I eat it quite often. I have had thai at other places in Chicago and this is definitely my favorite. My favorites are the basil, larb (chicken salad), chicken satay, and vegetable rolls. Although I normally just run across the street to pick it up, dining in is great too, as long as its not too busy. There's really nowhere to stand when you are waiting for a table and waiting outside is out of the question when it is 2 degrees out. The BYOB factor makes for a cheap meal, especially when you have a coupon for a free entree. Don't bother driving here since the parking lot is the size of a postage stamp and most of the street parking around the place is permit. But it is right near the redline so no worries! The only thing that makes me sad is that I am moving in a few weeks, and although I am excited about my new digs in the West Loop, I will definitely miss Cozy.
I love Cozy. Best restaurant "ambiance" ever. The staff is also really nice and the food is also good. Not AMAZING (worth five stars) but definitely pretty damn good.

Cozy Noodle and rice is a wonderful little hole in the wall joint in the Wrigleyville area.  One of the first things that I noticed is all the locals picking up phone orders at the front counter.  When the locals dig the food in a area with so many choices, you know that you are in the right place.    The food was wonderful. I really enjoyed the Curry fried rice. It had a hint of spice to go along with the Curry that was quite tasty.    The wacky decor is also a nice touch. The place is decorated with Pez dispensers and other wacky toys from the 50's that really give the place a cozy feel.   Carolynne r. and I are in the Wrigleyville area quite a bit, so I'm sure that we will be back.

I thought the interior was charming and we had very good service.  We got in just before the mad rush of dinner patrons, so maybe that had something to do with it.  Oh and the Red Tofu Curry was absolutely amazing.  It used to be that I would only go to one place in all of Chicago for my red curry fix, but no more.  Cozy has this dish down cold (er, hot?).  Silky coconut broth surrounding crisp veggies, basil and tofu - add a little Siracha sauce and you are in heaven.  A perfect meal for a cold January day! ANdy M had a fried rice dish which was fabulous - didnt even taste like the typically oily fried rice most people think of - it tasted like an entirely different dish - who knew it was possible?   Plus it is so cheap - I think the most expensive item on the menu was something like $8.50?  Most dishes are in the $6.50 - $7.50 range.

I can only speak for takeout...but super disappointing. I ordered chicken pad thai. When the food came, it was cold. And in a teeny container. It was about 8 dollars plus delivery charge, so ten dollars for a cold bowl of noodles that didn't taste very good (and were a little overly greasy). It also came with no chopsticks, soy sauce, anything. At least the guy I ordered from was very nice on the phone. Maybe its better in the restaurant, but delivery was a no no.

We got take out (and my sister picked it up), so I can't comment on what sounds like very cool decor.  The food was average.  The chicken was a bit overcooked, but not horrible.  The noodles were, again, average, with a missing hint of sweetness I've grown to expect from certain dishes.  I ordered the "Cozy Noodles" special which were basically pad se eww with chicken and shrimp.  Sadly, there were only 2 pieces of shrimp.  I won't be running back, but won't go out of my way to avoid either.

The food here was so good, and there was SO much of it! The atmosphere and decor of this place was a riot. I loved the robots on the wall!! I can't wait to bring my out of town friends here when they come for a visit. Prices were really great too!

I like Cozy for 3 reasons: good food, cute decor, and they have parking (which can be tricky in Lakeview).   The standard Thai fare is all pretty tasty.  The only dish that I strongly suggest to avoid is their pad thai, which tasted pretty off (maybe it was just that one time I tried it).  Their decor is also pretty unique, with walls plastered with toys of a bygone era.  The decor in the bathrooms are also very cute, so make sure to check them out! Overall, a great restaurant that should satisfy your Thai cravings.

thai restaurants are a dime a dozen in chicago-  it takes something special to stand out... aside from their amazing coupons (bogo entrees when you dine-in, free app when ordering-in), cozy's does nothing to separate itself from the others.  in fact, it barely comes close to meeting the standards of restaurants of its kind.  a staple dish- the pad see ewe-  was watery (?), greasy and tasteless.  i counted 3 pieces of broccoli and 5 pieces of tofu in the entire dish.  my husband commented that the beef fried rice didn't taste any different from the steamed white rice.

A fantastic little thai place with quirky decorations. Marvel at the many lights hanging from the ceiling of various sizes and the toys lining the walls. Eat at converted sewing machine tables and check out the bathrooms (each is different). The food is exceptional as well. This is a good place to take people that are in from out town.

This place is amazing!  It is a little small and can be hard to grab a table.  But the takeout is great.  I do not eat meat and they have so many veggie options!  I LOVE this place.  Plus they have great coupons and it is super cheap.  Best pad thai in the city!  You will not be dissapointed!!!

Best thai in Lakeview.  The place is cool if you go in.. lots of tin toys.. but the pad thai and the green curry is great.  Cheap prices too!.. about 7-8 for dinner entrees.  The baby egg rolls are also winners.

It's less about the food and more about the ambience that makes the experience at Cozy so awesome.  It's so kitschy and colorful that you just want to hang out with your friends and converse all day.  Yeah, the shelves are lined up with a myriad of different toys: robots, model cars, etc.  There is a random elvis statue near the counter.  And lots and lots of lights.  It's...awesome.  And don't let me start waxing poetic on the bathroom. Anywho, the food is so-so, but the prices are fair.  It's not the best food ever, but it gets the job done.  And I can't complain about it.  So if nothing else, go with a bunch of friends and get drawn in by the wackiness of the place.

Stopped here for a late light lunch last weekend and left feeling fine.  Tom Kha (ok, it's my fave thai soup) was good.  Cup of coffee was strong and dark, reminiscent of Turkish.  Bathroom made me want pez.  Yum.

Back when I lived Wrigleville I would visit Cozy at least once a week.  It is the perfect little place: warm atmosphere, friendly service, affordable prices and most importanty - outstanding food.  I never realized how good Thai food was until cozy.  Of the many times I've visited, only once was I disappointed with my meal.   BYOB is a plus and there original location in Evanston is great too.

Two words: Dang good.   I've never been inside Cozy (I'm hoping that will change soon), but their delivery is da bomb!   Cozy is literally .3 miles (just Google Mapped it) from where I work and sometimes a lazy girl just needs some Pad Thai delivered to her.  They're quick.  They're nice.  Their food is dang good (see above).   One of these days I'll actually make the .3 mile journey to Cozy.  I'm sure it will be grand.

Awesome food. Awesome lunch specials. Also, great environment. There are little trinkets EVERYWHERE. Its strange, but really fun.  Pad See Ewe: awesome with chicken. I don't like Cozy's tofu very much. Its pretty dry, but the chicken is really good. This dish has wide egg noodles and a sweet soy sauce. Its light and delicious.  Crazy Noodles: awesome! Best in the city!  Baby Egg Rolls: I am not a fan of egg rolls usually, but these are really good.  They are really light and don't have scary unknown dark meat in them. Very yummy.

My favorite place in Chicago. It's actually an addiction of mine. Usually a place that I hit up at least once a week. Best Thai Food in the city! Crab Rangoon and Vegatable Rolls are amazing! Pad See Ewe is a must have each visit, especially since it's better than anywhere else I've ever had. The best part is probably the decor of the place. They love old toys and signs and have the place decorated all over in them. They also use tables that have old sewing machines on the bottom. This place is a must see. Check out the bathrooms, it's the best with decor. Also, prices are super cheap, which makes this place even higher on my list! Only downfall is it's location. Parking is hard to find, though they do have 3-4 spots for customers. Their small lot is just usually full with their delivery driver's cars. Also, during a Cub's game, don't bother, but that's true with any place near Wrigley. What do I know though, I'm a Sox fan. :) This place still deserves 5+ stars though. Check it out!!
You Should: Make the Trip or Delivery Sizzle: Thai BYOB, better than most Juice: Keep the delivery menu on your fridge

Why, oh Why don't you deliver to my house? I love you and I need you back in my life. I am too lazy to come to you during baseball season, and I always almost get hit by a dbag when I'm around you. I need you.  Nothing else seems good enough.
I really liked the entrees at the restaurant.  The baby egg rolls were okay...nothing too special.  The atmosphere at the restaurant was great!
very very good cheap thai place--excellent presentation, cool palce with vintage toy decor.  Standard, cheap thai prices--BYOB--if it is on your route, it is just the place

Well I guess I can not add anything to review this place that hasn't already been said.   The decor was the most appealing part of my experience here.  All the toys and decorations just kept me looking around in awe.  And the old singer sewing tables converted into tables is such a creative idea.   The bathroom is out there too.  A lot of Marilyn.  A lot.  Very colorful and eccentric - but it works. the food was great as well.  Service was quick, friendly and efficient.  I ordered my meal extra spicy - 'cuase thats how I roll.  And BAM!  I get the extra spicy!  It wasn't as hot as most thai meals I order extra spicy, because usually I am sweating my a$$ off afterwards - but thats how I like it - clears the sinuses and makes it good to go. The place is BYOB too, but I didnt have any B with my to bring, so I DTOW - Drank Their Own Water. Check it out - because I will again!

Yummy yum yum! I had the Bamee Noodles which was a cross between a Chinese and Thai dish. BBQ pork *like the Chinese rib meat, with crab, crushed peanuts and clear noodles. Great combo of flavors and of course I made it even better with SriRacha and ground chile paste. I disappointed as the edamame was served cold. I loved the display of Japanese robots and toys. For those of you who watched Force Five or Star Blazers when you were younger you'd appreciate know what I mean.

GREAT food, crazy decor, BYOB and the prices are very reasonable. The food has set my standard for great Thai food.  I have gone a lot of other places, but this is the one I keep coming back to. Plus, the staff is always fast and helpful.  If in doubt, drop your plans and go here; you won't be disappointed.

I can't say enough good things about this restaurant. Everything I have had there is excellent, and they have the best panang noodle curry I have ever had in my life. Hands down. The sauce is amazing, their use of vegetables is delicious, the chicken is good. Their broccoli beef, chicken satay, crab rangoon, thai tea bubble tea, hot tea, pad see ew, pad thai...it's all delicious. Service is usually quite good. It can be crowded at times and you may have to wait a bit, but I've never waited more than 20 minutes at its busiest times, and it's absolutely worth the wait.  I love the wild decor.

From childhood, this has been my FAVORITE restaurant of all time. It's got the BEST thai food around, whether its the Lakeview or Evanston location. Now I haven't been too adventurous with their food selection because I can't get over how amazing their PAD THAI is! But I always taste my friends food, and everything is perfectly spiced, sauteed, and cooked!!! And what makes the food even better is the fun atmosphere and decorations from floor to ceiling with little knick-knack toys of all kinds EVERYWHERE. Better yet, I went there around Christmas last year and the delivery guy was dressed in a Santa Claus suit! Price is very very reasonable, and its BYOB so its a great little restaurant to bring your friends and have one fun, delicious, and entertaining night  (even the bathrooms are fully decked out with toys and decorations)!

The kitsch inside of the restaurant rocks. Toys galore adorn the walls, but the BEST are the Pez dispensers covering the entire bathroom. I was so tempted to take a Kermit Pez...so cool! Prices are cheap, BYOB and a few nice tables outside. I recommend the Taro bubble tea. Loved my pepper steak - not too much heavy sauce and lots of fresh peppers. The spring roll is a light appetizer to start with.

A few months ago this would have been five stars. This was always one of my favorite thai places. The food is still good, but the service has gone way downhill. The last two times I went here, the restaurant was almost dead but I had to wait almost 30 mins. to receive my lunch. The second time I was with my friend, and he got his entree 15 minutes before I did, and we didn't get our ice teas until AFTER we'd received our food, and we had to ask for them. I've noticed that the waitstaff is totally different than before....Wondering if they changed owners or something. At least the food is still good, but not sure if I will be as much of a regular from now on.
One of the best Thai places in the city. I recommend the garlic chicken noodles.

Cozy is one of my regular spots. Cozy is wonderfully kitschy and a fun experience.  And best of all, the food is delicious.   They also have great lunch menu combo deals. I rarely ever give out a 5 star.  To me, that means its a spot you go to often, would tell friends about, and if you have company in town, you'd have to take them there. Some of my favorite MUST HAVE items are: Appetizers:   Baby egg rolls   Crab Rangoon Drinks:   Bubble Tea (Any flavor!)   Thai Coffee  (Have you had this!?  It's so smooth) Meals:   Pad See Ew (may fav dish) Like Pad Thai with wide noodles   Golden Noodles   Rama   BBQ Pork (I get it without the Ginger, so its mild) So.. there's some of what I get when I go.  I love this place.  I'll miss it when we move, but I'll be sure to stop in every time I'm in town.

I love Cozy Noodles!! I have not been in a while as I moved to NY but it's now that I miss it even more. I used to live around the corner from Cozy and would regularly get it to go, although eating there is the best. The fried rice is always tasty and never greasy. A lot of my friends have had the other dishes and I have never heard a complaint. I wish there was a cozy in NY as I have not yet found a decent replacement. It is a BYOB but there's a liquor store around the corner so always an opportunity to get a beer with the food.

I was in here last night with some friends & I noticed the menu has changed. The layout is definitely more organized, but I think the prices may have gone up a little bit. Nothing crazy of course, maybe  50cents to a dollar more- it's still a very reasonably priced place!  My friends couldn't believe the bathrooms & took about 50 photos in each stall! The staff just laughed at us as they walked by.

This is a great place to go if you are looking for a light dinner in the Wrigleyville area or a place to go before or after a Metro show.  It's a really fun place and very kitsch.  The food is flavorful and not too spicy.  I really like their crispy panang noodle and crispy pad see eiw dish.  They have yummy bubble teas (plum, taro, mango are all great) and best of all their environment is fantastic.  Lots of license plates, old signs, pez dispensers.  They have a small outdoor seating section and a great staff.  The food is reasonable and, though the portions are smaller than they used to be, it's still overall a good value. The only downfall of this place is that while it could be playing Pizzicato Five (yes, I know they are Japanese not Thai but their pop sound would fit perfectly), it's usually playing generic soft rock, which really ruins the whole experience at times.

Hi Cozy, How I love you so. I must say, you almost got 5 stars, but recently you have been slacking a tad. You used to fill my water after about ever 2 sips I took. Last time I had to run up to the counter and beg for some water.. Garlic chicken noodles require water, they just do!!.. But Cozy, you are the only place I will break my iron clad diet skills for to eat your crab rangoons. I CANNOT get enough of them. That sweet and sour sauce that is spicy that you give me, I could drink that stuff! I actually have a hard time choosing what I want to order because I love so many of your items. I will admit, I try to avoid friday and saturday nights because you have a lot of wino customers that get extremely loud in that tiny "cozy" place of yours, and I can hardly hear myself think. But that's not your fault. My husband was beyond thrilled when he asked you once if he could get carrots instead of peas in his curry fried rice, and you were super happy to oblige his request. However the next time he cheerfully ordered that, you shouted "We don't make changes to the menu". He's already socially awkward, and it took a lot for him to ask. Plus he was really disappointed. because he seriously has an aversion to peas. We don't come back as often as we used to (once a week) but when we feel like driving around 20 billion times for a parking space, we do still have a lot of love in our hearts for you, cozy. Keep making those crab rangoons please, and I'll keep never truly hitting my fitness goals ;-)

I can't believe that I've never reviewed Cozy's-- tasty, cheap, and delicious.   Plan on sharing though, since they only bring out one entree at a time, and you'll look like a real jerk if you're chowing down while your date is patiently waiting for her entree to arrive.

I have been here many times through the years, but most recently I came here yesterday for lunch. Yes, this place is super cute and yes the bathroom is covered in Pez dispensers. It is also very cheap here and their food is pretty good! However- I think it is SOOOO annoying that they bring out one meal at a time.  I have good table manners and I do not like to eat my food before everyone is served, but is it really necessary for them to only bring out 1 meal every 5 minutes? There were maybe only 6-8 people in the whole restaurant having lunch..... I do remember that this has happened many times I have been here and frankly, this annoys me so much that I will not be coming back here. Peace out, Cozy!
The only thing I remember were the old school toys and fun tables.   The food was ok but nothing spectacular.    I'm not saying I won't give it another chance.

Maybe we caught them on a bad night. But, after hearing good things about this place, my boyfriend and I decided to order delivery from them last night. Our order was simple enough: one order of crab rangoon and two orders of chicken pad thai. We ordered at 8:10 and our food did not arrive until 9:50! We called the restaurant several times only to be told that the driver was new and was mixed up on his route. What's interesting is the the food arrived piping hot which makes me think that perhaps our order was just forgotten. After griping about the delay, the driver gave us the crab rangoon for free. The food was average at best. I don't think I'll be ordering from there again anytime soon.

Cheap, Clean, Cozy and yummy.  So, whenever I see monkey riding tricycles Toys and more random things lined up on the walls of a restaurant, I get very suspicious about the quality of the food. BUT, check out those toys, they have no dust on them! They make an effort to keep it really clean and that's how I like it because you can guess how the kitchen might look like.   So, I went with 3 other people and ordered Pad See Ewe, Pot stickers, Chicken Satay, Crispy Pad Thai, and Mild Curry, two teas and paid only 11 dollars each!!!!  Such a good deal.  But, I personally did not like the crispy Pad Thai. I don't like crispy noodles in general so maybe it's more of an acquired taste.

What do an old commuter train, a monkey riding a tricycle, a space man, and a deer have in common? They're all figurines on the wall at Cozy. Don't be weirded out by the randomness, though - the whole top shelf is comprised of identical robot toys. So they've got that goin for them. Which is nice. The one word I would choose to describe Cozy is: Entertaining. The walls are bright yellow wherever they find a way to poke through all the crazy shit covering them up, like license plates, vintage radios, old consumer product ads, and of course a giant Elvis. The tables are all made of Singer sewing machines (Made in China?) (Yes, I know it's a Thai place.) and are close enough together that you can eavesdrop on up to three conversations at once. The menu itself is fun, too; that is, if I could decipher all those crazy symbols on it. But the people depicted are smiling and stuff, so that's a good sign. The food, prices, and service are all "good," but this is the kind of place where all that doesn't matter as much because it's just so damn entertaining. BYOB.

With the numerous Thai places in this neighborhood it is nice to see a place that has a fun atmosphere, and good food. I sat outside in their patio and enjoyed looking at all of their decorations in the window.  I ordered the Thai Green Tea bubble tea which was really good and refreshing, crab rangoon for appetizer which was also really good and more than just the four or five rangoons I seem to get at most places, and then the Bamee Noodles as my entree. Everything was fresh and hot and really tasty.  The service was also very good, although my server seemed to have disappeared and I was waiting a bit before a different server came out to assist with boxing up for leftovers.  All in all, I plan on taking some friends here and using their delivery service in the future.

I have a soft spot for Cozy Noodle because it was the first restaurant I ate at as an official Chicagoan, in 2005. Since then, I've had many great experiences either eating at (the slightly cramped yet super kitschy) adorable establishment, or ordering take-out.  The price points meet the quality of food, which I think is better than average. Not the best, but certainly not the worst Thai I've had. I'm especially fond of their crab rangoon for its lack in grease and plus in  crispy deliciousness. (cheesy, I know) The one thing I noticed though from when I was there last is that it seems their portions have gotten smaller, unless it's just their new platterware? Either way, check Cozy out, enjoy the robots and yellow walls, and order a bubble tea. :) PS - If you get a chance, check out both the women's AND men's bathrooms. They don't skip a beat when it comes to decor.

DON'T go for the service - but DO go for the Miso Soup (excellent!) and their signature, and most righteous dish called Crispy Pad Thai.  That dish makes it worth your while to eat there - but man - the service stinks CONSISTENTLY!  Order for carryout if you can!

My friends go here all the time and I finally made it out w/ them.  They love it and after eating there, I question if they love it for the sheer amusement of decor because really the food was nothing to rave about, if anything, I only had rants. The actual space is cozy as the name suggests, with just a few tables, I would guesstimate, enough seating for 25?  BYOB is a big plus.  Service was either hot or cold depending on the person.  We had three different ppl assisting us throughout the night.  One of the oddest things I've seen is, the server took the order for half our table but then walked away.  We waited five minutes thinking she would come back, but no.  We had to get up and ask someone to come over and get the rest of our order. Simply put, the appetizer trio I ordered that was a special was good.  But come on now it was all fried; it's kind of hard to mess that up.  My entree of beef pad seiw crispy was beyond crispy and my jaw hurt to chew.  On top of that, it was just too sweet and salty.  That seemed to be a common sentiment amongst those in my party. Sadly, I probably won't return.  Thai restaurants are like Starbucks in this city; there are way too many I do like to return here.

Cozy's food is great...I'm not a huge fan of Thai food, but this place still does it for me.  The only knock I would have is that the service can be slow at times.  They seem to have two levels of service...it's great if the regular servers are working, and it's a little lacking if the new servers are working.  Overall, a very good dining experience.

Something strange is afoot. And it's not the G.I. Joe action figure staring at you as you sip your tom yum soup.  It's the fact that several Yelpers are reporting being sick after eating here. Which really strikes me, because I had some very queasy poo-related moments in the hours after eating at Cozy myself. It went away without any major incidents or blow-ups/flare-ups. But I thought the food was so tasty and the place so cutesy that it had to have been just me having a bad day.  Not so. You've been warned.

I love this place! It's awesome. So cute inside- I could spend hours staring at the walls. Service is always fast and friendly. Delivery is incredibly fast, always well packaged, and a great price. But going there is the real experience. Eat here!!
Great prices and the food tastes okay.  But sends me straight to the bathroom afterwards.....be careful with this place.

Cozy's is good. Eating in is an experience because it is very "cozy". The wait staff does an excellent job, and the BYOB policy is great. They even bring a holder to your table. Once you sit, it's hard to get up b/c it is a small area. The decorations are hilarious.  I have been craving good Crab Rangoon since moving to Chicago and Cozy's is excellent. The BBQ pork and other dishes are very good. I'd definitely recommend it for take-out. Don't eat-in as a group.

Good food. Although wasn't impressed when we asked for dessert and got canned Lychee fruit on ice. Liked the decor- the tables that you eat off of were old sewing machines! How cool! Downside: when they say there's parking in a lot... there are 4 available parking spots in a lot that is hard to maneuver out of... Good luck if one is available, and if it is, try not to hit a mirror or another car on the way out.

OK, so I have ordered from this place 3 times in the past 4 years I have lived in the area.  The first two times I was sick within the hour.  I vowed never to go back....until my girlfriend convinced me to order one more time because "my friend orders from here all the time and LOVES it".  I warned her on several occasions about my experiences, but you ladies have to find out for yourself don't you????   Guess where the girlfriend was about an hour after her meal?  Yup, you guessed it.  I however have developed immunity I guess. I have vowed for the second and final time not to order their food anymore.

The decor is fun, the panang curry is absolutely heavenly!! Very generous portion size. Piping hot. The best part is the semi-crunchy deliciously-flavored noodles on the bottom! It's like the cherry and the whipped cream on a sundae, only better. I would come here once a week to eat this dish if I could. Oh, and the shumai are nice too.

The best part about this restaurant is the decor... by far.  The noodles are good - not great, but good. I've found myself wanting to rip some toys down and take them with me every time I'm in there... But I don't :-P 3 stars for being fun, and another for not sucking at Thai food.

Oooh so good. The decor is crazy and awesome and a complete distraction from table conversation, but i HATE talking, so it's awesome. The food is perf and all the servers are really adorable. Plus, the prices are crazy good, and they deliver, what what?

Yummy yummy. OK I am admittedly a picky eater, and the fact that I even eat Thai food is mystifying to me. That being said, Cozy is about the best there is in the city. You get to sit at SEWING MACHINES, is that not neato? My foot goes up and down on that pedal thing the entire meal...OCD much? The decor has been talked about ad nauseum but it really is cool, and the bathrooms are overwhelmingly kitschy. The food is fantastic, though I admittedly stick to the Fried Pad Thai (yes FRIED). Everyone I have ever eaten there with says their food is also glorious so I can't complain. The reason it loses a star...its small and the turnover is not great so you can wait sometimes for a long time only to be crammed into a tiny corner and the service is not as great as the food.

I LOVE Cozy! LOL. The last time I went was Valentines Day in the evening. As expected the place was packed but we only waited about 3 minutes before we got a table.  I love the atmosphere of the place and the waiters are amazing and super nice.  I had the Curry fried rice with the cucumber salad and spring rolls.  The spring rolls are always my favorite with the peanut sauce.  The rice was great and packed with veggies. Loved it. Just wished it was a little more spicy.  Other than that I had a great time and as always the prices are amazing.  One problem that I do have with the place is that everytime I go to the restroom I get scared by the 3 ft tall barbie next to the toilet. It just creeps me out. lol

After reading the reviews on yelp, I was expecting more from this restaurant.  The food was average, nothing exceptional or memorable but decent.   I would order takeout but not eat in.  The restaurant is very cramped and you can hear the person's conversation 3 tables away, so not much privacy.
The decor is really cute, but the food isn't as good as the decor. It was all right, but nothing to write home to Dad about...
Bathroom: Cool Atmosphere: Fun, Clean Service: Excellent Food: Above Average Above average food, I'd go back and recommend it to friends. Rick

Thai food in Australia is as ubiquitous as Mexican food in America.  I have never had it's equal - and that includes Thai IN THAILAND.   Still, my friends at Cozy Noodle get as close to perfection as I've had in the States.  Try the Woon Sen Kee Mao, Green and Red Curry Chicken (mixed... trust me, you'll thank me), potstickers (fried!  don't be absurd), crab wontons, and the shumai.  Dine in for a charming BYO experience or, my recommendation, order in for an embarassingly large spread without the shocked and horrified reaction from your neighbors.  They know me by name and order so tell them that "Schmidt" sent you.
Any restaurant that decorates with pez dispensers, robots, and lunchboxes is great in my book, but the food is pretty fantastic as well.

**SECOND UPDATE**  I have gone back to Cozy's several times since the last time and it has tasted much better.  It's more like the Cozy's I knew and loved.  Celebrate!! **UPDATE**  I went back to Cozy's tonight for the first time in years and I am absolutely depressed to report that it was not as good as I remembered...  =(  I did finally go to the bathroom there though. Oh my god, oh my god.  This is my FAVORITE thai restaurant on EARTH.  I lived a couple blocks away from this place during my college heydays and my dear friend Megan lived in the building right across the street on Cornelia.  Ahhh, memories.  We had MANY a lunchdate there.  I remember walking by it before it even opened being intrigued by the decor and Elvis of course. For a good 3 years, this place basically sustained me.  I probably ate there 3 - 4 times a week be it eat in, take out or delivery.  Every time I go back to Chicago, Cozy's is one of the first places I hit. LOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOVE the pad thai.  And I always ordered peanut sauce on the side for EVERYTHING because it's so friggin' good.   I didn't realize how spoiled I was until I moved to the west coast where this is no Cozy's.

Ok, the food is good. And, the interior is fun and cutesy. That's been established.  Beyond that, not totally impressed. The service was cool (at best). We were one of 2 tables in there on a Sunday afternoon, and we felt like we were perhaps...bothering them by asking for drinks, food, etc.  The table next to us, with 2 small children...were ticked because their kids' food never came out, but it was on the bill. The kids were screaming (understandable), the parents were unhappy...and they were all loud. This is not a big place, so...we heard it all. But we enjoyed our meal, and carried on. The bill comes, we ask them to split it down the middle on 2 cards (not hard, this is done EVERYWHERE for groups of diners). They say they cant do it, can't split checks. Well whatever, it's not splitting checks to equally pay out the bill from 2 debit cards. It's not that hard to figure out, and it makes for a huge inconvenience.  I've been meaning to try this place forever...but never quite made it. Guess there was a reason. I might try for delivery, but...who knows. Of all the Thai placees in the world...there is better service to be had.

I ordered the Pad khee mao. This dish was one of my favorites in Dallas. I was expecting something similar in taste and appearance. Instead the dish was oily and had very little flavor or color. I also got the Tom kar, which is one of my favorite indulgences. Alas, it didn't have that kick, that spicy punch you expect with Thai food. It was more like peanut flavored water. We were pretty disappoint with the food, so disappointed in fact, that my boyfriend ended up grabbing something else to eat instead. Spoon Thai Restaurant is a little further in distance, but in my opinion the food had a lot more flavor. I should mention that their delivery service was very fast and polite. Just wish I liked the food a little more.

I actually eat here once a week for about three years now. Best Tom Yum soup in the city! Awesome appetizers. Entress are good, but become repatitve if you eat here enough. Pad Keh Mao is good w/ bbq pork. Although I have to admitt that I have been strictly appetizers and soup for the past couple months. Interesting decorations and good prices, GREAT LUNCH SPECIAL. The only things that lack are service and beverages. Basically if you don't order a bubble tea that is WAY to sweet don't expect to get regular water refills. Not what you always want to here while eating spicy food. Over all though satisfing food.

Whenever I have friends from out of town visiting, I make sure to take them to Cozy. The food is delicious, portions are enough to satisfy, and it's BYOB. Their specialty is traditional dishes made "crispy." The noodles are pan-fried and crunchy and ads a unique touch to the dishes. The service is attentive, the atmosphere is unique (mosaics on the walls, collectible toys everywhere), and if you can't wait for a table, delivery or carry out is available and relatively speedy.
I had tried crispy pad thai, curry fried rice; they were good..but the tom yum soup was awsome..

This is really great Thai food for cheap. That's not to say that this place lacks flavor or fun. Its a perfect BYOB option in the neighborhood and it has a HUGE menu. You generally get coupons for the place, both in the mail and sometimes with your bill. The restaurant is kind of small but it is "Cozy" as the name would suggest. Good alternative to the bar food in that area.

Quite simply, there is no better place to go for a meal that will cost under $10 per person.  The food is great (especially the Pad Kee Mao and the Panang Curry) and it is always very quick.  If it weren't for the fact that I enjoy brining my own beverage in, I could probably sit down and then be through with the meal in under a half an hour.   I am not quite sure what's going on with the decor, but I'm pretty sure that I like it.  It's so weird that it just sort of works, right down to the 20 inch TV that will almost 100% of the time be on the weather channel.  A trip to Cozy is not complete without a trip to the bathroom where you will have hundreds of tiny eyes watching you (trust me, I won't give it away, but it is a little weird).  Give Cozy a try, you won't be dissapointed!

let me tell you, it's the simple dishes that are sometimes the most difficult do well. fried rice. easy enough to make, hard to find made well. chicken basil with rice. one of the more simple and common thai dishes readily available in any thai restaurant. so hard to find a place that does it like it can be done. bamee noodles. simple. noodles, meat etc... what's hard about that? well. at least in chicago, a good plate of bamee is not an easy find. cozy noodle & rice makes a damn good plate. i've eaten their bamee over a handful of times in the past two weeks, and they are cosistently delicious.  the very simple ingredients on their own are all of decent quality.  (egg noodles with bbq pork, fried wonton, crab meat, bean sprouts and crushed peanuts) it's when they're combined and how they're prepared that they transform into a higher existence. a plate of cozy bamee noodles, full of garlicky goodness and seasoned well enough where if you don't have your own set of thai noodle condiments (fish sauce, sugar, vinegar  or crushed pepper) you'll still be satisfied.  additionally, the place itself reminds me of being in thailand. there's such a nice playful creativity in the theme and decor of the place and it's very reminiscent of places in bangkok that really make the most of their space in interesting ways.  i haven't had a lot of their other dishes, but what i did have was all very tasty, (fish cakes, egg rolls, chicken pad thai, beef nam tok, chicken larb) although the spicy dishes weren't very spicy. so if you like your food spicy make sure you emphasize that to the waitstaff.

Cozy Noodle is the Love of my Life. I'm going to name my first born child Cozy. And the next one Noodle. Really, I love the one in Evanston, but the Lakeview one is great too.  Pad thai...why is it orange? I don't know, and don't really care. It's delicious. I love how they have those coupons for free appetizers that I always forget to bring, but it's so cheap it doesn't matter. The decor is a big part of the appeal to me, too. The service has always been good, and even though it's tiny, I haven't had to wait too long. Please give cozy a try if you haven't already!  And BYOB! Come on, people.

Cozy is simply amazing. Cheap food that tastes great! I recommend the cashew chicken or chicken pad thai. I took my grandmother and her friend here (who swore up and down they didn't like thai food, but said they'd give it another try) and they simply LOVED it. I bring all out of town guests here, and they fall in love with it. Unique decor too!
I could eat their pad see ewe morning, noon, and night!

dear cozy noodle, i just wanted to compliment you on the best crab rangoon.  not too soggy, or overfilled with cream cheese blechness...just a perfect balance of filling and crispy shell. your crispy pad khe mao and whimsical interior makes my heart smile. Thanks! Justin

The only reason I didn't give Cozy five stars is due to the fact that the seating is slightly cramped.  I guess I shouldn't really complain, though.  You can't expect the world from a tiny, inexpensive byob anyways, right?   Wrong!  This place is amazing!  It has a unique sense of style...(the pez dispensers consuming the bathroom walls)...and the food is cheap but of reputable quaility!  And did I mention it was a BYOB??? Have I died and gone to heaven???  ...Too dramatic?  I don't care...I'm a huge fan of Cozy! Before I moved back to Chicago for good, my friends who live in Lakeview would take me to Cozy every time I visited.  Now we try to go at least once a month.  We always start with the pot stickers and crab rangoon.  The homemade sesame sauce is sooo delicious..try it!  Our system for determing the stature of a thai restaurant usually depends on the quality of the crazy noodles served.  We've actually been to a thai joint where they didn't know what crazy noodles were...Preposterous!!  I know this may seem unfair to some...but my crew and I  just love crazy noodles (but we do try the curry dishes as well... )  Back to my point...the crazy noodles here are superb with just enough spice to get you going but not wear you down...mmmmm distinctive and palatable!  I'm a big fan of the Pad See Ewe...the wide rice noodles here are so tender and when mixed with veggies and the oh-so-sweet soy sauce, the combination makes for a savory sensation!  I'm no a huge curry fan but my friends always gets the mild curry and raves about it and I trust her opinion very much! So...check out Cozy Noodle & Rice...you won't regret it, I promise!!  Note: Be prepared to wait for a table...it's usually not that long of a wait..but it happens...plus theres not much of a space to wait either...I've waited outside before, but it's definitely worth it!

i've been meaning to head over to cozy noodle and rice ever since my friend raved about it about a year ago. i went last night before heading to the metro and had a pretty good experience. the waitstaff was super friendly, the decor is kitschy and cute, and the food presentation was beautiful. i ordered the chicken pad thai (so completely american of me) in a rush to decide what to get, but there seemed to be a lot of options, and cheap to boot. i have probably had better pad thai, but i couldnt tell you where (its not my job to remember every thai restaurant, right?). plus, all the ingredients used at cozy noodle seemed super fresh, and that was really impressive.

I liked this place.  Not only was the food good, it's BYOB with a liquor store right down the street.  The decor is amazing.  Toys everywhere.  I mean who can tire of a wall of robots or a bathroom filled with pez dispensers.  And the prices were very reasonable.

Fantastic place, so charming, people that work there are always polite and friendly.   The food is fantastic, I live on the west side and come all the way north to have dinner there whenever I can.  Crab rangoon is lovely, and I've never had any problems there with food or service. Definently a must. ;)

My day is always better after I visit Cozy Noodles.  The atmosphere is cozy -- small, light and fun with plenty of stuff to look at to keep you entertained while you wait for your food.  I've liked most every dish I've had here -- Beef w/Broccoli and the Chicken Ram are my favs.  I've had success with dine-in, take out and delivery.  One of the best BYOB's in the city.

If I was rating based on atmosphere alone, this place would definitely get 5 stars.  It's cute, cozy, and has outdoor seating for warm summer nights.  BYOB is always a plus in my book, and the service was decent.  However, I was a little disappointed in the food.  The crab rangoon was delicious, but I left most of my basil leaves chicken on the plate.  The flavors just didn't seem to go well together, and worse, the chicken was not steamed or stir-fried white meat like I was expecting, but ground.  AKA gross.  But, my friend enjoyed his Rama Special and I think I will definitely give it another chance and try a different dish.  Overall it was a fun, cheap, laid-back place to grab dinner in Wrigleyville.

Great food.  I have yet to have a single bad meal here, although some of the dishes taste very similar.  The bubble tea is great as well. The one downside is the service.  They don't screw anything up, but are as personable as dust.  Given the cost though, it's a minor hassle to tolerate.

This place has wonderful wall art and a great atmosphere. I'm also a huge fan of creatively decorated bathrooms, so I loved the bathroom wall covered in Pez dispensers. As for the food, I wasn't very happy with it. I ordered a veggie Pad Thai, which is a simple enough meal, but it tasted of fish so strongly that I didn't finish it. Not sure how that happened. We were a party of four and while everyone else agreed my food tasted oddly fishy, they enjoyed their own dishes, so I guess it's hit or miss with the menu. I imagine it might be worth going back and finding something better.

WOW...there are a lot of reviews for this place so I will keep my comments brief: - Good variety menu - Food has been fresh and tasty every time - LOTS of coupons come in the mail - Cheap prices - A good week night take out option *I have only ever done take out from Cozy.

Many stars for the crazy decor ... but I was slightly disappointed with my garlic chicken dish. It said garlic with broccoli, peanuts, sauce, etc.  I think I had at least twice as much garlic as chicken.  Not that I don't love broccoli, but I am more a meat-eater and not a veggie lover.

I love Cozy. The decor is super cute, there are toys, banks and radios on the shelves and the tables are old swinger sewing machines. I also love the lighting and all the old advertisements on the walls. The service is fantastic- I've never had an empty glass or had to wait for a bill or anything. The food is consistently good. I almost always get the same two things; crab rangoon and the cashew chicken. Mmmm. The pad thai with deep fried noodles are pretty good too. Everything is really inexpensive but ALWAYS delicious. It can be hard to find parking nearby depending on when you go, but if you don't parking a block or two a way you should be good.  Definitely worth a try.

This is a great place to grab a quick, delicious bite of Thai.  The staff is friendly and the prices reasonable.  The best is thing about the place is the decor.  Every bit of wall is covered in precious collections of toys and the tables are made of old singer sewing machine bottoms.  Even if you don't have to pee, make sure to check out the bathroom.  The pez dispenser collection is quite impressive.

Cozy is probably my favorite Thai restaurant. The staff is friendly and attentive, the food is served super fast and is consistent and yummy. (Our regular favorites are the Chicken Rama and the Cashew Chicken, which we have never been disappointed with) The prices are reasonable and the decor/atmosphere is fun and kitschy (the women's bathroom is covered in Pez dispensers AND they have a near life sized Elvis!) P.S. They have coupons on the website (mostly for carry-out or delivery)....so make sure to visit before you order!

It's Thai food - a little kitschier than most other places in this area, but the food is average, to a bit below average.  The crunchy/crispy pad thai had so much potential, only to be ruined by being so crunchy I could barely chew it.  Its decor, BYOB'ness and cheapness earned it an extra star, though.

This is definitely someplace to bring out-of-towners who want to enjoy Chicago without doing all the touristy crap.  The food is good, well-presented, and the BYOB option keeps prices VERY reasonable. The decor is really something else.  Maybe I'm just a small-town girl from Ohio, but I've never seen a Thai restaurant with a life-size Elvis, license plates on the walls, and action figures stuck all over the walls of the toilet. As a local, I'm pleased as punch that I can walk to someplace as funky as Cozy Noodles and get full on yummy Thai food for 6.95.  Reminds me why I moved.

My favorite thai take out place, I LOVE Cozy.  My thai staple is Pad See Ewe and it's particularly tasty here!  All the noodle dishes are great (except for the "crispy" versions which just means deep fried noodles, totally impossible to eat).  The pad thai is not my favorite, but it's not the worst either.  Stick to the wide rice noodle stir fries, I'm getting hungry just thinking of it.  The curries are also good though a few times I've had them arrive a bit on the watery side.  You can totally leave the baby eggrolls (dry and chewy...) and the crab rangoons (oddly underfried) but the fresh spring rolls are awesome! Super fast delivery (always less than 30 mins) and if you go to the actual restaurant, it's way kitshy with all the millions of toys.

A good thai place is hard to find....NOT! Actually it's pretty easy to find decent thai food in Chicago. They all seem to have the same menu and same decor. Half the time I can't remember the name of the thai restaurant I just ate at because all seem so much the same.  So what sets Cozy Noodle & Rice apart? The decor. There's so much to stare at in this cozy wrigleyville restaurant. The place is filled with toys, from the replica antique toys on the shelves to the plastic toys laminated into the dining table.  Make sure to visit the bathroom. The ladies room has pez dispensers nailed to the wall and the men's room is filled with action figures.  Don't worry the food is delicious and it has the same ridiculously cheap pricing that thai restaurants are known for. Need I tell you to order the pad see iew, or the fish cakes as an appetizer. No, we all have our favorite thai dishes that we always order, don't we?  So, why go here? If you're craving thai food anyway, why not enjoy it in fun, contemporary setting, that you and your friends wil remember?!

I'd never eaten until Cozy until recently.  Before going there I always thought it would be just another noodle shop and its menu never stuck out to me when they came inside those envelopes filled with coupons.  But when I finally caved in and went I discovered how adorable the inside is! It's a flashback to the '50s, '60s, 70's and 80's with figurines of cartoon and Disney characters -- and the tables are old sewing machine tables with colorful mosaics.  Sure, the food is OK and on-par with the rest of the noodle shops in the area, but the atmosphere is too fun to pass up, the service is very friendly and it's dirt cheap.  And, it's a refreshing change for the mayhem on Clark street less than a block away.

Cozy is so fun! Few places in Chicago can compare to the genius decoration in this place. Toys everywhere- even in the tabletops! Cozy is a great place to bring out of towners, as the decor makes enough of a spectacle to be a destination location. Now about the food- not as bland as Penny's down the street, but still a little lacking. The Tom Yum here isn't memorable. The Pad See Eiw is tasty. The rangoons aren't. If the fun factor isn't your thing, head to Tac Quick a few block north for some really tasty Thai.

wow. It seems like everyone but us loves this joint. what the hell went wrong with our order? Tom Yum Soup - I've had better out of a can from Whole Foods. bland & lazy. Spring rolls - raw won ton wrappers with a chunk of cucumber & a few shreds of carrots. I'm so glad I didn't pay for it. Crispy Pad Khee Mao - the noodles were so crispy they were rock hard. completely lifeless.    Panang curry - mix 1 packet panang powder with a gallon of water, stir in three carrots, four shreds of chicken & serve! It was so watery, it should've been on the soup menu. what a waste of good hunger pangs...

I've never actually eaten at Cozy, but their delivery is fantastic.  They will tell you every time that it takes 45 minutes.  However, it has taken a range from 18 minutes to 35 minutes.  Rarely does it actually take the full 45 minutes. Our current favorites are the Golden Noodles, Pad See Ew, and the Fried Rice.  You have to get the crap fritters as well; they are a free appetizer if you order more than $15.

Not a huge Thai food fan, but have now inserted the Cashew Chicken (no mushrooms) and Crab Rangoon into one of my top five favorite meals of all time.  I did knock one star off the overall rating because of the extremely uncomfortable sewing machine tables they have.  My legs never seem to fit under the table.  Aside from that, its a great atmosphere, very affordable, and something very unique to the neighborhood.  Oh, and check out the bathrooms.

I'm going to have to disagree with some reviewers and say this is definitely not the best Thai food I've ever had.  However, it is good, and is ridiculously inexpensive.  The service was awesome...really fast, attentive, and polite.  I liked the food, but the best part about the restaurant is the atmosphere and the BYOB aspect.  I did enjoy the Crab Rangoon, and I usually don't like it.   The bf and I had two appetizers and two entrees for about $20 total and the server brought us a to-go container of steamed rice for our leftovers at no charge.
It's a great place to bring your friends.  Good cheap food, BYOB, and outdoor seating.  What more can you ask for?

Went here Saturday when all of our regular places were way too packed to wait.  The food was tasty, the portion sizes were probably actually just what you need, but I eat like a bird so I want huge sizes (haha). The decor was the best part of the experience, for my 6 year old especially, it kept him busy.  Watch the little ones though, they like to try and rip the toys off of the wall - we had to stop him several times. The service was great, quick and cheery.

You can't help but be impressed with both the number of reviews and the high ratings that this place gets. And it deserves every bit of praise. I lived down the street for a year and a half, and I think my roommate and I ordered from Cozy's at least once a week. My fiance and I still travel up north (we live by Water Tower now) just to get Cozy's because we haven't found another go-to Thai place like it.  It's also a great spot to go with friends, BYOB, and the environment always spurs conversation. Just be careful not to crush your toes under the table!

I've lived in the area for years and have finally made it to Cozy's.  I loved it.  It's so cute and well cozy.  There's lots of stuff going on in there so it could be a bit overwhelming, but it's fun nonetheless.  I liked the food a lot.  I got Pad-See-Ewe.  It was great.  My friend and I also ordered the shrimp rolls, wow are those great.  There is a bit of a kick to them, but totally worth it.  It's also BYOB.  I got yelled at for not informing my friend of that, so be sure to mention that to people you're going with if they're drinkers.  And if you should forget there's a liquor store right around the corner. The only thing I didn't like was that the food comes out at different times.  Yes, while you don't want your food sitting under a heat lamp, you also don't want to be eating for 10 minutes before the others food arrives.  Other then that, I love this place and I can't wait to go back.

This place is ULTRA-MEGA-SUPERCUTE!!!!   And there are like, toys everywhere.  When your conversation stalls, and it will, just look to your left and say "Oh look, a tin penguin riding a rocket unicycle.  How kitchtacular."   The crispy pad thai here is the best thing to eat in wrigleyville.  Eat it ASAP.

It's no Star of Siam, but good service, good food, good prices. And yes, it's Americanized, but what else would you expect in the shadow of Wrigley Field? It still beats the heck out of any fast food in the area, and the prices are comparable. I'll definitely come back next time I'm in the neighborhood.

I went to Cozy Noodle & Rice yesterday for my birthday lunch.  It's a wonderful place!  The food is probably not the best Thai food I've ever eaten, but it is still really yummy, and of course the prices are great.  My group ordered three entrees, an appetizer, and three bubble teas, and our check came to just $35. The decorations are wonderful, kitschy old toys and robots.  I had a lot of fun reading the old signs on the walls too.   The service was good.  Our waitress was very attentive and kind, and quick to bring anything we asked for.  I will definitely be dining here again in the future!
Americanized Thai food.  Blech.  Even worse that my friend got sick afterward.

Cozy will likely always be my favorite restaurant in Chicago for various reasons.  Not only do they absolutely obliterate my patent-pending Curry Test, I've won Thai-food converts by bringing them here. This particular location edges out the Evanston shop as my preferred destination.  I go there every weekend (when I'm in town), and so far, I've been treated very well by smiling waitresses.  The real test was a late Friday night, and the place was jammed with a half-hour wait, essentially unheard-of for a lowly noodle-shop.  Even though every table brimmed with college ruckus or otherwise potentially disruptive elements, the staff oozed eagerness, and I doubt anybody left unsatisfied. If they would extend their lunch specials to the weekend, I'd live there. ;)
Great place when you're hungry and want some cheap and delicious thai food. The place is fun, with cool interior decoration. BYOB is great.

This place is awesome! I live pretty close and always have walk/drive by it, but I never have gone inside. Last night, we were going to go to Bar Celona for $1 tacos, but ended up here. I am so glad we did! It was fast, delicious, and cheap. The restaurant is kind of small, but the decor is so cute. Each table is an old sewing machine (and the foot pedal still moves the wheel). The walls are covered with little trinkets and toys. The staff was very friendly and attentive. We ordered spring rolls as an appetizer. It was okay. I would order them again, maybe. I ordered Pad Woonsen with Tofu and shrimp. I told them to make it spicy. When it first came, I thought it was too spicy, but after a few bites I realized it was perfect. The shrimp was really good too. My boyfriend got Pad Thai (as usual). His was good too. It had a different flavor to it, but he liked it. All of this (and two green teas) for under $20!! Can't beat that.

One thing I really miss about Chicago is the ubiquity of BYOBs and cheap, good Thai food.  Cozy, with a location in Wrigleyville and one in Evanston, was a college staple of mine.  I'm boring and usually opt for the Pad See Ewe, which is sweet with firm noodles and crunchy broccoli.  The red curry is also delish, as is the fried pad thai and crab rangoon.  They always have great coupon deals, and they deliver too.  Wow, I miss Chicago now.

Such a cute place to eat.  Toys galore, so be careful not to bring children as they will try to rip up the figurines, which are mounted to the shelves. More importantly the food is delicious!  My favorite is the mild curry.  I usually get delivery and they are SO FAST!  They will tell you 45 mins, but be prepared for them to show up at your door in 15.

One of my favorite places in Chicago.  It was one of the first restaurants I went to when I moved up (or even before I moved up?)  It's great for delivery, carry-out, or dine in.   I think I've had about half the menu (no small feat - this was only after I had the Pad See Ewe about 15 times in a row) and loved almost everything.  On top of the delicious food, it is fantastically cheap and BYOB.   Oh yeah, and the decor has to make you smile no matter what your mood.  I'm not sure if it is 100% authentic, but it's 100% fantastic.  I like it better than Penny's and at least as much as any other noodle shop I've tried.

Tasty. This place is great. I love the pad woon sen. It is awesome. I order it every time. The delivery is fast and they always have coupons. There is nothing healthy about this meal but when it tastes so good, who cares? Be sure to save the menus that come with every order, they always have coupons on the back.

Cozy is great. Inexpensive menu, great quality food! They have really perfected everything on the menu. Lots of Tahi restaruants cook everything with the same 5 ingredients. Everything at Cozy is fantastic. The waiters and servers know me by name and are always fantastic, even when it's busy. The decor makes me smile every time I visit. And they have bubble tea! What's stopping you?

This is a great little place if you're on a date or if you just want to people watch the other couples. There's some limited parking, they're open fairly late, and place is so warm and ... cozy that it's just a great old standby. And you have to check out their bathrooms - totally awesome :) My personal favorite thai dish is pad-see-ewe which they do very well. It's light and not drenched in scorched soy sauce like some places. The food is good and cheap the staff is really nice and friendly, how can you loose?

Standard issue Thai.  Not great, not bad, just middle of the road.  Actually, a little better than middle of the road.  The staff is super-friendly, too.  Nice place to dine with a few friends.   Venture into the men's bathroom for a sight not to be forgotten!

Great and cheap. Delivery service is always quick, and the crunchy pad khee mao is wonderful. I also love the mini-egg rolls. We've tried all their appitizers and they're all great - I can't speak with any authority on the other dishes though, I'm so addicted to the crunchy pad khee mao that I don't try other things.  Be sure to check their website before you order - there is always coupons up that you can use - chances are the delivery guy won't take them either, and you can reuse them to your hearts content.

What can I say?  Im a sucker for coconut milk!  I love their curry's.  (Vegetarians: Make sure to ask for no fish oil- its a little extra but its hiding in there otherwise...) The atmosphere is cool, the toys are neat, the Elvis scares a friend of mine, and the sewing machine tables pinch our toes.   The appetizers are eh.  The fusion between Thai and American leaves the spring rolls lacking but the curry! Mmmmm.   The crispy noodles are eh, Im a fan of just plain ol' rice.   Ive only gotten something AWFUL once, and that is the tofu salad.  Skip it.  Its bad. Other than that, Ill chose Cozy over Penny's any day.

Cozy's is the home of the 2nd best asian noodles in the neighborhood.  While they are every bit as tasty and flavorful as Joy's, the portions are not quite as large and so Joy's is #1.  Having said that, Cozy's is a great option and I enjoy their food quite a bit.

A favorite of mine.  I'm no Thai connoisseur, but I know that I've not been disappointed any time I go here. Any flat-noodle dish can be made standard or 'crispy' which I usually get crispy noodles with the Pad Thai or Pad See Ew. The food is very good for the price, which is not a bad price at all. The decor. This is the main reason for bringing people here. Friends from out-of-town, a date or just anyone who would appreciate the bright, kitschy atmosphere. Robots and cars and lunch-pails and wind-up toys of all kinds adorn the shelves. Other little delights abound, if you look around. Be sure to visit the restroom. I can only speak for the Men's Room personally, but it is worth it. Even the tables themselves, are old sewing machine tables. Very artsy. The staff has been friendly each and every time I go, whether for eat-in or carry-out. Parking is a pain in the neck: three tiny spots wedged in between them and the other building. Verrrry awkward. But it's a nice location, overall.  If you're hungry in Wrigleyville, tired of all the same restaurants on Clark street and in the mood for Thai: pop on over to Sheffield and Cornelia and try this place.

Coming from living in Seattle all of my life I have had my share of delicious authentic Thai food. Cozy is neither. I had the Bamee Noodles and another noodle dish with wontons delivered. The Bammee noodles was a cold lump of egg noodles stuck together with bar-b-que pork on  top and I, yes just 1 soggy fried wonton and 1 piece of fake crap. The dumpling noodle dish was also a disappointment as the egg noodles came separate from the tastless broth with dumplings. Inside the dumplings was a tasteless mash that we could not indentify. To top this off we used a coupon for free spring rolls and where still charged on our bill. Needless to say, we will not giving Cozy our business again. If you want cheap noodles alternative try Penny's.

I'm not too crazy about this place. I didn't really enjoy the food all that much, but I have to say that the waitstaff were friendly and attentive. But still, I'd rather spend my hard-earned cash elsewhere like Siam Noodle...forgot to mention that the owner (I believe she was the owner) had a bad attitude with a certain parking situation - reason for the two stars.... never going back!!!

probably my favorite place to eat in chicago! a fun atmosphere and great food. the staff here are so friendly and attentive that you can't not enjoy this place! oh, did i mention how cheap it is? and that it's byob? cozy's, i think i'm in love.

My favorite Thai joint ever. The tofu rama is so good I could eat it every day. The lunch specials are amazing and the food is always fast and hot. The toys are really fun and make for great camera-phone photos and the owners are super sweet. I've been going since they first opened and they remember me and my favorite stuff every time!

The food here is great.  I've only eaten in the restaurant twice, but lived off of their delivery when I was in the 'hood.  They've got a large selection of appetizers, salads and entrees, each of them being delightful morsels!  My favorite order was Cucumber salad, steamed Shu Mai (I know I butchered it!) and of course, Crab Rangoon!  YUM!

Inexpensive, great food, cute decor, and BYOB - how can you go wrong?   Since I live in the neighborhood I love it for takeout but I've had friends also recommend it as a great first date spot since it's intimate and you can bring your own wine/beer!  I love tofu pad thai (very unoriginal I know) and there's is great... I totally converted from Penny Noodles.  The fresh spring rolls are also delicious and if you're health concious are a great choice.

I've been going to this restaurant for the past two years and love it! I think they have the best thai food in the city and you simply cannot beat the prices. I also like that they do not use cilantro - some people like it, but I don't and many thai restaurants overuse this herb.

The kitchy decor is fun. Most of the time, my food is good.However they don't do a good job with my favorite Thai dish (Rama Chicken). Their peanut curry is watery! Ick. But their fresh spring rolls are excellent. If I want something really light to snack on, I'll pick those up to go.

A fun place to look and eat. The food here has been pretty good. I was impressed by the value, the staff, and the selection. Most things you can get vegetarian. Please, just sit me with my back towards Elvis. It makes me uncomfortable to look at him while I eat.

Ambiance is great at this place, smokes most of the trendy joints and does it cheaper and less fake. Bathrooms are probably the best decorated in town, even if they are some of the smallest as well. And you cant beat the elvis, nor the tables made from sewing machines. Food is some of the best Thai I have had in some time, there is always lulu's in evanston, but this place was darn amazing. I had the Lard Na, probably the best I have ever had, the noodles were still crispy, home made sauce, or at least better quality then most. Other great stuff was the bbq pork and brocolli. There was also a GREAT spicy basil chicken. And the prices are rock bottom for a good amount of food. We will definitely be back, kind of hope evanstons is as good since there would be more parking up there. That is one of the hinderances of this location, if you drive parking can be bad, its really hit or miss though.  Highly recommended restaurant, and only reason I went there was reading about it on Chicagoist.

They have awesome food here and it's so cute inside!  There are toys everywhere which is cool although I was a little creeped out by the enormous Barbie in the women's bathroom.  The place is small but I've never had to wait for a table.

This is a super cute restaurant with pretty good food.  The waitresses are nice enough, but kind of flighty.  The atmosphere is very cute and the restaurant is filled with old-fashion toys.  Definitely an experience and a place that I will go again!

While it may not be the fanciest or best Thai restaurant in the area, Cozy Noodle has charm and good food. Because their prices are very reasonable and they are BYOB, you can have a very full filling and inexpensive night out. The food, though not really very authentic, is really quite good. I would highly recommend this place; however, it is pretty small so on busy days or times it may be hard to get a table.

Cozys is a nice small thai place. Decor is really fun. Prices are inline with other thai places. Not a lot of seating, and sometimes it fills up.  Nothing really special about Cozy's food, but I have eaten there many times. Decor is probably the most interesting thing about this place.

I really enjoyed this cute little place. It was very unusual, and cozy. It was also BYOB with no corkage fee, and the meals (apps and entrees) were tasty, delivered at a reasonable time, and outragously inexpensive. My only complaint here is they advertise as having outdoor seating, but when I went, they said they didn't have a license for it, so we couldn't sit outside. Other than that, it was FAN -tab-u lous!

Love this place!!   The decor w/ all the toys is straight out of eBay!  Don't miss the Pez restrooms! The food is quick, very reasonably priced and delicious.  My menu favorites are the beef salad and pork w/ broccoli (forgot the exact name).  The fruit slushes are also fresh and delicious.  The only dish I don't love is the pad thai - I don't love the flavor. I go here all the time and it is highly recommended!

I absolutely LOVE Cozy Noodle & Rice.  First of all, the place is awesome - There are toys all along the walls and the bathrooms are completely covered with Pez dispensers.  Although in the Women's bathroom, there is a creepy doll that watches you as you pee... Otherwise, it's awesome!  The food is delicious and affordable (be sure to order some Crab Rangoon...Mmmmm...) and the staff are super friendly.  Everyone should go to Cozy!!

Stopped in here for a bubble tea and fell in love. Cheap and good. Loving the kitschy theme. Waitstaff friendly. Bathroom super clean even floor. I know because they don't have a baby changing table. That is why I give only 4 stars. Definitely go back for food.

Freakishly fast delivery but the golden noodles don't hold a candle to Joy's. The crab rangoon is delicious, though. I'd order from here again but I'll get pad thai or something.  Update: I tried the garlic chicken noodles and the won ton soup, both were yum. Upping Cozy to 4 stars.
