Toys, toys, toys and yummy Thai food!  What better combination is there?  I was sucked into Cozy when I saw my plastic SuperSaver circa 1982 chillin' in the window.  If it's good enough for SuperSaver, it's good enough for me.   I like bringing out-of-town guests to Cozy not only for their super low prices and great food, but for the sensory spectacle that makes this place so unique.  Sit at converted Singer sewing machine tables with mosaic tops, be distracted by all the cool old wind-up toys, robots and vintage radios, visit the Pez dispenser- and Barbie-covered bathrooms even if you don't have to use them and enjoy some very good Thai food.  Cozy has my vote for the #2 best crab rangoon in town, but has my favorite noodles panang--crispy wide rice noodles in a delish panang coconut curry with veggies and chicken (for me, at least).  Cozy also has bubble tea and while I am not exactly a big fan of it, I love encouraging my out-of-towners to try it, just to see their faces when they get that first glob of tapioca.  Hilarious. Cheap, delicious, entertaining (well, except for the Weather Channel running on the boob tube--so weird)--this place is fab.

I can't describe how much I love this place. The only thing that kills me is that it's nowhere near where I live.  That, and my OTHER favorite Thai BYOB is closer than this one and I should show more "neigborhood love" by reviewing it first. The food here is great, I haven't ordered a bad dish yet and I'm at the point of  "ordering at-random."  And it's super cheap.  Crab Rangoon (though a standard yawner on an appatizer) is fantastic here.  All the Curry here is great, Panang being my fav.  But, I gotta go with the Pad Se Ew, in which they make the flat noodles "crispy" instead of the classic, er... "floppy" style. The decor is awesome.  Lots of antique toys displayed, old-school radios, those weird Zen-Cat Statues that wave at you incessantly.   The bathrooms take that idea about eight steps further.... I won't ruin it for you.  The tables are converted bejeweled sewing tables whose bead designs also appear on the bricks outfront on the dining patio.  And there are robots.  Yes, they're are tinny robots everywhere.  Oh, robots. Service is mind boggilingly fast (probably becuase of the capactiy of the restaurant), and the servers are just as friendly.  Too friendly infact -- as we were standing waiting for a table once I got in this one gentleman's way at least 8 times, and he kept apologizing to ME.  They also didn't ask us to leave when there were a few tables finishing their BYOB's even thought the place was pretty much closed. It can get pretty crowded during peak dinner hours, which sucks for me, but I get excited knowing this 'lil place is doing such good business.

Best Thai food I've ever had. Every dish is delicious, the crab rangoon is so good that it changed my life. The restaurnat is BYOB with no wine corking fee, which is freakin' awesome.  It's also super cheap. The only downside I can think of is that in the summer if you sit outside the L is right there so that's loud... but if your conversation gets drowned out its ok because all you'll be talking about is how great the food is.
The service is great, food is really good.  The decor is somewhat of an acquired taste but it doesn't bother me much.

I love this Thai place! It's decorated very cute inside with tons of toys to look at. It's a very fun atmosphere. The food is relatively cheap and affordable too!  They had a really spicey chicken noodle dish I loved!

Went here recently for the first time and thought it was a lot of fun with delicious food and great atmosphere, the toys on the walls are a real kick! I thought the waitstaff was very friendly and unassuming. Only complaint I have is of the timing of the food preparation which left me with my entree while my girlfriend waited several more minutes for her's. Maybe they were sort of busy. Otherwise, go for some truly delicious food at this cool freakin restaurant.

This is the best Thai place in the city! ! They have an awesome lunch special, 11-3, which includes a main dish and a small appetizer, none are priced over $6. The walls are decorated with old collectible toys, and that bathrooms are covered as well. They usually mail out coupons for buy one get one free dinners too.
